dont play this terrible game. no matter how good you are at shooters or the effort you spend to learn the game you will never be better than the controller sweats who populate most of apex's playerbase, and who you will spend most of your game time playing against.

This is one of the cases where I wish there was a ‚Äúmeh‚Äù option. This is a great battle royal game. The Legends system allows you to select characters with unique abilities, which adds depth to the game's combat. Each legend encourages a different playstyle and affects your team's dynamic. The issue arises when you look into actually playing the game. This is an EA game, after all. The game has a lot of yanks that you will become familiar with as you play. Sometimes you join a game and stutter and rubber band so much that the game is unplayable, and you have to leave the match or restart the game to fix it. I've also encountered that the match will randomly throw you out, and if you are really lucky, you will be able to join back. There are also regularly game-breaking exploits. Over the time I've played, I've seen the ability to damage opponents in peaceful zones, not being able to damage, not being able to pick up weapons, shooting through walls, not taking storm damage, camping areas with kill timers without dying, not being able to revive teammates, and much more. These bugs depend on updates and maps, usually. And what you will experience the most, and usually every session, is getting kicked, rubberbanding, lagging, and generally server issues. But the worst thing about the game has to be the players, especially your own teammates. If you play fills, you will experience teammates splitting up from the team, especially if they aren't jump masters and want to go to a different place and then proceed to get themselves killed and eventually leave. But teammates leaving as soon as they get knocked down is the most common thing you will experience. You will actually be surprised if a teammate doesn't leave instantly. You will also become familiar with the different types of players and the characters
they usually play. The characters I experienced to be the most toxic and lacking in Team Corporation are by far players like Wraith, Octane, and Pathfinder. You will very rarely have one that both knows how to cooperate and is non-toxic, but again, this is something that will be a surprising event. This is a game you will have a love-hate relationship with.

I have never had another game quite like this, this game takes you for a joyride for the most heart pumping adrenaline rush feeling for a couple minutes of intense fights to the gut wrenching pure rage feeling that makes You want to write Santa and God a hate speech letter and break the foundation of Your house while looking at the damage report of the demon You just faced. Despite My absolute hate for this game there is a corner of my heart that will not let go of it and I keep coming back for this torturous cycle of adrenaline fuelled moments and pure rage and self loathe. If you haven't played this game yet please proceed with caution and only dip your toes in the waters. To end it all, Respawn, please leave EA and make the game less about money.

If you like a br game with a faster pace, apex is for you. Dying most of the time feels like a skill diff rather than just simply "his gun was better" type moment. Ranked is plagued by cheaters, but not too bad until the higher ranks. Overall I have fun with apex, and although I'm not great at it (Plat) it still feels enjoyable to play, rarely do I go a session where I get steamrolled the whole time.

You can not get a straight forward fight to save your life in this game.Its third party nonstop nonsense or you get bombarded by a random assortment of abilities that make fighting inside impossible and others that make it very hard to push outside or fighting in the open.This game is no longer a shooter and has been reduced to how well you can use character abilities and rotate while getting cheap free kills on teams that are distracted or are out of position.Not for people who enjoy gunplay.

I have been playing for over 5000 hours since APEX was released (Season 0). I quit this game because of the unbalanced aim assist. Even if I play at 100% of my aiming skill, I cannot defeat controller players mechanically. I would be happy to come back and play all day if the aim assist issue is fixed. I don't know how many years that will take, but I will just keep waiting, because playing this game with mouse and keyboard is just a waste of time. For the sake of my quality of life, I will play other games. I am sad to leave this game because I love APEX so much, but I have to uninstall it. Thank you APEX for teaching me how fun FPS games are... Goodbye, APEX...

Absolutely broken with the new season (21). Numerous graphical issues, servers are a dumpster fire where on my stable network connection we are constantly getting kicked out at the beginning of matches (seems like DDOS) and are getting network issues just as a firefight starts, main menu is unstable and is causing some of my friends to freeze the game completely and forcing them to restart, the quads mode seems incredibly rushed and had many minor problems (for example I can't see the health bar of the 3rd teammate as there is "press ENTER to chat" written over, should have been caught in testing) and there is so much else to say, but what's the point of that. And don't get me started on the blatant cheating we encounter on nearly daily basis.

TL:TR - buggy rushed mess that I do not recommend

This game is shockingly bad. Not from a gameplay standpoint but EVERYTHING ELSE.
- 50% of my matches have had people disconnect due to errors with the servers
- Occasionally some matches will have random people will just lag and rubber-band all over the place
- RANKED HAS THESE ISSUES. YOU CAN LOSE PROGRESS OVER A SERVER ISSUE.
- Netcode will often have you taking damage despite already being in cover
These are only the technical issues, there are so many more problems I could be writing a novel.
I absolutely adore the gameplay, its extremely fun when things work and I will see myself playing this game for hundreds of hours but my god its frustrating to have all these problems. Respawn and EA need to do something....

The game itself is good, but the matchmaking ruins it. If you're new you will get teamed up with people way better than you and you will have to fight people who grind this game for hours on end. And that also means that even if you keep playing and become good at the game you will get teamed up with people just starting out.

I am a 55 year old biker and trucker father, and probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son got this game for from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 12 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he let me borrow his controller. Me and my son then played in turns and I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game has helped build my relationship with my son back to how it was before he lost his mother.

Welcome to "Apex Legends," where dropping from a spaceship into a kill zone with 19 other squads is just another Tuesday. Choose your legend, each with their own quirks and abilities, from a robot who loves high-fives to a medic who‚Äôs always too optimistic. The game's fast-paced combat and strategic gameplay keep you on your toes, but beware of teammates who think "teamwork" means looting your kills.

The graphics are stunning, which is great because you'll spend a lot of time admiring the scenery while getting sniped from halfway across the map. The ping system is revolutionary‚Äîperfect for when you want to silently scream at your squad to stop being idiots.

While the frequent updates keep the game fresh, it also means constantly adapting to new metas and bugs. It's a chaotic dance of death that‚Äôs as exhilarating as it is infuriating. Ideal for those who enjoy a mix of strategy, chaos, and occasional moments of pure gaming bliss.

It's a shame, as this is a great and unique game that I loved. My evaluation is based on my experience of approximately 2000 hours of gameplay on Origin and 700 hours on Steam.

Unfortunately, a few things have ruined the game for me:

Aim Assist is too strong: According to R5, a modding and tracking community for the game, only 4 out of the top 1000 players are using mouse and keyboard. This reflects the in-game experience, where as a MnK player, you often get outperformed by most players. Controller players argue that MnK offers better movement, but statistics and the popularity of controllers clearly indicate an advantage for controllers.

The game is full of cheaters: A YouTuber named Zeus calculated the number of cheaters based on the number of players banned in ban waves. In ranked mode (the primary game mode), from gold rank and above, 1 out of 3 players you encounter is cheating with an aimbot or wallhack. Given that a squad consists of 3 players, you will almost always encounter a cheater.

Security issues in tournaments: Recently, hackers managed to manipulate servers and even injected cheats into pro players' accounts. Videos documenting these incidents can be found on YouTube. The server security is not 100% guaranteed.

Trust me when I say, it's not worth picking up this game until EA fixes the aim assist and the cheating problems. It‚Äôs not fun, it will make you angry, and you won't enjoy playing it.

With Apex Legends being one of the prime free battle royals of the last decade, they didn't get this position by mere chance. With Titanfall being the IP this game is set in, the weapons and set pieces make it a very familiar title to those that have played the previous games. The gun-play and movement are fun, fast-paced and clean for those who enjoy longer TTK shooters. With any multiplayer game it does have some issues with balancing characters but for the most part the devs keep it mostly under control (This is only my personal experience). While playing with friends is the best way to go, I have enjoyed plenty of solo sessions as well. At the end of the day this is a battle royal through and through, so from its core there is nothing super unique about the game from that aspect. However the Legends and game play keep it above the seemingly endless sea for free-2-play BR's out there on the market. Whether you enjoy shooters from a casual perspective or you enjoy a test of skill. Whether you are seeking a trio to win or go after self-glory, this game has plenty to offer.

I really wish I did not have to deal with the cheaters, 80% controller community, and horrid servers causing latency, audio, etc. I have watched the rise and now fall of this incredible game.

There really isn't a shooter out there quite like this one. I have tried them all. Yes, I know....we have Titanfall and yes...I go back and play on it from now and again. I just really love the "hero" part of Apex and the complexity of how a game pans out differently quite often.

I really want to encourage new players to play.

I find it hard to recommend it at the current state. Maybe you will enjoy it and I am happy for you. I enjoy it sometimes....often times the people who take it too serious (Controller Zen/XIM) ESP, Radar, aimbotters) literally ruin this game for those who are legit competitors. I am nearing the end of my time on FPS I believe. The cheaters have ruined it for everyone. Thanks a lot to you guys. Well done. Hats off and enjoy your digital banner that means literally nothing in the real world. I hate that I have to take away the multiplayer aspect of playing with the homies because cheating is rampant in any competitive fps.

Whatever....I am just rambling now....keep making those cosmetics EA so you can milk this cash cow dry and toss it to the edge like you have done with all your other projects. Keep saying F*&^ the true supporters and enthusiasts who wanted the game to get better. Not like they love this game and have shown you that.....

Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to Apex Legends, where the only thing hotter than the dropship's engines are the fiery emotions you'll experience. Consider this your content warning: This game may cause spontaneous outbursts of joy, frustration-induced laughter, and an insatiable urge to shout "Bamboozled!" at the top of your lungs.

Let's start with the adrenaline rush, because Apex Legends hits harder than a Gibraltar ult. From the moment you drop into the map like a caffeinated superhero, every second is a rollercoaster of emotions. One minute you're looting like a pro, the next you're getting third-partied faster than you can say "respawn beacon."

And speaking of legends, let's talk about the characters. They're more diverse than a buffet at a food festival, each with their own quirks and abilities. Whether you're ziplining with Pathfinder or setting traps with Caustic, there's a legend for every playstyle and a personality to match. And don't even get me started on Mirage ‚Äì the guy's ego is bigger than the loot vaults on Olympus.

Now, let's address the weapons. They're the real stars of the show, turning every firefight into a symphony of chaos and carnage. From snipers that hit like a meteor to shotguns that make enemies regret ever leaving their hiding spots, choosing your loadout is like picking your favorite flavor of mayhem.

But it's not all sunshine and respawn beacons in Apex Legends. Let's talk about the moments that make you question your life choices ‚Äì like falling off a cliff because you got too cocky with Octane's jump pad, or realizing too late that your teammate's idea of strategy is throwing grenades at their own feet.

And let's not forget the ping system ‚Äì a masterpiece of communication that allows you to scream "enemy here!" without actually screaming. It's the lifeline that keeps squads together, even when you're spread out across the map like a disorganized game of hide-and-seek.

In conclusion, Apex Legends is a whirlwind romance with chaos, where every match is a chance to prove your skills and test your sanity. Approach with caution, embrace the highs and lows, and remember: Even when the loot gods are against you, there's always another dropship waiting. Final rating: 8 out of 10, because in the world of Apex Legends, the only thing predictable is the unpredictable.

Step into the chaotic world of Apex Legends, where friendships are forged, victories are snatched, and epic fails are imminent! This game is like a rollercoaster ride - one minute you're flying high on a respawn beacon, and the next, you're face-first in a pile of loot with no ammo.

The legends in this game are as diverse as your sock collection - some are super cool, some are a bit quirky, and some will make you question your life choices. But that's the beauty of it! Where else can you see a robot, a soldier, and a ninja fight side by side for that sweet, sweet victory?

The loot system is like a box of chocolates - you never know what you're gonna get. Will it be a shiny new weapon or a Mozambique that's just waiting to disappoint you? Embrace the randomness, my friends, and learn to love the loot, no matter how trollish it may be.

Apex Legends is not just a game; it's a wild, unpredictable adventure that will have you laughing, crying, and screaming into your mic in equal measure. So grab your squad, jump into the arena, and get ready for a crazy ride through this battleground of madness and mayhem! See you in the ring, legends!

I believe there's an issue with SBMM. To clarify, EA does not design SBMM and EOMM for player benefit, but rather to maximize its profits by maintaining player engagement. These systems match players against opponents of varying skill levels to stimulate prolonged play through psychological triggers, which is a well-documented phenomenon. Furthermore, they can pair players with skilled teammates who have purchased cosmetic items (skins) to create a false sense of improvement, potentially leading to more micro-transaction sales. They may even adjust matchmaking after purchase to maintain your interest. In essence, SBMM and EOMM are tools to maximize developer profits, where the game 'plays' the player.

Own a musket for home defense, since that's what the founding fathers intended. Four ruffians break into my house. "What the devil?" As I grab my powdered wig and Kentucky rifle. Blow a golf ball sized hole through the first man, he's dead on the spot. Draw my pistol on the second man, miss him entirely because it's smoothbore and nails the neighbors dog. I have to resort to the cannon mounted at the top of the stairs loaded with grape shot, "Tally ho lads" the grape shot shreds two men in the blast, the sound and extra shrapnel set off car alarms. Fix bayonet and charge the last terrified rapscallion. He Bleeds out waiting on the police to arrive since triangular bayonet wounds are impossible to stitch up. Just as the founding fathers intended.

Ma'am, that is an eleven pound whole slab of deli ham. It has no bones, fat, or connective tissue. It is an amalgamation of the meat of several pigs, emulsified, liquefied, strained, and ultimately inexorably joined in an unholy meat obelisk. God had no hand in the creation of this abhorrence. The fact that this ham monolith exists proves that God is either impotent to alter His universe or ignorant to the horrors taking place in his kingdom. This prism of pork is more than deli meat. It is a physical declaration of mankind's contempt for the natural order. It is hubris manifest. We also have a lower sodium variety if you would prefer that.

Nobody will read this review, but here's the recipe and instructions for a classical chocolate brownie.

Ingredients
1/2 cup (115g) unsalted butter
1 cup (200g) granulated sugar
2 large eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/3 cup (40g) unsweetened cocoa powder
1/2 cup (65g) all-purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon baking powder

Instructions
1. Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease an 8x8-inch baking pan or line it with parchment paper.
2. Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract.
3. Add the dry ingredients: Stir in cocoa powder, flour, salt, and baking powder until the batter is well combined.
4. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and spread it evenly.
5. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the brownies begin to pull away from the sides of the pan and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs.
6. Cool in the pan on a wire rack before cutting into squares.
Enjoy your delicious homemade brownies!

Apex Legends has been a major letdown due to several critical issues. The aggressive aim assist for controllers gives an unfair advantage over mouse and keyboard players, ruining the competitive balance. The game is infested with cheaters and hackers, with little to no action taken against them despite numerous reports, making almost every other match unfair and frustrating. Additionally, the server performance is consistently poor, with frequent disconnects, high latency, and crashes, especially during ranked matches. To top it off, the developers seem more focused on releasing high-priced cosmetics instead of addressing these fundamental problems. These issues severely hinder the overall experience, and until they are addressed, I cannot recommend this game.

The state of the game is simply appalling, anti-cheat feels non existent and I have no faith that anything has been done over the last couple of years. The problem has only gotten worse.

Challenging particularly for the less young amongst us but very rewarding once you get 50h+ invested in understanding how to take a fight.
I really enjoy the graphics, the rythm and the general forgiveness the game has after taking a bad fight, allowing revivals as long as one man is still standing. The pressure is increasing as the circle shrinks and some fantastic clutches make you feel like a hero.
The casual game modes are great and engaging too - particularly 3 strokes
The short format is ideal for fast in and out session of gaming.

A year and a half of events, buying store items and having good fun with friends. But then one day I log in to find everything gone - no items, no progression, the game straight up treats me like I've never played before.
EA Help was useless. Nothing I could do on my end.

You want a fun but frustrating BR game with tight FPS mechanics? This is it.

You want a multiplayer live service game that is stable to run, doesn't want you to spend money to access the Legends, keep your game data safe and has good server connection?

THIS IS DEFINITELY NOT IT.

Every time Respawn messes with their servers/accounts there's the chance you'll lose everything you worked hard for, in a game that constantly wants you to grind. Think on that next time you see a shiny item in the store.

Apex Legends: A Rollercoaster of Fun with Some Bumps

Apex Legends burst onto the battle royale scene with a bang, offering intense squad-based gameplay and a refreshing take on the genre. From the get-go, the game's fast-paced action and unique character abilities made it a standout choice for gamers seeking a break from the more traditional battle royale experiences.

The game was super fun right from the start. The thrill of dropping into Kings Canyon or World's Edge with a squad of diverse legends, each with their own abilities, added layers of strategy and excitement. Whether you were coordinating with teammates to secure a coveted drop zone or clutching a victory in the final firefight, every match brought its own adrenaline rush.

However, not all was perfect in the Apex Games. The removal of the Arena mode, which offered a more condensed and tactical experience, was a sore point for many players, including myself. The decision to streamline the game to focus solely on battle royale matches left a gap for those who enjoyed quicker, more intimate skirmishes. This change contributed to the feeling that the game got old fast and became repetitive over time.

Moreover, while Apex Legends introduced innovative mechanics like sliding and character-specific ultimates, some aspects of the game's mechanics felt clunky or unrefined. Hit registration issues and inconsistent server performance occasionally marred otherwise thrilling gameplay sessions, leading to frustrating moments that detracted from the overall experience.

Despite these drawbacks, Apex Legends continues to evolve. New legends, weapons, and map updates keep the game fresh, and the community remains engaged with regular events and challenges. The developers' commitment to listening to player feedback and implementing changes has been commendable, ensuring that Apex Legends retains its place as a top contender in the battle royale genre.

In conclusion, Apex Legends is undeniably a super fun game with its high-energy battles and unique character-driven gameplay. However, the removal of Arena mode, coupled with the game's tendency to feel repetitive, and occasional mechanical issues, prevents it from achieving true greatness. Nonetheless, for players seeking a fast-paced battle royale experience with a wealth of tactical options, Apex Legends remains a solid choice despite its flaws.

Review of Apex Legends
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | A Solid Battle Royale with Exciting Gameplay, but Room for Improvement

Apex Legends, developed by Respawn Entertainment and published by Electronic Arts, burst onto the battle royale scene in 2019 with its unique blend of fast-paced action, character abilities, and team-based gameplay. While the game offers an exciting and fresh take on the genre, it also faces challenges that affect its overall experience. Here‚Äôs a look at the strengths and weaknesses of Apex Legends:

Pros:

1. Dynamic and Fast-Paced Gameplay:
One of the standout features of Apex Legends is its dynamic and fast-paced gameplay. The movement mechanics, including sliding, climbing, and zip-lining, offer a fluid and exhilarating experience that sets it apart from other battle royale games. The game‚Äôs focus on mobility and quick engagements makes each match feel action-packed and engaging, catering to players who enjoy a more aggressive and fast-moving style of play.

2. Unique and Diverse Legends:
The game features a roster of diverse characters known as Legends, each with unique abilities and playstyles. This variety allows players to choose a Legend that suits their preferred approach, whether it‚Äôs aggressive combat, support, or strategic play. The abilities add an extra layer of strategy and teamwork, encouraging players to coordinate and leverage their Legends‚Äô strengths effectively.

3. Team-Based Focus and Communication:
Apex Legends emphasizes team-based gameplay, with squads of three working together to secure victory.* The game‚Äôs innovative ping system allows for intuitive and effective communication, even without voice chat. Players can mark enemies, loot, and locations, making it easier to coordinate and plan strategies. This focus on teamwork fosters a sense of camaraderie and collaboration, enhancing the overall gameplay experience.

4. High-Quality Graphics and Audio:
The game boasts high-quality graphics and audio design, providing an immersive and visually appealing experience. The detailed environments, vibrant colors, and smooth animations contribute to the game‚Äôs aesthetic appeal. The sound design, including weapon effects and character voice lines, adds depth and immersion, helping players stay aware of their surroundings and engage more effectively in combat.

Cons:

1. Limited Map Variety and Repetitive Gameplay:
Despite its engaging mechanics, Apex Legends can suffer from a lack of map variety and repetitive gameplay. While the available maps are well-designed and offer diverse environments, the game would benefit from more frequent updates and new locations to keep the experience fresh. Over time, the repetition of the same maps and gameplay loop can lead to a sense of monotony for long-term players.

2. Inconsistent Matchmaking and Balancing:
Matchmaking and balancing issues can impact the overall enjoyment of Apex Legends. Players may encounter matches with uneven skill levels, leading to frustrating experiences where beginners face off against highly skilled opponents. Additionally, the balancing of Legends and weapons can sometimes feel inconsistent, with certain characters or loadouts dominating the meta and limiting strategic diversity.

3. Progression System and Monetization Concerns:
The game‚Äôs progression system and monetization model have drawn criticism from some players. While Apex Legends is free-to-play, its in-game currency and loot box system can feel overly reliant on microtransactions. The grind for cosmetics and Legend unlocks may seem excessive to those unwilling to spend money, potentially impacting the sense of reward and progression.

4. Occasional Technical Issues:
Technical issues, including server instability and occasional bugs, can detract from the overall experience. Players may encounter lag, connection drops, or other performance problems, especially during peak times or major updates. These issues can disrupt gameplay and lead to frustration, particularly in a game where split-second decisions and smooth performance are crucial.

Conclusion:
Apex Legends offers an exciting and innovative take on the battle royale genre, with dynamic gameplay, unique characters, and a strong focus on team-based action. However, the game also faces challenges with limited map variety, balancing issues, and a monetization model that may not appeal to everyone. While Apex Legends provides a solid and enjoyable experience for fans of fast-paced shooters, it has room for improvement to enhance its long-term appeal and address the concerns of its player base.

If you‚Äôre looking for a fresh and fast-paced battle royale with a focus on teamwork and character abilities, Apex Legends delivers a solid experience that‚Äôs worth trying. Enjoy the thrill of fluid movement, diverse Legends, and engaging combat, but be prepared for some areas where the game could still grow and evolve.

Apex Legends, developed by Respawn Entertainment and published by Electronic Arts, is a free-to-play battle royale game that has taken the gaming world by storm since its surprise release in February 2019. Set in the Titanfall universe, Apex Legends combines fast-paced action with unique character abilities, offering a fresh take on the battle royale genre. This review explores the game's core mechanics, characters, graphics, and overall impact on the competitive gaming scene.

Gameplay:
Apex Legends excels in delivering a smooth, dynamic, and strategic battle royale experience, distinguishing itself from other games in the genre.

Core Mechanics: Players form squads of three and compete against 19 other squads to be the last team standing. The game features a well-designed map with diverse terrains, encouraging strategic planning and adaptability. Movement is fluid and responsive, with an emphasis on agility and parkour.

Legend Abilities: One of Apex Legends' standout features is its roster of unique characters, known as "Legends," each with distinct abilities and playstyles. These abilities add a layer of strategy and team composition, making every match feel different and encouraging cooperative play.

Weapons and Equipment: The game offers a wide variety of weapons and equipment, each with distinct characteristics and uses. Players must find and manage their gear effectively, balancing offensive and defensive capabilities to survive.

Graphics and Performance:
Apex Legends boasts impressive visuals and performance, providing an immersive and smooth gaming experience.

Visuals: The game features vibrant, detailed graphics that bring the sci-fi world of the Outlands to life. The character designs are distinctive, and the environments are rich with color and texture, making each match visually appealing.

Performance: Respawn Entertainment has optimized Apex Legends to run smoothly on a variety of systems. The game maintains a stable frame rate, and while occasional server issues and bugs can occur, these are generally addressed quickly through updates.

Atmosphere and Design:
The atmospheric design of Apex Legends contributes significantly to its appeal, combining elements of sci-fi and action in a compelling way.

World Building: The game is set in the Titanfall universe, and while it doesn't feature Titans, it incorporates lore and elements from the series. The map, Kings Canyon, and subsequent maps like World's Edge and Olympus, are intricately designed with a blend of natural and futuristic elements.

Sound Design: The sound design is excellent, with clear audio cues that are crucial for gameplay. Footsteps, gunfire, and character abilities are well-balanced, providing players with the necessary information to make strategic decisions.

Community and Support:
Apex Legends has built a strong community and continues to receive substantial support from its developers.

Community Engagement: The game has a vibrant community, with active players, streamers, and content creators contributing to its popularity. Respawn Entertainment frequently engages with the community through social media, forums, and in-game events.

Developer Support: Regular updates, seasonal events, and new content keep the game fresh and exciting. Each season introduces new Legends, weapons, and map changes, ensuring that players always have something new to explore.

Longevity:
Apex Legends has proven to have lasting appeal, thanks to its engaging gameplay and regular updates.

Replayability: High. The dynamic nature of each match, combined with the evolving content and strategic depth, ensures that players can enjoy countless hours of gameplay. The ranked mode also adds a competitive edge for those seeking to test their skills.

Future Prospects: With continued support and a growing player base, Apex Legends is poised to remain a major player in the battle royale genre. Its innovative mechanics and strong community engagement promise a bright future.

Conclusion:
Apex Legends is a standout title in the battle royale genre, offering a unique blend of fast-paced action, strategic depth, and engaging character abilities. Its vibrant world, smooth performance, and regular updates ensure it remains fresh and exciting for both new and returning players.

Pros:

Fast-paced, fluid gameplay
Unique and diverse character abilities
Vibrant and detailed graphics
Strong community and developer support
High replayability with regular updates and new content
Cons:

Occasional server issues and bugs
Steep learning curve for new players
Some balance issues with Legends and weapons
Final Verdict:
Apex Legends delivers an exhilarating and strategic battle royale experience that stands out in a crowded genre. Its combination of unique character abilities, dynamic gameplay, and strong community support make it a must-play for fans of competitive shooters. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned veteran of battle royale games or a newcomer, Apex Legends offers an engaging and rewarding experience that‚Äôs hard to put down.

This game makes me as a players perceive loot boxes positively as they are given for free. As I played and acquired new, shiny items from these free loot boxes, my adrenaline spiked to its peak. Then, I found myself entertaining the idea that purchasing loot boxes in other games wouldn't be as bad of a deal, as it would grant me the opportunity to experience similar adrenaline rush.

Then I heard someone calling me. "Hey, you. You're finally awake." I looked up and saw a man talking to me. I‚Äôve seen him somewhere before. Ahh! F***, it's Ralof! I instinctively looked to my right and saw Ulfric. Finally, my chance has come to be Isekai'd , and gave myself an internal fist pump. As I was monologuing, I heard another voice. Jolted, I saw my mom grinning at me. "Are you done daydreaming again about getting Isekai'd? " No, absolutely not, I was just writing review of Apex legends.

I really love to hop on and play some apex, as I have a decent amount of time in it. But, the current state of the game is rough to just hop on and have a casual experience. I typically play ranked and across all levels it's filled with nothing but absolute sweats who tryhard on everything. The ranking system goes as rookie, bronze, silver, gold, platinum, diamond, masters and apex predator. I've always gotten around the high silver to mid gold level. It seems the only people that are around the rank I am at are the people that are in the high ranks but are quickly making their way through the lower ranks. So all my teammates are in diamond/masters and shouldn't be in my silver/gold lobbies. They are leagues better than me and expect me to perform at their level but I've never and will never be that high in rank. If you miss a single shot and don't instantly get the knock you get yelled at by teammates for being absolute trash and an awful teammate. I would hop into trios, which isn't ranked, but about every other game I have someone who leaves early game because they got knocked. Not even killed yet but just instantly leave the moment they get downed and I can revive them back up. I'm glad they added solos in the game for season 21 so it gives all those people a playlist to be instead of just dropping on a random part of the map with abandoning your two other teammates.

The core gameplay of the game is really fun. It's always felt nice to drop in and grab gear. To level up your shield and get new abilities and I think it's a good update for the game. But, another thing is movement in the game. If you don't master the movement techs out there people will still call you trash and an awful teammate. "bro why didn't you superglide into a tapstrafe to hit the wall bounce?? Don't get in my party again asswipe" is sometimes what I hear and it's rough. I had someone leave my discord call, unfriend me AND block me because I didn't perform well in a duo game. Not even ranked and it was just a casual duo game. That's your average teammate at this point. I used to have friends who played this game but they all have dropped out because of how toxic and sweaty every game is. Which I completely understand. You have to be perfect with everything or else you just get bodied. So now I'm the only one left in the friend group so I have to resort to randoms and hope they are relatively chill people. At this point I almost don't even use voicechat because I'm constantly getting barraged with over the top callouts and then getting yelled at for not hitting 100% of my shots.

Overall I will always love apex for it's gameplay and movement. It's just the random teammates I get is what ruins the game for me. I'm not the best at movement but I learn just enough to have some basic fun with it. Nothing too crazy. I just can't play the game in long sessions anymore because of the constant toxic random people I get. All the casuals have left the game and the only players left are the really really good ones who play this game 10 hours a day and make it their damn full time job. If you don't have 20 kill badge, 4k badge and 5000 kills with your character then you're considered a pleb and unwanted by any teammates. Not sure if they can ever fix the issue of horrible bm that comes with players as that's not the games fault and it's just the natural state of the game by it's players. I would like to leave this as a positive review but the whole point of a game is to play it and have fun. I no longer have a lot of fun playing this game with it's current state. I just hop on for an hour once a week to get that crave of what Apex used to be. I'm mid af at the game and will always be. Some people just can't seem to grasp that everyone isn't top 500 in their region. I never write reviews for games but I just have a lot to say about this game. It used to be a fun game to casually hop on with friends. Now it's a sea of nothing but top tier players and makes it damn near impossible for a new player to start. Hope someone finds the review helpful

Why would you ever play this? Yet another cash grab battle royal.

EA forces the developers to focus on everything but the changes/fixes that would actually make the game better/more enjoyable. I have been a fan of respawn since the first titanfall, I've poured countless hours on origin, steam, and console, I think last I checked it was over a years worth, I have made it to the highest ranks, I have played in tournaments, and I can truly say that this game does have something special at its core that no other game can replicate, but it is plagued with so many other issues (biggest of which is blatant cheaters) that make this game not enjoyable. At this point I play because I feel like I have to since I've grinded so much of my 20's away to this game. If you are thinking about picking it up for the first time, don't, if you are thinking about grinding for pred, don't, if you are thinking about playing tournaments, don't. There are definitely games out there that care much more about their player base, I for one think for the battle royale genre, fortnite actually sets the milestone for what developers and a company should do for their fans. Anyways don't end up like me, I have wasted a lot of time, and lost time with people I care about that I will never get back because of my addiction to this game.

Disappointing Performance in Apex Legends

Apex Legends has been a highly anticipated game for many, but unfortunately, it hasn't lived up to expectations for me due to severe performance issues.

Game Doesn't Run Smoothly

From the moment I launched the game, I experienced significant lag and stuttering. Despite having a system that meets the recommended requirements, Apex Legends runs poorly, with frequent frame rate drops and occasional freezes. This makes it incredibly difficult to enjoy the fast-paced action the game promises.

Unoptimized Experience

It's clear that Apex Legends is not well-optimized. The game's graphics and effects, while impressive, seem to come at the cost of performance stability. Even on lower settings, the game struggles to maintain a consistent frame rate. This lack of optimization is frustrating and takes away from the overall gaming experience.

Final Thoughts

While Apex Legends has potential with its unique gameplay and mechanics, the current state of the game is disappointing due to its poor performance. Until these issues are addressed and the game is properly optimized, I cannot recommend it.

An unplayable experience marred by performance issues.

As of season 21 I cannot recomend this game for anyone, either a casual player who jumps in for a few games a week to have fun or somebody who playes ranked. I'll list all the pros and cons of this gameand will rank them form the most important to less.
CONS:
20 tick servers - havent played from day 1 but still played this game a lot, 1600h is I think enough to say some things but from the moment I played ive got too much situations where Im behind cover and the enemy kills me or the other way around, mobile games have that kind of servers, but a multi bilion dollar game to have servers worse even than R6 - a game released in 2015, personaly I dont think the hardware is that expensive to upgrade for one of the biggest games, idk how "pros" play this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• on turnaments but it's unbereable.

Ranked - Im not that good, just avrage but for me to grind 100h twice so 200h (or more) just to get a charm a badge and or a FRAME that will dissapear in 1 or 2 seasons, not worth it, the sbmm and other matchmaking systems are tragic for a RANKED system, making it to a level 20 is easy so you can get many smurfs in low lobbies just for them to "have fun" killing noobs, reported many of them, I don't think there should be that much of them. The system literary punishes you if you get high kill game on ranked and just want to get aout of the rank fast. Devs can't decide how to make it good and it changes every season so you have to get used to it every 3 moths. The split is unnecesary and just adds to grind.

Matchmaking and SBMM - either nonexistent or so tight that it's unbereable, the game mostly pairs you with players who have many times more kills and than youre whole account on one legend, ranks way higher than you and above all, skill level so high that you can just stand and loose the match becaouse if he just sees you then you are dead. A new player who can shoot somewhat good from other games but with no knowlege of the game (healing system, rotations, red weapon system etc) can be put against a player who knows every line of code of the game so the first few games are on bots and the rest of the account games are hell.

Antycheat or rather it's nonexistence, I dont think there were any bans which where not manual made by a human, the game has cheaters and smurfs (Respawn, if you give an option for reporting smurfs than why not use it?) nowdays it's easier to reoprt someone for swearing on vc or text to get them banned then for accual aimbot or wh hacks. there are easy solutions for all of them but nothing is being done.

Devs listening to pros which make not even 5% of the player base rather than the whole community. It's all becaouse o money, the pros can just cry someone is weak and puf , devs bufgf that legend, or the RARE weapon, max 2 on the whole match is too op so let's just nerf it and now the common weapon is just as powerfull as the rare so why pick rare whith limitted ammo. But if the community wants to have anything, them so begins the russina roulette if devs will even CONSIDER doing it.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.


Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Honestly its a really well designed game that has great movement and gun fighting aspects, plus for the price you cant really beat it either. There will be times when the matchmaking seems super unfair and you get stuck with potato aim teammates that do nothing but raise your blood pressure whilst fighting against other fairly good players stacked together but that is usually the case with all competitive FPS games. The legends are all well designed and the game is constantly receiving balance and QOL updates which is lovely and quite welcome. I would say this is a great game for anyone who has some friends they want to play a fun little shooter with, or even anyone who wants to get sweaty and play super competitively it has options for everyone. There is an anti cheat system in play However, I do still encounter a fair bit of people with very questionable aim/movement that when spectated are almost certainly cheating. As anyone who frequently plays FPS games knows there is no avoiding the Maidenless losers in games like this so no need to be too shocked about it when it happens, just chalk it up to not enough hugs from mommy as a kid and move on.

As a consumer, the game feels severely busted and in mad frustrating probably 75% of the time. The audio issues, the fair matchmaking issues, the balancing, the nerfing--it's all pretty annoying, especially because Respawn seems to cater to the pros (from my experience, being someone who keeps up with the esport) and nerfs legends/guns based on the pro scene and what is in meta. Feels like they're consistently "fixing" random things, which leads to more random bugs (Ex. Revenant reborn's broken af, OP af debut. My god. That was so miserable. Bro was immune to dying that split)

- Forced input cross-play on PC is annoying. I'd like to play with other MnK players (even tho we are a dying breed), but I don't think this'll ever happen considering most ppl play on roller these days, from what I understand.

- AA makes some switch to roller. Don't think it's necessary to do that, but it's frustrating that players feel like they have to switch in order to feel like they can just play pubs lol the pro scene is flooded with rollers now, too, so that definitely influences the AA linear lifestyle

- Matchmaking is WHACK. Most common badges I see these days are masters/pred badges, coupled with either one 20-bomb and the 4k badge, or two 20-bomb badges. Those badges are EVERYWHERE. They're supposed to be amongst the hardest badges to get, but they're literally EVERYWHERE. Can't remember the last time I saw a normie gold or plat badge

- THE CHEATERS BRO. WHAT THE HELL. 30% OF MASTERS/PREDS WERE BANNED BC THEY WERE CHEATING. Bros get to level 500+ and then MAYBE get caught?? How is easy anti-cheat that easy to cheat?? I'm so confused!! I'm so tired!!

Anyway TL;DR I'm stuck in a toxic relationship with this game and even though it has charming legends and fun mechanics, other stuff out of my control gets in the way and makes the game less fun, whether it be weak servers, cheaters, bad matchmaking, weird bugs, etc. I'm 1.2k hrs deep, so I'll probably keep going as F2P, but I wouldn't recommend this to new players unless you're already a BR-enjoyer and/or enjoy a soulsborne-flavoured, curb-stomping, grind experience that will probably make you rage until you pull off one cool clutch and get a good spike of dopamine to keep you hooked

Was fun until all it became was a money grab. Streamers are the only ones who are listened to when it comes to changes and adjustments towards balancing issues, legend balancing, SBMM and ranked. Of course the company would listen to them, but what about the majority of its player base? No i'm not your "Casual" player, i have been invested in this game since season 4 and have played it off and on, i'm a hard stuck diamond since i only solo cue and half my teammates have no game sense. Back on topic with the issues that still persist,

1. The audio is trash with all the noise clutter, you can hear fighting from across the map and lava bubbling but as soon as someone is right behind me licking my taint they just catch me off guard and its a rinse and repeat cycle of how i end up back in the lobby.

2. The servers are GARBAGE, i pay for half a gig internet speed but i'm always having server issues on the west coast, they literally run off a toaster connected to a lemon which is then powdered by a hamster whose dead body momentum is keeping the wheel turning.

But instead of addressing the issues they decide to come out with more "mythics" which already have a stupid low drop chance unless you pay around $200 for one of the events. And get this, they re-colored the mythics for certain characters but if you already OWN one you have to wait until you get the shards for the different color variant... Like why? If i already own the base model how come i cant just spend credits or crafting shards for the different color? Maybe a level grind to unlock it so i actually have something to look forward to and keep me engaged in this god awful game. Some mythic skins have dive trials and others don't, Its a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• show of a concept. But yet i keep coming back because the sound of cracking someone tickles my pea sized brain. Its a love hate relationship that later on turns abusive. Do what you will with this information, but the frustration is real.

3. SBMM/Ranked. I don't even know where to start with the ranked scene, half the people who solo queue just decided to rush into ranked and not take the time to understand movement, positional advantages, AIMING AND HITTING YOUR SHOTS FOR GOD SAKE and how each legend works. What really adds icing onto the cake is while you are having to tolerate your teammates you're also put against a 3 stack pred team. Like why? Why do i have a silver and gold on my team while having to deal with preds in a platinum lobby.

Also stop coming out with event skins that players can buy at a reduced price, I thought the events were supposed event oriented not rewash material. Fix your game EA or at least come out with titanfall 3. Either way it would probably be another title you kill completely.

Gameplay and Mechanics
Apex Legends is undeniably a fantastic game. Its fast-paced, team-based battle royale format keeps the adrenaline pumping from the moment you drop onto the map. The unique abilities of each Legend add a layer of strategy and depth, making every match dynamic and exciting. The graphics are stunning, and the game runs smoothly, offering a highly immersive experience.

Community Feedback and Developer Response
However, despite the excellent gameplay, the way the developers handle community feedback is a major downside. Players have voiced numerous concerns and suggestions over the years, but it often feels like these fall on deaf ears. The lack of responsiveness to community desires can be frustrating, as many feel that the game could be significantly improved if the developers listened more to player feedback.

Cheating and Matchmaking Issues
Cheating is another significant issue that detracts from the overall experience. While it's common to encounter exceptionally skilled players, there are times when it‚Äôs clear that cheaters are ruining the game. The current anti-cheat measures are inadequate, and this ongoing problem severely impacts the enjoyment and fairness of the game.

Matchmaking, especially in ranked play, is also problematic. Being placed in matches with players of vastly different skill levels, such as queuing as a Gold rank and being paired with a Diamond player, creates a huge imbalance. This can be disheartening and frustrating, as it often leads to matches that feel unwinnable and unfair.

Conclusion
In summary, Apex Legends is a great game with exciting mechanics and engaging gameplay. However, it is let down by poor management, inadequate response to community feedback, and persistent issues with cheating and matchmaking. The developers need to address these problems to enhance the player experience and maintain the game's long-term appeal. If they can fix the anti-cheat system and improve matchmaking, Apex Legends has the potential to be one of the best games in its genre. For now, it's a good game that‚Äôs unfortunately held back by some significant flaws.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.


Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

this game was a gem years ago, seasons 1-6 were honestly a blast, game felt refreshing and there was a larger player base so you weren't put up with people on the top if you weren't on the top

It started going downhill on season 7, The content was great, sure, but the player base started to dwindle.
Somewhere around season 11-12, things hit the fan and you started seeing 3 stack predators in *Normal Lobbies*. i think this was something they did with ranked.
it hasn't really recovered, the game has gotten stale, respawn is a shell of what it used to be.

If your looking for a shooter, I reckon to say that this isn't a good place to start.
I have tried multiple times to get back into this game following season 12, but to no avail. Each session was just met with more and more frustration as me and my friends (arguably middle golds) were consistently matched against high diamonds, masters, and the occasional predators, in both ranked and unranked.
"Skill based matchmaking" is no longer a solid thing, I'm afraid. and you cant improve if you get gunned down the moment somebody sees you.

That, and EA/Respawn have been shifting more and more away from "interesting gameplay" and more and more into "recycled content to sell more skins" Ontop of butchering existing and established ideas to be "politically correct"

In short, TRASH GAME
The addiction becomes too much, avoid the pain and suffering and don't play it

Great game plagued by devs who force players to play ungodly amounts if they want to climb ranked. In this game you can win 10 out of 10 placement matches... and even though lets say you were diamond the previous season... this dumb ass game will put your ass in SILVER... It is designed not to put you in your correct rank division but rather to force the player-base to grind in order to keep players busy chasing something they already achieved.. By the way the game only gives you 3 months to rank up.. ( it used to be 1.5 months LMAO). By the time you climb back to your previous season peak, you will only have a couple weeks to try and reach past it... truly a flawed pathetic rank system and schedule. For comparison- I just finished this seasons placement matches in League of Legends. Last season I ended at platinum 2. After my 5 placement games, league put me back at platinum 3. The contrast is insane. Also- after not playing this game like four-six months it will degrade you down to ROOKIE... this game is a joke. It should be considered illegal to manipulate player hours the way they do. Pathetic.

"Apex Legends" stands out as a great game due to its innovative gameplay mechanics, diverse characters, and strategic depth. The game features a unique blend of battle royale and hero shooter elements, allowing players to choose from a roster of "Legends," each with distinct abilities that encourage team synergy and tactical planning. The fluid movement system, including sliding and zip-lining, adds a dynamic layer to combat and exploration. Regular updates and seasonal content keep the game fresh and engaging, while the vibrant, immersive world and polished graphics enhance the overall experience, making "Apex Legends" a thrilling and continually evolving game.

But it's not just about the thrill of victory ‚Äì it's about the journey. From the rush of your first kill to the satisfaction of claiming victory as the last squad standing, every moment in Apex Legends is packed with excitement and camaraderie.

At the time of this review, I played the game on pc for 999.9 hours, and on console for ~2000 hours. Here's what I can conclude (I took a long hiatus from the game to focus on school, so I cannot speak on the current state of Apex and will write this based on my memory of previous seasons).

Pros: Great gunplay/gun mechanics, slow time-to-kill which allows for long and entertaining fights compared to other battle royale games, solid and rewarding movement mechanics, and a variety of ways to keep the game fresh (limited-time gamemodes, a rotating battle-royale map selection, and mixtape maps like deathmatch, gun game, etc.).

Cons: Steep learning curve for new players (many characters to learn with learning curves on each individual character, variety of maps to learn and understand, movement mechanics, like superglides, that take time to learn and perfect), broken SBMM at times (especially when party members have a significantly lower MMR than you do). In order to improve and progress in the game, a significant time commitment is required overall. Despite this, casual players who do not want to commit to this can find the overall experience enjoyable.

The game suffers from issues that are to be expected with shooter games like it, like the occasional broken meta or legend and third, fourth, and sometimes fifth-partying as a result of the slow time-to-kill, for example. However, these factors should not deter new players from giving Apex a fair shot, as the game is great overall when one looks past these issues.

A sandwich is a product defined by the process it is produced. The defining process is layering, or stratification, if you will. (If you will make me a sandwich that is.)

Much like an archaeologist going through the Himalayas with a camel-hair brush, one can uncover the strata, or layers, and therefore reverse engineering the probable method the layers were put there -- by the sands of time, an ancient ocean now evaporated, a massive meteor attack, volcanic eruption from the Earth's bowels, or by the hand if an angry and vengeful God.

Or, more relevantly, a being with the agency to use a knife or fork for spreading yellow mustard, or placing a slab of bogna, on a piece of bread borne fullgrown from a plastic bag.

But, because one cannot be entirely sure of the method, "sandwiches" qua sandwiches are notoriously susceptible to being misinterpreted. The mere act of observance may change the observer.

So, strictly speaking, Pop Tarts are stuffed like ravioli. Or are they layered and sides crimped? Are tacos layered or stuffed? How about lettuce wraps at that "Chinese" food place with the big horse outside it over at the mall?

While scholars may debate this, your Redditor here (n.b. there is no flair for "gassbag") is a strict constuctionist. The layering, viz., stratification must be in seriatim. One layer *then another layer.

So "stuffed" items, with a "filling," are not, strictly speaking, stratified. But scholars less orthodox than I may disagree, although I deem them unworthy of academic respect in this regard.

It matters not the number of substrate moieties upon which the layering is done, nor the composition of said substrate. Bread, lettuce, fried chicken, potato chips. Double decker, triple decker, a plurality if deckers, turtles all the way down. Layered with a viscous spread like honey. (Bonus- honey is the second sweetest thing in the world. The first sweetest is YOU.) Or peanut butter or Vegemite or mayo or chopped liver. Perhaps a solid strata, like ham. Or a friable strata, like tuna salad. The list is endless, figuratively, although perhaps literally as anything can be a comestible if you try hard enough.

The critical feature is that there is something laid upon said substrate that does not intermix with the substrate. So a layer cake with frosting spread in between is not a sandwich, because the frosting/cake layers are integral. That is, one cannot (practically) remove one moiety from another without destroying the whole. (There are those willing to lick off the frosting to remove it there by leaving pure substrate, nevertheless they will leave fur or whiskers from time to time there changing the nature of the melange.)

One may conger a maternal figure lovingly making such sandwich, whereas, in truth, it may be the black heart of a soul- less machine. One may eat a sandwich to remember, or to forget.

One particular vexing case study is a friend of mine who complains of making sandwiches while on Ambien. She wakes up in the morning with jello, chicken and bread -- gone, except partially eaten in what appears to be a sandwich. If one makes a sandwich and no one sees was it actually a sandwich? A question for the ages or until she just gives up and stops keeping food in her house.

Ok. I have now digested my Easter brunch. That is all.

APEX Legends: A Disappointing Descent into Chaos

I've given APEX Legends a fair shot, but after countless hours of gameplay, I must say it has been a frustrating and underwhelming experience. Here‚Äôs why I think APEX Legends fails to live up to the hype:

Balancing Issues:
The game suffers from severe balancing issues. Certain legends are far too overpowered, making the selection process feel unfair and unbalanced. This disparity often results in predictable and monotonous gameplay, where everyone gravitates towards the same few characters.

Technical Problems:
APEX Legends is riddled with technical problems. From frequent server issues and connectivity problems to random crashes, the technical stability of the game is a major letdown. These persistent issues disrupt the gaming experience and make it difficult to enjoy even a single session without encountering some sort of technical hiccup.

Toxic Community:
The community around APEX Legends is unfortunately quite toxic. New players are often met with hostility and unhelpfulness, which can be discouraging and off-putting. The lack of proper moderation and community management exacerbates this problem, making the overall experience unpleasant for many.

Monotonous Gameplay:
Despite the initial thrill, APEX Legends quickly becomes repetitive. The lack of meaningful updates and new content fails to keep the game fresh and engaging. The gameplay loop feels stagnant, and after a while, it‚Äôs hard to find the motivation to keep playing.

Predatory Microtransactions:
The game‚Äôs microtransaction system feels predatory and greedy. Essential items and skins are locked behind paywalls, and the random nature of loot boxes makes it even worse. This pay-to-win element detracts from the fairness and enjoyment of the game.

Poor Matchmaking:
The matchmaking system in APEX Legends is deeply flawed. Matches are often unbalanced, with new players getting thrown in with highly experienced ones, leading to a frustrating experience. The long queue times only add to the irritation.

Lack of Innovation:
APEX Legends doesn‚Äôt bring anything particularly new or innovative to the table. It feels like a derivative blend of other popular battle royale games without any standout features. The game‚Äôs initial promise of uniqueness quickly fades away, leaving a sense of unfulfilled potential.

In conclusion, APEX Legends might have started strong, but it has devolved into a mess of technical issues, poor balance, and a toxic community. There are better, more stable, and enjoyable options out there for battle royale enthusiasts. Save your time and money, and look elsewhere for your gaming fix.

I played mostly on Playstation and Xbox, but the problems there are essentially the same here, those being, you can no longer play "Casually" in Apex anymore. It's hit that same cycle all Battle Royales do, the community is just too good now. There's no line between Ranked and Casual, it's either "Get stomped" or "Get stomped harder".

Here's an example. (Plus you could take literally ANY battle royale and swap it out with "Apex" and it would still be true!)

- "Hey, a new Battle Royale called 'Apex Legends'! It looks pretty promising!"
- "Wow, i really like this game, it's got really interesting mechanics and satisfying gunplay!"
- "I've been playing for a couple months now, let me try ranked!"
- "Ehh, i got beat, but it was still pretty fun! It makes me want to improve more!"

***3 Seasons later***
- "Huh? How did i get matched with a Predator? i'm only silver 2!?"
- "Damn... i'm getting beat every match almost.... maybe i should try ranked, that way i get put into more similarly matched lobbies!"
- "Nope, got destroyed even quicker!"
- "I'm really losing interest because everyone is so much better i have no chance to improve..."
Garbage Matchmaking. Horrible to teach new players.

TL;DR
Apex Legends, once a good battle royale game, has become frustrating due to constant network issues (high ping, packet loss, hits not registering), rampant cheating, unfairly strong controller aim assist, and unchecked config cheats. Respawn and EA seem indifferent to these problems, making the game a lost cause for regular players.

Apex Legends: A Disappointing Turn
Apex Legends used to be a top game in the battle royale scene, but now it‚Äôs gone downhill. As someone who‚Äôs casually played the game for a while, it‚Äôs really sad to see how network issues and cheaters (they‚Äôre in nearly every match) have made the game really not so fun to play.

Network Issues
The game has serious network problems. There‚Äôs almost always high ping and packet loss, which means the game lags a lot. Hits often don‚Äôt register when they should, and sometimes you get hit by enemies even after you‚Äôve gotten behind cover. These issues make the game feel really clunky and frustrating.

Unfair Controller Aim Assist
Another issue is the aim assist for controller players. While it‚Äôs supposed to help balance things between console and PC players, it‚Äôs way too strong right now. This gives controller users an unfair edge over those using a mouse and keyboard.

Then there are the config cheats. Configs are macros, so yes they are cheats. These are setups that let players do complex movements effortlessly, which normal players can‚Äôt do (atleast not consistently). It‚Äôs basically cheating, but it often goes unnoticed.

It‚Äôs really frustrating to see players cheating so openly with no fear of getting caught. The anti-cheat system, Easy Anti-Cheat (EAC), is a joke. The name Easy Anti-Cheat says it all. EAC once issued a warning to my friend for having two mice connected (he uses different mice for work and games), but it can't detect the actual cheaters though. Cheaters can keep on ruining games without any consequences.

What‚Äôs even more frustrating is that the developers/publisher, Respawn/EA, don‚Äôt seem to care. Even though there‚Äôs a ton of evidence and reports from players, they‚Äôre not taking serious action against cheaters. It seems like they don‚Äôt want to ban cheaters because it might reduce the number of players, but this just drives away honest players.

Apex Legends used to be a great game with exciting gameplay, but now it‚Äôs struggling with too many issues. Network issues, cheating, overpowered aim assist, and unchecked configs have made it a mess. Until the developers take real steps to fix these problems, the game will keep losing its appeal.

In my personal experience it's been pretty hard to enjoy this game. I like the mechanics and all the variety this game offers. My biggest problem with it is the matchmaking. This may sound like I'm just complaining about me being bad at the game but I have been discouraged to play and get better because of the matchmaking. In most of the matches I've played I've had to fight enemies who were hundreds of levels above me. I'm talking about me, a level 33 player, being in matches with level 500+ enemies. How do you fight against someone who has double or triple the amout of time and skill in the game? It could also seem a bit weird that I'm only level 33 with 100 hours played. That is because most of the time I've spent just being in the practice range playing against my friends with many different weapons and loadouts to get better. It helped only a little bit. Now I don't actually know how Apex' matchmaking system works exactly. So it could be totally normal and I'm complaining about nothing. Or maybe I'm just not cut out for battle royale. I hope the point I'm trying to make is understandable. And don't let this review keep you from at least trying it out. Have a great day.

I have played this game a lot and if you look at my game hours you will realize that I have played this game for almost 1000 hours.
I can say that I enjoyed 30% of the 1000 hours of gaming experience, and the rest was difficult and disappointing.
There are many high and good players in this game and if you stop playing this game and want to play again, it will be very difficult for you to return to the previous level. So this game is considered a hard game and you are behind the game.
My other problem with this game is that you need to play at least 2-3 hours a day to get the minimum rewards, and if you don't spend in this game, the company doesn't care. And it doesn't look at how much time you spent on this game, on the other hand, there are a lot of cheaters and fraudsters in this game and it makes this game difficult for you.
In general, according to these, I can say that I may continue to play this game, but it is only to continue and not to lose the prizes, and if I have more time, I can continue playing the game, I will definitely leave the game and the game I will play another game, and if I make sure that I reach the minimum, I will definitely play another game, and I am sure that there are games that the developer company cares a lot about for an ordinary player like me, and they value me a lot.
In general, I think that if someone installs this game for the first time and after knowing the conditions of the game, he will choose to play another game (if he can).
In general, I can say that this game is a normal game and in the current world there are much, much better games for you to spend your time playing.

constantly refreshing gameplay when compared to other fps! the game itself has very little matchmaking so your expectations when starting should really be low, however the game has a high skill ceiling and winning and getting knocks/kills are really satisfying. plus if you're looking for EA to dump you with cash grabs with amazing skins that are way too overpriced, this is definitely the game! aside, respawn has yet again released a masterpiece in terms of concept and execution! the game itself is buggy from time to time but it's just fun and frustrating! strongly rec with friends!

The worst Chili's in Missouri. The waitress Kilen treated my family poorly before I even arrived. Coming in late to the sh*t show of a family gathering the waitress she never acknowledged me when she came to drop off the appetizers. After my niece reminded her that she had a drink order for the bar she rolled her eyes and turned abruptly and left to get the drink when she came back I asked could I order something. When she finally took my order you could blatantly see she was visibly annoyed that I had joined my family gathering to which my nieces informed me that she had been acting as if she hated having to provide the customer service she should been trained more properly to do. While she was taking my order the store manager Donna brought over the margarita that was ordered at the same time the appetizers were ordered. I asked while each team member was standing there for a glass of Apple juice in a margarita glass with a side of lime. Kilen and Donna walked a away and after several minutes Kilen returned with a regular mug glass with apple juice not even with lime on the side. When I reminded her that the glass I requested she breath very heavily rolled her eyes and snatched the glass from the table mumbling something derogatory under her breath and stated with as much attitude she could muster " all right" as if I was inconveniencing her with her plans for waiting on our table. So I asked another waitress to send the manager over to our table once she walked away because she was being overtly rude to us the customer. The manager comes over listens to my complaints agreeing reluctantly with what all of us were saying about her behavior. During this exchange the waitress comes in listening distance from another empty table hears a little of the conversation about what we're telling the manager and then abruptly shoved on the chairs across the floor making a loud scrapping sound and storms off huffing and puffing and starts to cry at this point as if we did something to her negatively like she didn't deserve for this inappropriate behavior to be reported. I could not believe the exchange that was taking place in basically empty restaurant. While I waited for my food to get to the table I explained again to the manager how this energy and action should not have to be exercised by the staff she seemed very unmoved by pleas for better service and stood with a blank face looking at me as if I were alien. The manager then changes gears as if it's our fault as the customer that the waitress is so upset and crying and tried to my excuses switching the focus to the waitress emotional breakdown from her own behavior. By the end of the visit this manager tells me point blank to my face that I'm in the wrong for making her staff upset after I catch her and the whole rest of the wait staff on the kitchen portion of the restaurant discussing my reaction to being treated rudely and abrasive by the waitress in this scenario. I don't know when it became the customer responsibility to make sure that the wait staff has a good experience at a restaurant. I have always thought it was the other way around. But the manager goes on to tell me I didn't handle the situation correctly because I had her staff member upset. It's like wow Chili's that how your employees are trained to treat the people that make a choice to eat in your restaurant. I am taken all the way back by the lack of compassion or customer service exhibited by the manager and waitresses in this restaurant.

I'd rather have Titanfall 3.

This game has a fun gameplay loop but its overshadowed by EA's disgusting greedy microtransactions. While they are cosmetic only, its very clear that they are given priority over any new innovations to the gameplay formula. I can count on one hand how many good changes they have made for the gameplay over 5 years. Like upgrading the shields through damage done as well as teamplay (ie. revives, rezzes, collecting EVO caches).
They took the guns from Titanfall, they took the setting from Titanfall, they took the experience from Titanfall (minus the best part: TITANS) and watered it down until it was just there to sell their ugly overpriced skins.

Unfortunately it is a fun game and I keep coming back to it despite the frustrations. But as I just stated, the majority of it comes from Titanfall. EA is never going to make Titanfall 3 so this is the best we get.
