Are you an MnK player who wants a fun pvp battle royale experience with interesting and skill-based source movement to boot? Great! Good luck on your search because you won't find it here!

This game is only fun due to the source movement, but you are actively throwing your matches if you don't use a controller. The controller aim assist is entirely indistinguishable from aimbot. This is especially bad because EA doesn't actually remove cheaters, so you're left spectating the person who killed you questioning if you should even report them, because you genuinely can't tell if the person you're watching is cheating or just using a controller.
I'm sure there are a bunch of controller players that are crawling out of the cracks to screech about how "it's fair because I MnK have more control."
To that I reply:
1. 80% of Apex Pred players are controller.
2. The large majority of ALGS teams have fully switched to controller. Even well known MnK players such as ImperialHal, Jmwfps, ReptarRB, and TSM Albralelie have switched because of the clear advantage it gives.
3. No, movement does not counter it in any capacity:
YouTube‚Ñ¢ Video: Mande shows why Aim Assist needs to be NERFED before the next ALGS.. 
Views: 31,876
Mande shows why Aim Assist needs to be NERFED before the next ALGS.. Welcome back to another Apex Legends - Funny Moments & Best Highlights video.

(No, this is not the only clip, I can pull hundreds of clips of proof.)
4. Controller and MnK First person shooters are not made for controllers, they're are just adapted as such because it makes companies more money. Crossplay should only be for casual people playing with their friends, it shouldn't be balanced around "equalizing" objectively different inputs by allowing a computer to do 90% of the work for one.

anticheat got more aggressive, ive just recently been kicked for failing authentication and then given a match desertion penalty for leaving the match when i was kicked. I would understand this if i had done literally anything at all to fail authentication, i havent. no hacking, steady internet connection, just randomly failed authentication. this is not only annoying, it is bad anticheat design. if i had been an actual cheater, i would KNOW that my cheat isnt working. instead, my account should have been silently flagged for failing authentication, and after a certain amount of failed flags in a short span of time, along with conclusive evidence of cheating like substantiated reports and/or suspicious stat changes, banned in a wave. lets say once every three months, known cheaters banned.

i would be fine with the anticheat being a little aggressive if there was any evidence that it has improved the cheating situatuion in the game. but the devs arent even ALLOWED to talk about the cheating situation. we dont get to know how many bans are being made, what the health of the game is, anything like that.

I reinstalled the game today to play with one of my friends, we've only ever played duos together the past 4 years (cause no one else in our friend group is too interested in playing apex with us for trios). Just too find out duos isn't coming back for another 4 weeks??? I can't imagine how cutting off a giant portion of your player base of your game for 6 weeks is a good idea in any feasible way.

Epitome of the Battle Royale formula. Low skill floor, insanely high skill ceiling. That being said, its oversaturated with two types of people: Old timers like myself who played on and off the past 5 years or so, and true casuals that use controller for an insanely powerful AA. Sprinkle here and there tryhards like in any other FPS of course, and you got a community that is quite adamantly against newcomers. Despite my gripes with this game, I played more than 1k hours of it, 700 on steam and another 400ish on Origin at launch. Its a good game, no denying it. Just not good for beginners and with a toxic ranked gameplay loop. True movement FPS enthusiasts will enjoy it, the casual FPS player will get sick of this game's ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• real quick.

This review comes from a casual solo player

I still really like the core of this game, the battle royal has it's problems and i feel that most reviews focus on that.
so i'll focus this review more on the mixtape game mode.

Prologue:Arenas
I used to mostly play arenas before mixtape was introduced, it had it's problems (mostly matchmaking) but still was very fun. according to Respawn itself:

Arena's not reaching it's audience is kinda sad, but understandable reason for removing the game mode. On the other hand is giant BS. It was a great place to learn how to fight in 3v3. Personally i think introduction of a 3rd team would've make it more interesting, because many battles in battle royal involve a third party. Other than that the use of own budget at the start of each round was a great way to learn weapons that you normally wouldn't use. the limited amount of abilities per round uses makes you learn how to use them in the most useful/impactful way in teamfights.
That being said,


The fact that most mixtape maps are just a cutout from the battle royal map rubs me the wrong way and causes more problems in their respected game modes, I also find it kind of annoying that the same maps keep being in rotation. Biggest 3 problems i have with mixtape are:
1) they're short --> a lot of people get their dailies this way, after joining they either don't play or leave afterwards.
2)Most lobbies consist of Master players and players that haven't reached lvl 100 --> since you still fight in 'teams' (for some reason) you can easily tell who is going to win before the game even begins and most of the times it's very one-sided.
3) There's a lot of server lag at the moment --> if you use a marksman gun en have a shootout with someone, all they have to do is: spam left right and somehow your bullets just fly through then without damaging them from the other side if someone shoots you while you run towards cover you somehow die while already in cover away from their sight. this problem is rather specific and i'd understand if people will just call it a


If you really want to win in this mode don't even think about trying out guns that you're uncomfortable with. Most of the time the random selection of guns doesn't really make any sense and since everyone can choose the same 2 guns, what's the point of giving people the option of guns that most players don't even consider using? This game mode specifically from verticality. In battle royal verticality is borderline awesome. escaping enemies, flanking enemies and moving on, it's a good experience. but in deathmatch you don't really have a reason to move on, so the winning team mostly just camp on high ground, combine that with the matchmaking and you'll notice the game being more of a 'try to climb this greasy pole' (for the losing team) and less of a normal deathmatch.


This game mode is the best in the mixtape. I wish this mode utilized the weapon selection better, the mission 'capture this point' feels more of stretching the game instead of 'let's try helping the losing team' and the lockout-event should be way shorter, cause even if you're really losing it's easy to take that point back, taking the point back feel like a game stretch (again). Most of these complains aren't that big of a deal, because overall all the pieces that are used in mixtape fit control very well.


Lockdown is by far the worst game mode of all, most of the players don't really care of capturing the points and just play it as if it's a deathmatch. the maps are also horrible for this kind of game mode. The first team that captures a point don't really play the game while having the point: While having the point, the other teams will start fighting each other before even able to reach the point. the rewards for capturing a point are also questionable, most of the time it's a red-tier weapon (which is fine) combined with gold sniper. The problem with snipers in lockdown is that the maps aren't really made for sniping and with most points being inside, makes it even more useless. Also the spawnpoints are horrible, obviously the team that spawns the closest to the next point will capture the point, bringing me back to 'the maps aren't made for this game mode'


This game mode has the same problems as deathmatch, but since you don't choose your own weapon solves half of it's own problems. Other than that (and core mixtape problems) this mode is fine.



i don't think Respawn succeeded with ''bringing something that allows players a little more relaxed play.'' In practice there's no real reason to win or lose in this game mode, you don't really get rewarded in any case. Also the main game went through some changes in the past few seasons, meanwhile mixtape feels pretty much unchanged.
I would love to see these game modes translated into a one man experience, without needing a team (but still allow people to join in groups).


The best way to play this game is with a premate squad of 3 people.
this game can be enjoyable when played with 2. The random is going to be more miss than hit, nonetheless there are still fun people that play this game.
if you're very competitive, you might enjoy this game.
If you're looking for a casual / solo experience, i'd recommend looking elsewhere or joining a community that you enjoy and play together.
Lastly, if you enjoy spending money on useless items that won't help improve the game in any way, you are the perfect demographic for this game.

Average apex experience: My buddy and I have to play trios when we want to play duos, simply because they are incapable of having more than one game mode at a time. Next we try to find a spot to land, pick and go, excited to play the game, due to our past experience in earlier seasons. We land at what seems to be a semi popular spot, we have experience in other shooter games, and our aim is, semi-decent. I'm not saying I'm the aiming god, but I used to be able to land enough shots to get some kills back in seasons 1-10ish, we land we get into a fight, I'm obviously playing mirage because. Well yeah. I'm actually quite a good mirage player so I can get some fun tricks done and it's a fun time. At least it was. Till all of a sudden the game decides that the level 53 player who has about... 4 wins total over 70 hours(at the time) should go against 60,000 kill bloodhound masters players. My friend and I get smoked immediately and it's back to the lobby. Repeat this about 2-3 times, then get off and play something else.

I want to improve, I really do, and I know this seems like a skill issue, but how can I get better when I barely get a chance to fight? Fights last less than 5 seconds most of the time and I am left sitting wondering what happened. I really used to love this game, my time on play-station was credible back in the early pre-season to season 6 days. This game has character, it has soul. It has something that is really a great concept that truly could be built upon to be better. But instead it is plagued with sweaty players, soulless character releases, scummy company money grabs, and overall terrible matchmaking. I will continue to play this game, because I do know eventually if I slam myself at the brick wall that is Apex enough times I'll get through it and actually be able to play and have fun again. But for now I can barely play 2 games, due to the constant flood of high skill players in my lobbies. It sounds bad to say but even fortnite has better skill based matchmaking than this. Most games now can have at least semi competent matchmaking where the highest level players in the game aren't put with the bottom of the barrel. I know it is casual, but that's exactly it, casual. something for the boys to just hop on and play, something where you don't win all the time, have to work for a win, but also don't get curb stomped by top level players.

I really do want to recommend this game, I want to praise it and give it the love it deserves. But I can't. I don't have fun playing this game. I don't think many other low level players will have fun playing this game either. Like I said earlier, I'm still gonna play, just to try to get better, but I already have tons of knowledge about the game. I can't imagine how it is like for a 100% new player to just. Hop in, see what it's all about. Then get absolutely CRUSHED as they play in their first match after the exhibition ones

TLDR: It's a great game at its core but it is just surrounded by so many matchmaking issues and other common gaming issues that it's almost impossible for new players to pick up, or returning players to hop back in. I can't recommend it now, But hopefully in the future it'll improve.

This is a good option for a "secondary" game. I play it if I don't see anything fun to do with my main games. The matches are quick. You can compensate for bad teammates and don't drag your teammates down as much compared to MOBA games. It is a close-range arcade-style battle royal FPS. If you want, you can play long range (300 meters or more) even if it is not optimal for ranking up. Using terrain and positioning can win you games. Using a slope or roof as cover, moving without being seen, and letting unsuspecting squads fight each other are rewarded in-game.

Cons:
You are rewarded for practicing aiming with your mouse. You need to adjust your sensitivity and track targets on screen. This is a con for me because I hate practicing repetitive tasks like combos or mouse movement. If you like it, it's a plus.

In every match, your armor level is tied to the number of shots you land. Playing safe can set you behind. You need to take other "objectives" around the map to get "evolution points" and level up armor. As a counter-balance, abilities matter, but they can be offset with good shooting.

Durability and mobility are very high. You can hit an enemy in the head with a pistol, automatic rifle, or sniper rifle and they will definitely survive two shots.

I started playing in season 15, and it was really fun! I was playing against people my skill for the most part and actually felt like I was improving. However, I have hit a stage where I cannot find myself enjoying any moment anymore with the incredibly unfair matchmaking and cheaters everywhere. If you want to have fun, there‚Äôs plenty of other games that will do exactly that without all the anger and frustration Apex offers.

This game runs terribly on Linux. I have to disable all of the graphics improvements and even choose the lowest possible resolution just to get 30 FPS. It's also a live-service game that requires a separate account just to play. It's hard on my hard drive, and it's just overall the embodiment of everything wrong with modern game design.

The graphics are solid, though. And the tutorial level felt like a story in and of itself, with a fun voice teaching you how to play in very "Gen-Z" terminology. It does have that going for it. But even if this game is free to play, the minimum specs for this game may cost you a small fortune, especially if you plan on using Steam Proton.

Fun game, great devs, horrendous publisher and outdated engine.

The game contains extremely fun gameplay, making it my go-to battle royale, plus the design of characters and weapons from Respawn have been top tier since Titanfall 2. The came contains extremely expensive macrotransactions for mostly useless customization like character skins that you cannot see since it's an FPS, but weapon skins are good, still I don't recommend people getting involved into the monetization system.

The gameplay is high contane based mainly around mobility (not as much as Titanfall) and includes really interesting movement techs like superslides. It includes limited time gamemodes that turn out really fun and ofc the main one that's a battle royale. Athough I heavily recommend playing the game with friends since comunitcation is really important and playing with randoms can turn out extremely frustrating, specially when they rage-quit instantly after being downed.

This game definitely ain't what it it used to be. Back in the good ol' 2019 days players would just run around King's Canyon like headless chickens and have fun. Around season 7, however, the game reached the pinnacle of straight up competitive repetition where everyone plays with visible sweat running down their face and the dedicated casual players like myself had become imprisoned in SBMM hell, never to see the "You Are The Champion" screen again.

Meta gaming, TTV usernames, esports, unnecessarily overpriced skins and heirlooms... This ultimately led me to abandon what had been my favorite fps game to play during quarantine. This game and I even share the same birthday!

Now, five years later, it's safe for me to say this game is NOT worth it anymore seeing what it's become today. It's run its course and anyone looking to have casual fun in a shoot em up title will need to look somewhere else.

I had loved this game for a long while about 2 years ago. Its fast paced, you can collect items for free without having to pay and there are different game modes to enjoy. After 350 hours of non stop love for the game it became filled with cheaters. From wall hacks to aim bots, I had to quit the game out of frustration. Then to make matters worse, they removed my all time favorite (and only reason why I played) arenas game mode. Despite desperately missing the game, the combination of the insane cheaters and no arena mode made me leave the game uninstalled for 2 years, occasionally checking back in case things changed. Finally, I am able to enjoy the game again after all that time. Though arenas has still made no return, matchmaking has treated me better. The game is fast paced like I've always loved, but I don't have to sweat my 4$$ off just to get one kill. Now I'll be waiting on arenas to hopefully make it's return and my love for the game will grow to its highest again.

I have just over 70 hours in this game and I started only 1.5 month ago or something. I can confidently say I am a new rookie player that mostly played solo and managed to get to Bronze III. Game has great potential but for me it is the most unfriendly game for newcomers I have seen so far. Here all the pros and cons:
PROS:
- The maps

- The game modes (incl. the main battle royale)

- I haven't seen too many toxic players compared to other games I played (Battlefront 2, LoL), This might be tied to my casual skill level though.

- Tools like death recap, spectating and hit feedback are all great to have, should be in more games

CONS:
- Matchmaking, I have already seen a consistent amount of far, far better players than me. if you want to play the game as newbie, be prepared to face god like squads and players with god like aim right from the get go. You should be happy with like 1 kill every 5 matches in the beginning.

- Cheating, Even though the game has kernel level anti cheat (which is evil in its nature), presented as silver bullet against cheating, I have already seen a fair amount of cheating. The death recap and spectating does help a lot in spotting them

- Poor hit registration, audio registration and low tick servers ruin many 1 v 1 or squads vs squads

- This might be more a personal issue, the aiming and hitting feels clumsy in this game. Bullets have a fairly low velocity while the player movement is very fast compared to other games. Also the inaccuracy of the hip fire is so bad most players use their optics consistently even on players that are like 10 meters away. That feels awkward as well.

Apex Legends: A Solid Battle Royale Experience with Room for Improvement

Apex Legends, developed by Respawn Entertainment, is a popular battle royale game that has carved out a niche for itself with its unique blend of team-based gameplay, character abilities, and fast-paced action. Since its surprise launch in 2019, it has maintained a strong player base and continues to evolve with regular updates and new content.

Gameplay and Mechanics:
The core gameplay of Apex Legends is solid and engaging. The emphasis on team play, with each player selecting a "Legend" with unique abilities, sets it apart from other battle royales. The movement mechanics are smooth and fluid, allowing for dynamic and strategic encounters. The ping system is a standout feature, providing excellent communication options for teams without the need for voice chat.

Visuals and Performance:
Visually, Apex Legends is impressive. The game features a colorful and vibrant art style that stands out in the crowded battle royale genre. Performance-wise, it runs well on a variety of hardware, though some players have reported occasional issues with server stability and connectivity.

Content and Updates:
Respawn consistently adds new content, including Legends, maps, and limited-time events. While this keeps the game fresh, some updates have been met with mixed reactions from the community. Balancing issues and the introduction of new mechanics can sometimes disrupt the game's equilibrium.

Monetization and Cosmetics:
Apex Legends is free-to-play, with monetization primarily through cosmetic items. The in-game store offers a range of skins and other cosmetics, though the pricing has been a point of contention for some players. The battle pass system provides additional content and rewards, offering good value for those who engage with it regularly.

Community and Support:
The community around Apex Legends is generally positive and active. Respawn's support and communication with players are decent, though there are occasional complaints about the responsiveness to player feedback, especially concerning balancing and bug fixes.

Conclusion:
Apex Legends remains a strong contender in the battle royale genre. Its unique character abilities, team-focused gameplay, and smooth mechanics provide a distinctive experience. However, issues with balance, monetization, and occasional performance hiccups indicate there is still room for improvement. Overall, it's a solid choice for fans of the genre, offering both excitement and challenges.

Rating: 7.5/10 - A Solid Battle Royale with Potential for Growth

I have uninstalled - and subsequently reinstalled - this game 3 times in the last 48 hours. I have added the game to my "ignore" list, removed it from my library, all in an attempt to save my sanity. Yet, here I am, typing a review as I await the re-installation of 70+GB of pure pain and suffering. This game is fantastic but it remains the most humbling experience I have ever had. The level of skill required to be consistently good at this game can only be attributed to some kind of demonic deal, a soul exchange, a dance with the devil. I thought I was decent at games, yet, now as I approach 30 years of age, I find myself screaming at the PC, depressed, questioning the very meaning of my existence. The graphics and art style are not my cup of tea, the community is poisonous, the micro-transactions are borderline predatory (see what I did there?) When it's good it makes you feel like a King amongst men, but when it's bad, it's worse than chewing broken glass whilst having red hot iron forced through your eyelids. The game is free, but I have spent over ¬£1000 on it and I plan to spend more. 10/10

If you crave frustration and disappointment, look no further than Apex Legends for an abysmal server experience. Prepare for your PC or laptop to spontaneously give up on life, crushed under the sheer incompetence of the game's unstable performance. Even a 1000Mbps connection won't save you from the relentless lag induced by Apex Legends' abysmal servers. When stacking up against its competitors, Apex Legends stands out for all the wrong reasons, showcasing embarrassingly inferior server performance. While Valorant maintains a somewhat respectable 120ms server latency, Apex Legends shamefully lags behind at a mere 20ms. The disparity continues with Valorant's robust anti-cheat system, a stark contrast to Apex Legends' flimsy implementation of EasyAntiCheat, essentially rolling out a red carpet for hackers. The lack of repercussions for cheaters is no surprise, considering the game's questionable decision to skimp on banning measures for the sake of saving a few bucks, resulting in a hacker-ridden wasteland. As if the gameplay woes weren't enough, Apex Legends gouges its player base with exorbitant skin prices and shameless exploitation through predatory and anti-consumer gambling strategies. Choose wisely, or be prepared to endure the arduous journey through the pit of despair that is Apex Legends

- Sydney servers has no players and the one game i had was with a white guy screaming at me for looting for 2 seconds and then pushing enemies into their own death for no reason so never again

how is this even considered a "game" ? the aesthetic is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• than ever and lacks any personality, it really only caters to people who have never touched a mouse or keyboard in their entire life and is a personal statement on why the video game industry as a whole is dying. These grifts are constantly shilled and Electronic Arts has the bones to do so rightfully. One can argue that it is a good thing that video games as a whole are inept as it might inspire people to have more real experiences and activity and therefore opens the door for more opportunities in life. though one thing is most certain, that if these pathetic excuses for video games are indeed "the future of gaming" then by all means let them be the ones to erode it sooner rather than later. I will choose to live in a world that has no fond memory of video games rather than a world that pretends and mockingly suggests that this could ever be considered good. at what good work is shown here? hot topic models running around blasting each other? it is an actual ugly joke and is catered to simple minded incompetent people or at the very least suggests so. that being said, you don't have to be smart to know of their horrible designs and lack of creativity so only time can tell the story of the biggest lackluster "game" of all time.

I don't know what to say... I have played this game a lot on another account on the Origin AKA now as the 'EA' platform, and I've spent 1000+ hours on this game. Here I am reviewing it right here, and still, I seriously don't know what to say... about this game. Go ahead and try out the Battle Royale mode if you want and see how ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• hard your ass could get beat. It's very draining and exhausting sometimes to get your ass beat up so hard like that.

Sometimes it feels like it ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• on you with the randoms that you are teamed up with, the server connection problems, or just straight up ridiculously difficult situations that feel like nothing but hopeless; sometimes it's just looting over and over again all over and around the map until you end up meeting your cruel fate to be destroyed by some sweaty ass squad or some sweaty ass player, sometimes a trio of 3 that are friends who usually play together that destroy you, and it happens whether you try to be nice and supportive or not, whether you are very careful and cautious or not... it's frustrating. Does that mean that the game just completely sucks ? No, it doesn't completely suck because they have made it very catchy throughout the seasons as they have added multiple features to multiple weapons, to multiple maps and to multiple modes... yada yada yada... The point is! That they have created something cool here, cool and so ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• deadly. I wouldn't talk about the 'agendas' or the backstories of some of the characters, as that doesn't interest me neither do I give a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• about such a thing in such an online-based game like this, nor do I care about the skins they make and add (I can hardly look at one that makes me feel like it's genuine) or the bundles or the micro-transaction-like nature in the game.

Also, let me tell you ? You wanna get good at this game? You could get good at this game at some point but even then that just doesn't ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• cut it. If you go ahead and play with randoms, then just forget about any good and solid chance of winning and being the champion, so you just ought to play this game with friends whom you know and have a good sense of communication with (even then that doesn't cut it, btw), and you would have to get online with them when they do to play together and have a good chance at winning, but more importantly, I really want to say that, Regardless of all of that mentioned above, you really could get stuck (or sucked) in this game ending up not knowing just how to stop or let go and just ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• end it where it should, it really could get messy and gets you hooked on winning or "scoring" as the champion or whatever you wanna call it (because some people don't even play to win as champion to begin with) while feeling it's just going nowhere, really nowhere... play if you want and see how it's crazy, so crazy, it's biggest problem lies in overdosing, overdosing that adrenaline rush and playing without quitting or stopping... I swear it's probably the closest way I've gotten to time travel in this life (based in the senses that I have that I observe with), because you just really lose sense of time when playing... Those who want that adrenaline kick (or charge) can surely find lots of that here but don't go complaining when it gets crazy and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• tense. Regardless, does that justify pain, the agony, the suffering, the torment and the frustration that comes with it? No, I don't think so, simply because that IS just NOT how I want to feel, I want to feel good, like I am on fire and not worried about having to be so careful to get ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• right where the smallest mistake can ruin it all, I don't want to be so serious like that. I am tired of this match-in match-out loop. Don't want to be depressed, sad or agitated because I didn't get the right "thing" or go with the right teammate or because it didn't go well while jumping from one match to another anymore, don't want that and all the crazy ass grinding anymore, seriously... Unless I get to know WHERE THE ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• it's going, if it's going anywhere... at all,.

It's just boom here, boom there. Kill leader this, kill leader that. Champion win, champion dead. And it just doesn't stop... Face it; I know it's like this, like there is some toxicity (maybe not from one teammate to another but between us and ourselves), some dysfunction leading to frustration, anger, dissatisfaction, and agitation. Sometimes I can't stop rolling my eyes while playing, waiting for me to discover one thing I can depend or count on in this game to help me win with or without randoms... but still, until now I haven't found that. It's crazy turning on this game, getting into a match while saying "I feel good, I feel like I am gonna win and be crazy good like on fire, lessgo I got this" then saying "ok, that was just a silly hiccup watch let's go again and try again" then saying "hold up, I got close there hol up, let get some more I got this, i got this right ?" then saying "wow wtf is this, did that really happen ? I'm so ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• done" then like "wow so bad so bad wow! I can't believe this wow wtf ugh man how un-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• believable"......... And that's it that's it basically, that's how it is. And I don't know; I just don't know FOR THE LIFE OF ME where it ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• goes, Where does it go ? Where ?

It's hard for me to choose recommending this or not. On my steam account I have only just under 60 hours of playtime, but I mainly played this on xbox where I spent hundreds maybe even a thousand hours playing the game.

The biggest reason I opted to give it a negative review is in the matter of loss of enjoyment. Back when I started playing, I believe it was around season 2 or 3 forgive me for being too lazy to go look lol, I was a little slow getting into it battle royales just weren't really fun for me. But I was really drawn in by the gameplay with each character having a unique set of abilities and I think that's something that's been improved with all the new characters added in since even though I never touched them and more so with this new perk system. It had it flaws here and there of course but they weren't always that big of a pain.

Of course back then when I started, matches were actually fun! Sure there were times there was a run in with someone much higher skilled at the game, but that was all it was at the time. A bad match. I never felt like I was stuck in a hopeless loop of loss after loss, immediate death after immediate death such as I have in these last 3-5 seasons. I tried to give it a break, see if maybe I was just growing overall too frustrated when I played, but when I came back it seemed like I was just incapable of doing half of what I could when I had first started playing. Every lobby I join seems plagued with full teams of level 500 predators and there's just no escape from it.

There is some very interesting lore inside the game surrounding the different maps and characters and I really like the way things are headed, aside from matchmaking obviously, and I want to follow the story but this isn't something I can easily enjoy without friends to rage at getting instant wiped with. So if you have at least one other friend to play with, I believe you could still have fun even with the imbalance. Push through it and with some luck of the drop progress will be made.

Sorry if a lot of this seems like rambling I tried my best to keep it simple and to the point.

Apex Legends... where do I even begin? This so-called "battle royale masterpiece" is nothing short of a frustrating mess from start to finish. Strap in, because this review is going to be one wild ride through disappointment and rage.

Let's start with the gameplay mechanics, or lack thereof. Apex Legends prides itself on its fast-paced action and dynamic movement, but in reality, it's just a chaotic mess of random encounters and mindless shooting. The gunplay feels clunky and unresponsive, and don't even get me started on the hit detection - it's like trying to hit a fly with a baseball bat blindfolded.

And then there's the map design. Oh boy, where do I even begin? The map in Apex Legends is a convoluted maze of indistinguishable corridors and open spaces, making navigation a nightmare. It's like the developers threw a bunch of random assets together and called it a day, with no regard for flow or balance.

But perhaps the most infuriating aspect of Apex Legends is its matchmaking system. I swear, it's like the game goes out of its way to pair you with the most incompetent teammates imaginable. Whether they're AFK in the spawn area, looting every nook and cranny while you're bleeding out, or just straight-up ignoring your pings, playing with randoms is a surefire way to raise your blood pressure to dangerous levels.

And don't even get me started on the microtransactions. It's like the developers are actively trying to nickel and dime you at every turn, with overpriced cosmetics and loot boxes galore. It's insulting, really, that they expect us to fork over our hard-earned cash for virtual pixels that offer no real value.

In conclusion, Apex Legends is a train-wreck of a game that's not worth the bandwidth it takes to download. From its lackluster gameplay to its abysmal matchmaking and predatory monetization practices, it's clear that this game was rushed out the door with little regard for quality or player experience. Save yourself the frustration and steer clear of this dumpster fire of a battle royale.

Probably the highest quality battle royale game in the market; the diversity of characters' skill sets and their interaction with the game environment is quite impressive. Additionally, communication via both voice and shortcuts is very effective. The ping system, in particular, is highly useful. Lastly, it's quite free-to-play. You can obtain each season's battle pass and numerous skins without spending a single cent. The game stays lively with frequent updates introducing different game modes. Overall, it's the top choice if you're into battle royale.

Now, let's talk about the problems; aside from the typical toxic player base and inevitable cheats in such popular games, some characters' abilities provide clear advantages over others. As in classic online games, in the name of balancing, there's a shift in the "meta," sometimes resulting in abilities being nerfed to the point of being unusable. For example, Valkyrie, or on the contrary, some characters receive buffs well beyond what's necessary, like Mad Maggie. One of the most common issues is the lack of any punishment system in-game, leading to players frequently leaving matches after being knocked down, putting your team at a disadvantage. Finally, while matchmaking isn't bad at lower and mid-levels, it can go out of control at higher tiers, matching you with hardcore psychos who play 24/7.

In summary, it's a highly quality battle royale game worth giving a shot. Unfortunately, it still deals with the chronic issues of competitive online gaming.

The thing that bugs me about this game the most isn't the 20 tick servers, or the medium sized content dump every four months with nothing but overpriced cosmetics following, it's being forced to play with controller players. PC has no option to turn off cross play. With keyboard and mouse, your accuracy is solely your own practice and skill. With a controller, it's half done for you with aim assist. I'm always guaranteed the same deck of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•: New non-meta weapons taking up ground loot, a new legend that will take 10-20 eons to fix after release, servers that make me think I'm an African child who thought "This games free, must be worth my time." This game is not worth your time, your friend's, your family's, or even your dog's. Nobody looks at reviews before "purchasing" free games, but if little Timmy's parents happen to orbit their kid and need to know whats lurking in the corners of their 7 and a half year old's computer, they better find this review, hopefully right before Timmy gets sent to eternal damnation when he's 30, jobless, and stuck playing this brutally idiotic game (Which shouldn't even be classified as a game anymore)

Forgot to leave this downvote years ago but with all the hacker/exploiter drama going on around this game, I felt it's time to leave a well deserved negative review.

Fact of the matter is all Battle Royale games have zero anticheat's that work, and are always infested with cheaters. Game devs never do anything and in these sorts of games when you report anyone for cheating you get ignored or punished for 'wasting staffs time' cause they know they can't do anything about it either, so seeing as how the hacking situation has only gotten much worse after 2 years I'm going to have to say my comment is spot on.

Classes/Characters/Heroes, whatever you call them, they're imbalanced, and most of them are absolutely boring to play or have worthless skill sets that literally do nothing but set you up to get killed by enemies rather than help you kill the enemies.

Overall this is a 2/10 game. It's not fun solo, it's not fun with friends, it's not fun with hackers, it's ugly to look at, has a terrible map design layout, and the core system of the game is just the typical Battle Royale so it brings literally nothing new to the table to spice up what has always been an incredibly boring style of game.

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ (4/5)

Apex Legends, developed by Respawn Entertainment, has cemented its place as a standout title in the battle royale genre since its surprise release. The game offers a unique blend of satisfying gameplay mechanics, diverse characters, and a vibrant, ever-evolving world. However, its heavy reliance on microtransactions can detract from the overall experience.

Fast-Paced and Satisfying Gameplay

Apex Legends excels in providing fast-paced, exhilarating gameplay that keeps players coming back for more. The gunplay is crisp and responsive, with a wide variety of weapons that feel distinct and satisfying to use. The movement mechanics, including sliding, climbing, and ziplines, add a layer of fluidity and dynamism that sets it apart from other battle royale games.

The introduction of Legends, each with unique abilities and playstyles, brings a strategic depth to the game. Whether you're using Wraith's portals for tactical advantage, Lifeline's healing drone to support your team, or Gibraltar's shield to tank damage, the Legends‚Äô abilities complement the core gameplay and encourage team coordination.

Diverse and Engaging Maps

The maps in Apex Legends are beautifully designed and continuously updated, offering diverse environments that keep the gameplay fresh. From the sprawling urban landscape of World's Edge to the lush jungles and high-tech structures of Olympus, each map presents unique challenges and opportunities. The rotating maps ensure that players must constantly adapt their strategies, preventing the game from becoming stale.

Dynamic Seasonal Content

Respawn Entertainment has done an excellent job of keeping Apex Legends fresh with regular seasonal updates. Each season introduces new Legends, weapons, and map changes, as well as limited-time events that add new modes and challenges. This constant influx of content keeps the player base engaged and excited for what‚Äôs next.

Excessive Microtransactions

Despite its many strengths, one of the major drawbacks of Apex Legends is its heavy reliance on microtransactions. While the game is free-to-play and it's possible to earn some in-game currency through gameplay, the majority of cosmetic items, including character skins, weapon skins, and other customization options, are locked behind a paywall. The prices for these items can be quite steep, and the frequent introduction of new, appealing cosmetics can make it feel like a constant push to spend money.

The Battle Pass system, while offering some value, also incentivizes additional spending to unlock premium tiers and exclusive rewards. This can be frustrating for players who prefer to enjoy the game without feeling pressured to make constant purchases.

Conclusion

Apex Legends is a standout battle royale game that offers thrilling, fast-paced gameplay, a diverse cast of characters, and dynamic seasonal content that keeps the experience fresh and engaging. Its excellent gunplay and movement mechanics, combined with strategic team-based gameplay, make it one of the most enjoyable titles in the genre.

However, the game‚Äôs excessive microtransactions and the high cost of cosmetic items can detract from the overall experience. While the core gameplay remains free and highly enjoyable, the persistent push towards in-game purchases may frustrate some players. Despite this, Apex Legends remains a must-play for fans of battle royale games, offering a uniquely satisfying and ever-evolving experience.

Edit: Steam asked me to revise my review. Only thing I'll add: IDK if there are THAT many hackers in this game, or THAT many people no-life Apex, but either way it's ridiculously awful for anyone that doesn't no-life this game. Some say it's controller aim-assist being ridiculously high, could be that, but no matter what the reason, it's awful.

There are three main reasons I'm going to give Apex a thumbs down.

1. Matchmaking sucks.
2. Lootbox prices matched w/ FOMO events
3. The Remote Code Exploit they just... never talked about.


1. As a casual player, the matchmaking is terrible to frustration. I have plenty of time in FPSs in general, so I get being against skilled people, but the 1,500,000 dmg Octane, or 13,000 kill Wraith in every other game really blows. I'm above average, below great, so what do I get? People with a thousand hours who've been playing since launch. It's just not fun after whatever last "matchmaking" update they did. Along with a tick rate worse than Among Us, I'm wondering why not maybe.... invest in some real servers? Can EA not afford those? Is that what we're pretending? They lock the Final Fantasy sword behind $300+ of loot boxes, but we can't get REAL servers so we can pretend this game works?

2. Apex Legends is the king of "Quickly spend hundreds of dollars on this event to get this super rare thing." The Final Fantasy event, the one directly after where you could get an heirloom... Heirlooms themselves.... Apex is considered predatory by most communities I've been a part of.

3. RCE! So during a tournament, a hacker hacked in to two machines of guys in the tournie and injected cheats in their machines. I've heard CRICKETS since then from Respawn/EA, besides like two weeks later there was a Twitter post saying they released a small security update. NOTHING about the fact a guy has claimed this attack and said it was to show off that RCE exists in the engine (but also said "I really doubt anyone else will find it, it should be safe to play"). But to not say anything is terrifying. Do they not care? Can they not fix it? Say SOMETHING here. Edit: Update on this. After MONTHS of hearing absolutely nothing, I heard through 3rd party sources that the original hacker, Destroyer2009, has claimed that the RCE exploit he used was patched. My question? WHY DID EA AND RESPAWN SAY NOTHING? The utter VOID of communication makes me worried. They're an absolutely terrible developer considering they never told me when their game could get me hacked, and then when the WORLDWIDE tournament gets hacked and the hacker says "LOOK HOW UNSECURE THEIR GAME IS", you'd THINK the dev might reply with "Hey, we took care of that SUPER dangerous exploit that was shown on the world stage, we ARE taking care of the game." The fact they didn't has me scratching my head.

The game's fine, the movement is good, gunplay feels pretty good, but there are some glaring issues that make me say: No, I really wouldn't recommend getting in to it.

It's a very good game. I played a lot on Origin/Ea App after launch, it has a great and fun pace/movement, fun legends and weapons. However, you gotta play in a full premade group, otherwise you will get stomped most of the time, even at the ranked lower brackets, it's really hard to get a fresh start at the game. One more thing, you better play it on a controller, the aim assist is INSANE. About the monetization, well it's published by EA after all...

Used to be a unique, fun movement shooter. Now it's a lazy cash grab catering to unskilled players.

I have 300 heirloom shards and zero desire to spend them. I'm not bothering to unlock the new character. The cheaters have ruined the game and I'm not excited like I used to be to do these things.

I play my dailies in 15 minutes and stop now. I'll probably quit doing that soon, too.

Amazing gunplay, satisfying sound design, fun characters, great maps. Great with friends that play the same way you do. I feel like other games have a more pleasing aesthetic or look better graphically, but the gameplay more than makes up for that. The game is occasionally plagued by issues due to its aging engine, such as footstep audio not playing.

What always shocks me is how insane some of the "micro" transactions are. A singular skin can go for 18 euro. Bundles for 30 euro. Or even 60. Fear Of Missing Out (FOMO) is abused constantly in order to push you to that purchase button. Super unique items called heirlooms can go north of 160 euro. (If that's what you're after.) All for some cosmetics. It's nuts. It's all out of proportion for what you're getting. it's aimed at exploiting whales and that's disappointing.

The game is amazing, but it's built on a shoddy foundation with outrageous monetization.
Play it. But just play the game. Don't get swept up in the shop. You'll only encourage them.

Apex Legends is an adrenaline-fueled whirlwind of action, strategy, and teamwork that keeps you on the edge of your seat with every match. Respawn Entertainment has crafted a masterpiece in the battle royale genre, offering fluid gameplay, diverse legends with unique abilities, and constantly evolving landscapes to keep even the most seasoned players engaged.

However, behind the breathtaking vistas and heart-pounding firefights lies a growing concern that threatens to undermine the integrity of the game: cheating. While cheating has plagued online gaming for years, Apex Legends is not immune to its effects.

On consoles, the rise of devices like Cronus Zen has introduced a new level of unfair advantage, allowing players to bypass recoil and perform feats of accuracy that would be impossible without assistance. This not only creates a lopsided playing field but also diminishes the sense of accomplishment for those who strive to improve their skills through practice and dedication.

Meanwhile, on PC, the battle against cheaters has become a constant struggle. Despite the efforts of Respawn's anti-cheat systems, some players still find ways to exploit vulnerabilities, tarnishing the experience for honest gamers who just want to enjoy a fair and competitive match.

Respawn Entertainment has taken steps to address these issues, implementing measures to detect and punish cheaters, but the battle is far from over. As a community, we must remain vigilant and report suspicious behavior to ensure that Apex Legends remains a fair and enjoyable experience for all.

Despite these challenges, Apex Legends continues to stand as a shining example of what a battle royale game can achieve when crafted with passion and innovation. With its dynamic gameplay, engaging characters, and vibrant community, it remains a must-play for fans of the genre. But let us not forget the importance of upholding the principles of fair play and sportsmanship, for without them, the thrill of victory loses its meaning.

Im done playing the game and im deleting it. Damage numbers are too low, needs more lethality. Too many tiers of goods and weapons and too much bloated mechanics with all the hero powers making the game a chunky mess. It has become frustrating to play. The movement speed is fast, but the damage is too low to compensate. The cheaters are too rampant, there's audio glitches and visual glitches. The whole team fighting mechanic needs a massive rebalancing, with a standard for all the heroes because the teams just don't make sense. You spend so much time running around and looting only to be killed in 2 seconds and this makes me wonder why make all the running around such a huge map, just condense the map. The guns do not have large enough bullet counts to offset their poor damage, other guns fire too slowly for the rapid movement and other guns have unusual recoil patterns. All in all the game does not represent a modern era battle royale and should be scrapped or remade or something

If it isn't me being domed in the head faster than the speed of light, it's the majority of the players in Mixtape being literal bots, or lag so bad the characters look like they were made on the N64. The enemy team always has 10 god-tier players, while I'm stuck with their grandparents who just picked the game up 2 seconds ago. I really want to Keep playing this game, but I'm literally risking an aneurysm by simply pressing play. If I wanted to rage so hard, I'd play Getting over it with nothing but my pinky toe.

Apex Legends is a game I have played for 4 years, and I have definitely seen its ups and downs as time passed. I would personally recommend this game not just because it is fun, but because it has its own unique characteristics in comparison to other Battle Royale games like COD Warzone and Fortnite. You can certainly look up many things about this game, but I believe that it is most likely guaranteed you will find a legend in the roster that suits you best. There is also a great amount of customization in this game (Which can be very expensive if you choose to spend money on this game), comparable to the likes of the games I mentioned prior, with extra possessions like your tailored banner. The last thing I will say before I review this game critically is that it may be tough for new players, though if you research ways to get better online you will get through it. Now, since we have sung its praises with many more that I did not mention, we must now look at what apex does not get right or what it could fix to do better. Hacking is currently rampant in apex, especially in the competitive mode as you move up the ranks. This has been a problem for a very long time, possibly dating back to season 2 (when I started playing), when I was on console so at that time hacking was barely a concern or even not a concern at all, while when I switched to PC in season 3, I personally started seeing cheaters in game as soon as season 5. It also relates to the large incident that happened in ALGS recently, where 2 players (Genburten and ImperialHal) had their game hijacked, giving them esp with full hitboxes, health, and player names, along with bullet (not aim-locking) aimbot. Hacking is the only concern I will describe in this review because it has been recent, and is a genuine concern and has been for a long time. In conclusion, while apex has many great qualities I mentioned, there are some concerns that do not have to do with how the game is intended to be played. I would personally give the game an 8.9/10, because despite its shortcomings, it is unique, it can be tailored, and most of all, it is great, but its shortcomings hinder me from giving it a 9/10 (Amazing). Opinions can differ widely on how good or bad this game is depending on who you ask, so I am not expecting you to 100% believe in my opinion, and all I ask of you is that you at the very least consider it.

I can't really keep up. I don't play this game often enough like I could a few years ago. Call it a skill issue, but I don't particularly enjoy getting dunked on 24/7, because I can't retain all the high speed skill or understand how the base characters plus caustic work against and with the others. I've been playing since season 0, and the game has been in a downward spiral since Season 4. Apex has a lot of special things that make it stand out as a battle royal. Those are drowned out by issues that never get resolved, years later. They still have severe server issues despite being a top played game, matchmaking balance is a joke, and there is a HUGE CHEATING PROBLEM that Respawn/EA refuses to acknowledge. This is just a money cow, and they'll never fix it so long as people keep milking it.

I am going to be completely straight with you, this game has been completely ruined by aim assist (in a sense it is cross-play), but to put into comparison as you can see I have 3k+ hours as of writing this review and I very easily get one clipped with automatic guns by genuine noobs (and believe me I have run into enough smurfs to tell a difference) and before you think I am just bad (which tbh you wouldn't be wrong in thinking that) you can watch some of my game play at medal.tv Leafy1392 (only if you feel the need for comparing my skill). Anyway I can do a lot of movement and my aim is decent but every game I get one clipped over and over again, it has really become a game were the only requirements to be good is to play on a controller and get the right settings on the controller, and within 50-100 hours you will probably be able to reach masters rank... Other than that I really don't have any problems with the state of the game, guns are balanced, ranked is decent, audio is fine IMO (despite what most people think), I don't feel pressured to spend money on cosmetics, movement is fun, you don't stare at a corner all game *cough* Valorant *cough* , and over all I feel like if it was pure skill vs skill (mnk vs mnk and controller vs controller) it would be a lot more enjoyable. but in the mean time I have become fed up with controller and find it very hard to want to continue playing, so I can't recommend unless you want to be a controller player. Yup I know a lot of controversial opinions here. If you want to know more about how aim assist is OP watch a Youtube video on it, it would take forever to explain in this review.

Pros:
- Fun gunplay
- Decent modes if you don't like battle royale as much
- Cool events
- A variety of characters to choose from
- Rotating modes to keep the gameplay fresh
- Alright visuals
- GREAT sound design: turn that up

Cons:
- Respawn is deaf; they don't care about the community
- Kill-cams ruin the game; it feels like everyone is cheating
- You are heavily pushed to spend; overpriced cosmetics
- Server issues kill you; server problems which suck for everyone, even respawn
- Bad management; published by EA, you know how that goes
- Prepare for the Grind; yeah spend hours grinding battle pass and events
- Sweats in most games; see below reason
- Almost no skill-ranking system; you can be put in a match with a level 423 and a level 4 on your team
- A surprisingly long match-making queue; almost 300k people can be online but it still takes forever to get into a game, even one with no other people except you in it like the FIRING RANGE (just you and your party to practice mechs)
- Does not run that well on lower-end systems; yeah. also if you usually get more than 30 ping in a game you are screwed because that will turn into 300 with the bad servers

Overall:
4/10 - Please fix your game; worse than Team Fortress 2 in terms of "cheaters" - Go play Titan Fall

It should be illegal to even call this ranked matchmaking since it¬¥s not SBMM and they seem to not care AT ALL about trying to place equally skilled players against each other.

It¬¥s just not fun in RANKED matchmaking to constantly run into groups so much better then you that you have no chance of winning, to the point you sometimes even get literal pros on their main accounts not even smurfing in the casual mid ranked lobbies...... and/or getting teammates that are complete beginners trying to learn the basics looking like a toddler playing in your own team when you are mid skilled.

No but on a serious note, if, for some black magic ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• ery, the devs sees this, I have some genuine propositions to make this game better. If yall invest in the game, it's playerbase WILL grow and then you'll make more money. So here's what yall can do and I KNOW THAT IT'S NOT HARD TO DO:
- Fix the matchmaking: put people with a similar account level (about 200 or 300 levels difference), a similar lifetime KD/R (about 0.5 to 0.8 kd difference) and a similar KD/R during the last 2 or 3 seasons (something like 0.8 to 1.2 kd difference or even less). Then, in ranked, YOU PUT THE SAME RANKS TOGETHER, but you take in consideration their highest ranks of the last 3 seasons and you try to make them similar (you add the mmr of the 3 ranks and try to have a similar result for eveyone in the lobby). Then, if they party up, you just add all the values of each criterion and find similar parties WITH the other matchmaking method I just mentionned.
- Fix the servers: You guys have the budget to have better than 20 tick servers. Even Roblox does better. At least, give us some 60 tick servers or even more (if you are generous enough)
- Fix the anticheat: I mean, just put one in place. It's literally doing nothing rn. The anticheat team is legit living the dream, they're paid to do nothing. It would be a good idea to get a lot of the cheaters banned, right??? Right???
- Nerf aim assist: 0.4!? 0.4 is crazy ngl. At this point, the game is aiming for you. Just lower it down to 0.2 and give controller players the ability to move while looting deathboxes so they won't cry about it. This and like superjumps or 90 degrees tap strafes so it's still fair (kinda).
The only reason why I still play is because it's the only decent (even decent is a generous term) movement shooter I could find and there's no game similar to Driveclub to go play instead. So please, Respawn Entertainement, give me more reasons to me and the majority of your playerbase to play your game.

While CS2 and Dota are incredibly toxic, this community has a different type of toxicity. Someone will call you slurs over the mic, but if you type angrily back to them, only YOU get punished due to your message being in the chat log, but not theirs. It endorses the behavior you'd see in grade school where one classmate would start kicking your chair, but YOU end up in trouble for shouting at them to stop. DOTA and CS2 handle things far better through the implementation of a behavior score system that is based on the number of reports, letting you work back up to a better score if you've had a bad week.

This game flat out ROBS YOU of all of the money you've spent on it, banning you after being successfully reported twice. Don't let EA gyp you out of your money. Stay far away from this publisher.

I genuinely cannot recommend this game in good faith.
Yes, I have 650 hours played. Yes, I'm going to continue to play it, because friends of mine play and I want to play with them. But I will not encourage anyone to try this game new.
I like to think Respawn themselves have a good track record of trying to be good to the players. But EA chokes them out with pricing and forcing them to focus more on producing even more content that bleeds your money dry. A new currency was recently implemented for a cosmetic weapon you can't even get without spending boatloads of money on it. So that's an additional point where you're forced to grind or spend money. Great.
Next is the poor execution of gameplay mechanics. It used to be duo or trio queues, now it's solo or trio. They specifically removed duos to implement solos, and that absolutely boggles my mind. I play duos 999/1000 games, so now I'm effectively screwed for the entire season. Like sure I can play solos if my friend is gone, but suffering through trios with either just a team of two trying our best, or with a random player is just not fun.
But that's all talking about this season. Let's talk about why I, in general, cannot endorse this game.

-Absolutely no MMR. If you jump into the regular battle royale, you could get pitted against either absolute beginners who just got out of their bot matches (yes, the game starts you off with 3 bot matches, which are also incredibly dumb and don't represent actual gameplay), or it will put you in against someone who has prestiged 3 times over, is diamond or higher in ranked, and has clocked in 5,000 hours. Nothing beats getting sniped when you barely showed a pixel of your body out of cover. It's a frustrating experience.

-Game geometry can just screw you at random moments. Portions of the map which may either seem climbable, or are climbable, may just randomly drop you off. Or they'll not register you're climbing in the first place. Doors will hold for your enemy when you go to kick the door handle, but when you try to hold the doors they open backwards for the enemy no problem.

-Netcode is really poor. I've had instances where I get a clear meatshot on an opponent, the hitsound registers, but no damage is actually registered. Or I go down despite being fully behind cover after being shot by someone who was around the other side.

-It has the classic battle royale problem of "you can just get screwed when you drop". Half the time I drop there are no nearby guns, or a pistol, but my opponent has a shotgun or LMG and just gets to mow me down while I have nothing. And it doesn't feel good when I get that end of the stick instead and my opponent is defenseless. It's a lame situation and sucks to deal with.

There's a lot more, but that's all I want to compress this into right now. Please do not give EA your money.

I admit my PC isnt the best but I can run the game, when I'm ingame but thats really the biggest barrier to get ingame and be ingame for more than 2 min without crashing.

Picked the game back up for the first time since it dropped in 2019, and the boys and I have been playing since Season 19, now Season 21. Right as they finally start picking things up and giving more meaningful updates like re-spawning with your weapons, character leveling choices, and a universal heirloom; then, they decide to drop Duos from their game mode selection in favor of Solos. I'm just one of many players who enjoys the 'battle buddy' experience, and Trios is usually fine if everyone is online, but we just can't help getting frustrated at randoms. So when its just me and one of my friends online, Apex is just unplayable, on account of the sheer frustration of dealing with a new random every single match with no way to learn how to actually cooperate with them before the match's end. The game is still awesome, and we're still going to keep playing once everyone is finally on at the same time, but 'bold' decisions like these are a terrible business practice. EA needs to start hosting polls when it comes to decisions that divide their community like this, or the gambles they make with these decisions are going to draw the last straw some day soon. Surprises aren't fun when they take options AWAY.

I've played Apex Legends for over 400 hours on the EA launcher before I switched to Steam. (been playing since release)
The only reason I play this game is because I mostly have a great time with a friend.

So, you'd say that I'd recommend this game, right? I would if EA / Respawn Entertainment would listen to their community instead of making the game worse with every single update.

I have no idea why they can't manage to keep solos, duos and trios available forever. Unbeliveable that they have disabled duos for approximately 6 weeks because of the latest season that got released like a day before this review. If you can't find a third partner, you're forced to play with a random player, which is fair enough, but this sucks as well due to the voice optimization. It's really hard to communicate with a random player and based on my experience only a few will actually cooperate instead of minding their own business and leaving the match as soon as they get killed.

I'm also not a big fan of the latest maps, but it's not something that I hate. They just don't look nice in my opinion.
I wish you could always choose between maps you like, (e.g. CS2, TF2 etc.)

What I also hate is the fact that they cancelled an event called "Winter Express" during the last winter holiday because they apparently had released an update not so long ago and because of balancing problems, which could have been easily fixed if they simply removed characters that might have been too OP.

Long story short: This game can be fun, just don't expect to master this game quickly. I'm still not an excellent player. Be aware that EA won't do anything that pleases their community.

I like the game play. It is challenging if trying to solo. Its best to be on a team to help take down other players. The nice thing is you don't need a MIC to talk to other team mates, for they have this call out button for objects and enemies. I'd still prefer a team with MIC player. This game takes more strategy then just pray and spray. You essentially use a full mag just to break shields and another to down a person. That's why team mates are nice. Now For some reason the PC players are way better then console players. I've noticed at least one every game there's a squad or one guy that just whips the whole lobby. You learn to ignore those people and try to enjoy the game otherwise. I still find this game fun to play with friend and people you meet.

I just came back to this game after four years of not playing it and I was surprised to not only find it in a good state but also a state I still recognize. The game hasn't spiraled out of control and the freebies you get to earn are still quite accessible. Would recommend if you're a fan of battle royale* shooters with good mobility and a very charming, diverse cast of characters!

Do keep in mind that the game is a Battle Royale however, and if you don't enjoy losing the majority of the time then this game probably isn't for you! It's a great game with great gunplay and general gameplay, but it's not like a PvP game that tries to have everything be as fair as it could be. Most of the time you're going to just get unlucky and run into people that happened to get better loot, a better position, and may just be better than you in general.

It's a game that in my opinion you need to play because you enjoy it, not to win. But if that appeals to you, or if you already like battle royales? I highly recommend this one.

Con: ranked is a cheat fest. 30% of banned players last season were Master & Pred (the top 2 levels) - and that figure is only for those that got banned. There are cheaters in all levels, and in pubs. Just warning you.

I generally do not like FPS games, in part because I am not good at them, and also because I feel many have a realistic 'war' tint to them that I do not like to participate in. Apex has an aesthetic that I like, and game modes that I enjoy even if I am not a master.

The diversity of characters (canon LGBTQIA+ and neurodiverse playable legends!) and the sprinkling of lore makes me really appreciate what the devs put into this world.

I enjoy the game most when playing with friends I know, but mixtape in particular is fun with anybody, and the daily/weekly/season challenges are a fun goal to work towards.

As one of the most anticipated releases in the gaming world, Apex Legends has undoubtedly left its mark on the battle royale genre. Developed by Respawn Entertainment, the creators of the critically acclaimed Titanfall series, Apex Legends delivers a fresh and exhilarating take on the ever-popular multiplayer format.

From the moment you drop onto the vibrant landscape of Kings Canyon, it's evident that Apex Legends is more than just another battle royale clone. The game's standout feature is its unique roster of Legends, each with their own distinct personalities, abilities, and playstyles. Whether you're a cunning strategist like Bloodhound, a nimble scout like Pathfinder, or a ruthless assassin like Wraith, there's a Legend to suit every player's preferences.

The gameplay mechanics of Apex Legends are finely tuned, offering a seamless fusion of fast-paced action and strategic teamwork. The introduction of the innovative ping system revolutionizes communication in multiplayer gaming, allowing players to convey vital information to their teammates with ease. Whether you're marking enemy locations, highlighting loot, or suggesting a tactical retreat, the ping system fosters teamwork and coordination in a way that few other games have achieved.

Another standout aspect of Apex Legends is its fluid movement system, inherited from the Titanfall series. From sliding down hills to wall-running across buildings, traversing the map feels incredibly smooth and satisfying. The addition of ziplines and launch balloons further enhances the sense of mobility, giving players the freedom to explore every inch of Kings Canyon in search of victory.

In terms of visuals and audio design, Apex Legends excels on all fronts. The game's vibrant art style brings Kings Canyon to life with its lush landscapes, futuristic architecture, and dynamic weather effects. Meanwhile, the sound design immerses players in the heat of battle, from the thunderous roar of gunfire to the distant echoes of approaching footsteps.

While Apex Legends has garnered widespread acclaim since its release, it's not without its flaws. Some players have raised concerns about the game's monetization model, particularly the reliance on loot boxes and microtransactions to unlock cosmetic items. Additionally, the occasional server issues and balancing issues can detract from the overall experience, though Respawn Entertainment has been proactive in addressing these issues through regular updates and patches.

In conclusion, Apex Legends stands as a testament to Respawn Entertainment's creativity and innovation in the competitive gaming landscape. With its diverse roster of Legends, intuitive gameplay mechanics, and stunning visuals, it's no surprise that Apex Legends has become a cultural phenomenon in the world of gaming. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or a newcomer to the battle royale genre, Apex Legends offers an experience that is as exhilarating as it is unforgettable.

The game performs well with the recommended specs, and the gunplay is decent. The heroes boast intriguing abilities that add diversity to the gameplay. However, I ceased playing around level 12 due to the matchmaking system being unfriendly to new players. The initial game pitted me against bots, which was overly simplistic. In the subsequent match, I found myself facing premade teams comprised of players with hundreds of hours of experience in the game. Consequently, I couldn't even grasp the basics as I scrambled to find a weapon upon landing, quickly lost sight of my team, and perished within the first 5 minutes. I simply desire to unwind occasionally after work, but I wish the entire process, from finding a consistent team to learning heroes, maps, weapon spawn points, and discerning which weapon to use in specific situations, was more beginner-friendly and streamlined.

I adored Titanfall 1 and 2. Played both religiously for years, shouting from the rooftops how criminally underrated they were the whole time. Watching their playerbases fall off and then eventually go on life support was heartbreaking for me. It was like losing a very close loved one to a horrible illness.

Apex was like getting back together with an abusive ex that swears they‚Äôve ‚Äúchanged.‚Äù It‚Äôs never really the same as it was and, sure, they‚Äôve changed, but not exactly for the better. Still, I had nothing better and sometimes‚Ä¶it was like they were still that person I fell in love with, if only for a moment.

Rather than an abrupt, traumatizing end to a wonderful relationship, it‚Äôs more like a slow, agonizing grind of every single last shred of respect I once held for that individual. All that remains in my chest is cold hard lump of super-compressed coal, and it‚Äôs all that bastard Respawn‚Äôs fault.

"Apex Legends" is a popular free-to-play battle royale game developed by Respawn Entertainment and published by Electronic Arts. Set in the same universe as Respawn's "Titanfall" series, "Apex Legends" distinguishes itself with its unique cast of characters, each with their own special abilities and playstyles. The game features fast-paced gameplay, intense gunfights, and strategic teamwork as squads of three players compete against each other to be the last team standing. Since its release in February 2019, "Apex Legends" has garnered a large and dedicated player base, with regular updates and new content to keep the experience fresh.

I've played this game for over 300 hours over Xbox/Switch/PC and here's what I noticed:

1. Movement is great, matchmaking sucks.
The movement potential for this game (especially for PC players) is absolutely wonderful and definitely sets Apex apart from other FPS games. However, this also means there's an extremely high skill ceiling.

Matchmaking is pretty much a mess for anyone playing more than 5 hours a week. Ranked and pubs will have new players facing off against esports pros/streamers at this point.

2. Meta is pretty healthy, at least in terms of weapons
Pretty much every gun is useable in some way, and it's hard to say there are any obsolete weapons (except for charge rifle/p20 as of s20)

This game is really fun, and I have enjoyed it. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend it.

Like most games, aside from encountering the occasional hacker, there will be toxic elements in them. However, at least some form of action is taken against these toxic individuals in games like CSGO2. But not in Apex, especially when they use the in-game mic.
This has been an ongoing issue for years, but EA and Respawn have done absolutely nothing to address it. They preach about keeping the community a safer place and taking a stand against toxicity, but their actions speak otherwise.

1. Reporting players for toxicity only works IF they text to communicate. (In-game mic reports are ignored unless you actually record your games and send them footage of it via support email.)

2. Unlike what EA preaches, the in-game taunts for legends are anything but friendly.

3. The report functions for players who sabotage the game is just for show. Don‚Äôt expect any action to be taken against them. For example, trolls who loot your desired attachments, throw them off the map, and intentionally body-block your bullets in a fight. This even applies players who intentionally jump off the map to lower their KDR for easier lobbies.

As a day 1 player of Apex there are a lot of things that feel and still feel great, gunplay sounds crunchy and satisfying to unload into another player and hearing their shield crack along with the down sound effect is like music to the ears, the OST a majority of the time is really good and carries along an epic beat whilst you soar down to stake your claim on the map and the movement which is a slightly neutered Titanfall system still feels very fluid and satisfying, all of these things still mean a lot to me however I can no longer in good conscious recommend this game to anyone until they start shifting their focus onto fixing the games atrocious servers and bugs as well as the current level of SBMM.
At the very least in OCE servers all players in casual feel like they are sweating for their lives to win the match, this isn't entirely bad for older players but for newer players who drop in after their initial first matches are getting put up against these players which causes them to slowly stop playing. Along with the fact that their is always a constant in the same 3-6 legends in every match making many of the less popular legends even less popular making any purchases and time put into them feel worthless.
The servers always feel like they are having issues in just about all matches you'll for no reason either get no audio cues of players running around the location you are in, having your power just straight up either not activate (Mirage trying to place a decoy whilst standing/walking over a tiny rock) and having hits just fail to register for no reason whatsoever.
However the worst problem is from the teams clear disregard about the state of their game and more of an interest in pushing collection events and skins to get as much money as they can out of their playerbase.
Until they actually start addressing problems with this game I can never recommend this game that used to be to me and many others the best Battle Royale experience on the market. Respawn please either do better with the game with an Operation health for a season to just fix these issues with either no Battle pass or no collection event for the whole season or just pull the plug at this point as the game is just in such a sad state by this point

Overall really good game! The mechanics are solid, there are a lot of different possible loadouts and different abilities with all the characters so no two playstyles are identical.
The abilities themselves are unique and fun, the only shortcoming is that certain legends definitely outshine others, lowering the incentive for certain legends to be played, whilst simultaneously making it hard to play without certain legends, namely Lifeline.
But other than that I enjoy the game! There is always something to do, whether its challenges or collecting skins, lots of fun to be had!
