Rating: 5/5 Stars

Review:

Apex Legends isn't just another entry into the crowded battle royale genre; it's a revelation. Respawn Entertainment has crafted a game that not only meets but exceeds expectations in nearly every aspect. From its fluid movement mechanics to its diverse cast of characters, Apex Legends stands tall as a masterpiece of the genre.

One of the first things that strikes you about Apex Legends is its impeccable gunplay. Weapons feel weighty and impactful, with each gun offering a distinct feel and playstyle. Whether you prefer the precision of a sniper rifle or the close-quarters chaos of a shotgun, there's a weapon for every situation. And with the addition of attachments and weapon mods, the depth of customization adds another layer of strategy to each firefight.

But what truly sets Apex Legends apart is its Legends - unique characters with their own personalities, abilities, and backstories. From the agile Wraith to the defensive Gibraltar, each Legend brings something special to the table. Mastering the abilities of your chosen Legend and synergizing with your teammates is key to success, adding a level of depth and teamwork rarely seen in other battle royale games.

The game's map, Kings Canyon (later joined by new maps), is a marvel of design, offering a variety of landscapes and environments to explore. From sprawling urban areas to lush wilderness, every location feels distinct and memorable. And with regular updates and map changes, there's always something new to discover.

But perhaps Apex Legends' greatest achievement is its commitment to player satisfaction. With regular balance patches, bug fixes, and content updates, Respawn Entertainment has shown a dedication to listening to its community and evolving the game based on player feedback. Events, challenges, and seasonal updates keep the experience fresh and engaging, ensuring that players always have a reason to return to the arena.

In conclusion, Apex Legends isn't just a game; it's a revolution. With its polished gameplay, diverse cast of characters, and commitment to player satisfaction, it sets a new standard for what a battle royale experience can be. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or new to the genre, Apex Legends offers something for everyone and is a must-play for any fan of competitive gaming.

Steep Learning curve but very worth it once you get it down. every legend is different and has pros and cons. They all play differently so its a matter of finding a legend that compliments your play style. Play ranked, it will teach you how to move from cover and how to play smart. random pubs will lead to a wraith solo pushing and leaving as soon as they are knocked. Ranked has more of a chance that people will stay and not leave so you get more 3v3s. stay close to your squad, the third party thirst is real. On controller, 4-3 is your best friend. Smooth is fast. and so is autoaim. MnK is aimbot, no real recoil. Just being honest lmao. Last, get those shields up to purps first, more shield points equals better chance at surviving the gun fight

Difficult game, not without flaws, but it can be perfectly enjoyable and a very good game to get into if you are willing to OVERLOOK those flaws.


- Every mistake you make can be improved on.
- If you're good at the game you will snowball and be rewarded even further.
- All the gunfight and Legend mechanics are unique, interesting and detailed.
- Maps are pretty normal IMO, and not something that I'm enticed to care about.

Some players say that things like aim assist have ruined Apex, I don't know whether that's true or not, but I hope that if that IS a commonly-known issue, that the developers fix it soon, because I personally struggle to get into this game and knowing that small factors like these may be impacting my experience is not nice to think about.

Best battle royal game. When you starting to play Apex is like having a relationship. To bad cheating it's a problem in this game, sometimes servers and buggs happens when new updates comes or some of them are from the begining of S1. To bad devs don't care about improving this part of the game... they only like to make better skins.

To be honest, I never liked the battle royale concept (or, I was never interested in this type of games) but I changed my mind.

Let's take step by step:

1) Trio mode and Duo mode: It's very fun. You can play as solo if you want it to be more challenging. This is the mode I most usually play as solo queue. Of course, sometimes teammates go to crazy places but other times they go to better and safer places. It is not bad to go to the hot areas sometimes and try to win there. It only makes you good. When looting, don't go all together to the same place because one person will get everything and others won't. Separate yourselves when looting but keeping yourselves together in the same area.

3) Solo mode: Sweaty. Very sweaty, but fun. It should stay forever in the game because a lot of players like to play solo and it's a good way to practice. The good thing is, if you die, you have another chance.

4) Quad mode: Never played it with a full squad of friends, but as a solo queue player it's just a pain, in my experience. Teammates always land where everyone lands and everyone fights to get a weapon and everyone end up dying in like 30 seconds. One interesting thing is, if you end up dying and if your teammate respawns you, you end up with all your weapon attachments. This don't happen in Trio or Duo.

5) Arenas: never played it so idk. Right now, it's not in the game btw.


Right now, the mode available are Trios and Quads (late July, 2024) .


Mixtape (Gun Run, Team Deathmatch, Control, Lockdown):
Gun Run: You get one gun. Once you get a kill, you get a different weapon. Wins the team who reaches the knives and get a kill. For me, that's probably the worst mode of mixtape. I always try to avoid it.

Team Deathmatch: First team to get 50 kills wins. The best mode of mixtape imo.

Lockdown: Your team must secure an area for more than one minute. If you secure you get points. You also get points for every kill. First team to reach 500 points, wins.

Control: There's 3 areas on the map your team has to control. You get points by controlling an area. Once you reach 100%, you win. Teams of 9v9. You don't have much the problem you have in Lockdown.


What I didn't like about other games of this genre was that there were quite toxic people always commenting on your plays or how bad you were. I'm not saying it doesn't happen here. But I always turn off the audio so I don't hear what my teammates are saying. Many of the games I played, few spoke and few wrote in chat.

If I give up on a game, let it be for myself. I don't want to give up a game I like because someone decided to be toxic and bully. So, that's why I started to turn off audio and everything else. True solo queue experience.

The game itself is great. I like the graphics, the mechanics, the gameplay, the guns and most other things as well.
What isn't that great however is the fact, that since I started playing the game around 2021, I have encountered countless performance and server issues. This might be overlooked at the beginning but eventually they get frustrating as hell, especially when they do not get fixed at all.

One of my friends had issues with the game crashing randomly, while it didn't happen for the rest of us.
Then there were issues with friends just not joining into the game and remaining in the lobby while the game starts for the other two.
I have recurring issues with Package loss which apparently has something to do with Telekom and EA, and it just never gets resolved. Now since recently I have the issue that my game just closes completely without error message at seemingly random times.

There are countless threads online for those issues and they are persisent as hell, so the question is why someone like EA is not capable of fixing things like that.

I am a 54-year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing Apex .
I am a single father to my son, who is now 14. My son recently started playing Apex.
In less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours.
This was terrible for me because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son
because he was always out with his friends or watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam
account to play with my son. I started playing, but this was my first time playing a video game
since the 90's, so I was quite lost. I asked my son for help, and together we spent some hours playing Apex.
I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. Playing video games
reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought
me and my son closer again, and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well.

Apex has a refreshing take to the battle royale fps genre. The game has a very high skill ceiling, a variety of unique characters, and incredible gun play. Apex Legends really nailed movement, I've spent plenty of hours in an offline server doing jumps and glides.

Gun play is fun, diverse, and rewarding. There are so many strategies to play. You can play fast and close with an R-99 and a Peacekeeper, you can play slow and methodical with the R-301, or even play marksman weapons like the 30-30. Resource management and taking smart fights matter more than individual weapons as there are many viable weapon choices. Even "low tier" weapons like the Mozambique can dish out a world of hurt and get you out of a pinch if needed.

Apex makes looting very rewarding. Every weapon has slots to upgrade - from optics to barrel stabilizers to stocks. Cosmetics are also very good looking in Apex. I have quite a few nice skins for my weapons and legends. Unfortunately, Heirlooms (melee cosmetics) are quite expensive and hard to come by. I have easily spent $300 for just two Heirlooms on my favorite legends. While they are not required and only serve a cosmetic value, I wish it wasn't so expensive. Speaking of that, Apex has a loot box system called Apex packs. Luckily, they are given out often and for free, though you can purchase them at a rate of about $1 each.

Legends are unique with lots of lore, voice line interactions, and big personalities. Abilities are unique and augment gunplay. There are intel characters like Seer, support characters like Gibralter, and sweaty mantle-super-gliding bald wraiths with a peacekeeper to suit all playstyles.

There are a few negatives to Apex. Like all modern competitive multiplayer games, the game is plagued by cheaters. Surprisingly, cheating seems to be on the decline right now which is good but it is still frustrating when a cheater kills half the lobby with a charge rifle while midair. I also dislike the ranking system because it rewards ratting. Because the system prefers placements over kills, there are a lot of ratting players just hiding for points instead of playing the game.

Despite those negatives, I think Apex Legends is still a great game to play and the premier choice for battle royales. I highly recommend Apex Legends for anyone in the market for a fun and dynamic FPS game!

You wanna know what really gets me through life?

booting up the game and getting earraped by the intro, followed by a swift (20min) look through all the cosmetics and useless trackers. Considering Queueing up remember I'm antisocial and don't want a random, spoiler! (i have no friends) unchecking the fill party box and go in solo, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• it. I breifly turn into a mathmatical genius when I'm calculating where I can drop alone so I can be a loot goblin without interruption. I check and loot everything I possibly can until I have the sickest loadout ever witnessed. I chase the circle only to collect my thought at the edge. Oh no! What's that at the edge of my screen? PLAYERS?!? I hope they don't see me. Go out of my way to hide and plan a different route towards safety. 2 Squads left. I'm watching them fight from a far. I creep closer. THIS IS MY TIME TO SHINE! I will strike when they loot. I whip out my kraber. I fire oneshot. I missed! DESYNC! I reposition getting ready for the next offensive. This is where all those hours in kovak is gonna pay off. I aim my incredibly powerful 50 caliber sniper rifle once more. I miss. GO AGAIN! I miss. I get lasered by 2 R301's at max distance and place second. DAMN! Its not great, not necessarily bad; nothing is really all that interesting about the game. I used to play it quite a bit when it came out (On Xbox) and have tried to come back to it recently and it is nothing exceptional. Seems like a pretty cut and dry shooter that has a store that contains both overpriced crap and loot boxes. If a standard shooter is what you want I would still look elsewhere, the game play is lacking and promotes the same pay to play model that Rainbow Siege uses. It should also be noted that the game developers or publishers are very political and very vocal about it. There have been times where I have logged into the game to be greeted with a manifesto about the newest thing and why I should feel terrible about it. I would stay away from this one all together, there are other games that provide a superior experience in a less toxic environment.

Playing mostly on Origin during this game's first year, it was a fun alternative to Fortnite. Now that there is more competition in the Battle Royale genre, I'm not quite sure this game holds up as well as it did originally compared to others such as Warzone. I still recommend it since it's still fun to play, I just think there's better games in the genre today. I appreciate the differences it had at launch from it's counterparts, making this game more unique and less of a copy and paste of games in this genre.

The actually core game (mechanics, idea for a game, etc.) is actually really good, and most of that is thanks to Titanfall 2, it's PvP is good because of its unique weapons and movement, but the servers and matchmaking is and has been atrocious since at least season 9. Allow me to give a brief explanation....

Back its former glory days, the matchmaking was fairly balanced, KD actually meant something when it came to who should be in a certain lobby, and who should not. Now, KD means nothing, "skill-based" matchmaking doesn't work, the servers nearly run rampant with hackers, and every game you play you'll be thrown into a server with either smurfs or way-to-high-a-skill player (or both), and you'll rage and punch a whole through your monitor.

In conclusion..... FIX YOUR FRICKEN GAME RESPAWN

I have played titanfall 1 and 2, I started playing apex on day 1 excited by the prospect that the titanfall universe is expanding.

I kept going with that idea for 4 years without doubting respawn at all because I did infact enjoy every story element they implemented in the universe. I was so hopeful that I even managed to be good at the game to the point of matchmaking specifically putting me with ranked masters. (to those who care I didn't play ranked at all I just kept tabs on my K/D since season 4 specifically because the first 3 seasons had broken disruptor rounds, broken flatline and devotion, it started at 1.03 and in season 17 it firmly stayed on 1.50s)

When season 11 came out with Ash that was my golden period. I am a massive fan of Ash and simply by playing her exclusively I prided myself on being top 0.05% in kills on Ash according to Apex Status. It was a nice time. Then slowly but surely, my happiness was wearing out. Respawn started to take WAY too long with good stories with good gamemodes and zero things to be hyped about. Like they literally started to make the game worse and worse bit by bit. And frankly I have to say, Conduit was the final nail in the coffin, they said it themselves that legend abilities are worth 10-15% of the fight and the rest was the guns, clearly not with this character. I genuinely quit a week in that season.

One day I'm going to release a fanmade project video that will make me happy about the titanfall and apex universe once again. I'm just sad that it's going to be fueled by spite for Respawn's lack to fleshout their amazing universe.

I dislike this game :)
1- A game cribbled with bugs all around (even the menu).
2- Aimbot and aim assist and no recoil is legal here, no problem with that if you are a mouse/keyboard lover then get lost, you are not invited to the party.
3- Dynamic FPS where you can slide and climb walls allowing you to break the laws of physics at the same time (this is a feature here, definitely not some mis-development).
4- You can play with people all around the world, this is positive except people can now shoot you through walls thanks to ping feature thus breaking space and time (notice the sarcasm here).
5- A game suffering from a lack of novelty (to be honest, like any Battle Royale format).
6- A great character design (I am definitely not thinking of Bangalore instant noodle hairs, download the game for more, I will let you savour the other gold nuggets of laugh. Please note, this is better shared with friends).
7- An inclusive game where your character can be handicapped by sound bugs (or perhaps another innovative feature? Ear drum rupture perhaps?) Silent grenades (certainly explained because it is futuristic grenades), Fridge size ninja characters with lighter footsteps than a winter rabbit sprinting on snow (this is logical if you think hard of it, these characters are well trained, do not attempt this home), caliber .5 sniper than can also be fully silent (future is now old man, adapt!)
8- Free to Play! (Hopefully seeing the list above). However you can buy skins which, taking into account the previous point, allow you to battle your friends for the ugliest skin, have fun! (get your credit card out once you sold your house though, otherwise, you are just to poor)
9- A game that is only buoyant due to the lack of serious competitor for fast FPS (Old Gen Unreal, please come back, I miss you so much!)

I would personally recommend this game if you want to make other games more tasteful, as a tool for contrast. Download this software (yes I said it) at your own peril! You will have fun realising what poor development is and how conflictual development and marketing can be.

PS: I almost forgot, you have soda cans with your favourite characters on it, jump the horse and buy one! These are not buggy or laggy. Enjoy! :)

WOULD NOT recommend.
1. Game is full of bugs
2. Game is not balanced at all, you will NEVER play against people with similar skill levels or hours, the MM system is utterly broken and they have no clue how to fix it, 20 seasons they just cannot fix it.
3. People spamming n word in voice chat, but if you type back something like "st*u id*ot" you get 1week-perm bans, nothing ever happens to them even with proof sent to EA support.
4. EA SUPPORT, need I say more?
5. Anticheat is trash, free version of easy anti cheat that is only good for show, kids can bypass this anti-cheat version.
6. CONTROLLERS in PC LOBBIES, they have 60% aim assist and non-existent recoil.
7. SCRIPTS/MACROS rampant.
8. Teammates are always vegetables if you solo queue, but you only play vs trio stacked diamond/master/predators with thousands of hours at the very minimum.
9. Pubs are unplayable, for the same reason MM isn't playable either, they add SBMM to it so if you get 1 good game enjoy playing vs twitch tv sweats using 90 movement mechanics on you.
10. THIRD PARTIES, this game is horrible in that regards, you can hear and see when people are fighting across the map.
11. CHEATERS, so many cheaters, not only is the anticheat trash, but the server-side detection of cheats is nonexistent too, yes, you can just hack and rage hack all day without repercussions in this game, there's not even a simple detection of someone spraying from across the map 30 bullets all hitting i nthe center of your head with 0% failed shots, it feels like old fps games when there was no anticheat.
12. Microtransactions, the skins are HORRIBLE, they want 40-360$ for a slightly colored item, enjoy paying for lootboxes for A SLIGHT CHANCE that u might get a heirloom (super rare), I guess battlepasses are ok, you can buy once and if you grind each season to lvl 90 you basically get the money back to buy the next one, but outside a few gamba boxes and credits and maybe 1 cool animation if youre lucky, the skins are always super ugly and the last 2 super good skins always have trash animations that remove 90% of your screen when you use them, iron sights are also terrible and a lot of skins are p2w.
13. Servers, they can be ddosed, and that's the best thing it can happen to them, there are much worse problems, sometimes you'd have to restart the game because you're just sliding while standing still, bugs being reintroduced over and over and over and over again since season 1 to 20 in over 6 years since the game launched, they nerf guns then buff them back up, then nerf them again, and so on, actual good game mechanics they take away and leave only trash ones.
14. Respawn studios are TERRIBLE, I hope EA does "the usual" with this studio once Apex is just not milkable anymore because people wake up and say enough is enough.
EDIT: 15. Enjoy having NO AUDIO, the devs basically added a bloody icon to indicate when u can't hear audio AHAHAHHA they can't even fix the audio of the game, basically you will almost never hear footsteps of someone approaching you even if they full run all the way, if you are shooting or causing noises yourself, and no, it's not by design, the game litearlly just decides you don't need to hear those footsteps, a MAJOR issue that has been plaguing since release, they DONT CARE. they only care about your money, never give them a penny.

Overall the game is just terribly bad, yes you can tapstrafe neostrafe and do cool wallbounces and grapplings, superslides superglides and so on - they do have nice mechanics in it, one clips are super satisfying, one of the best game on the market, but there's a thing called "EA" and "RESPAWN STUDIOS" which are utterly holding this back that makes this game go from a potential A+++++++ to a max of C+, they don't care, they just want 360$ for god awful DEATH BOXES, imagine PAYING FOR A DEATH BOX SKIN.

All events are mega recolor trash, with modes that nobody plays outside the super casuals that boot the game every time a new event is on and then never touch again until the next one.

Rather install fortnite and start playing that instead of this trash, doesn't even have a re-queue button, you just keep bouncing back and forth between waiting times, they can't code a stupid re-queue button, everything is spaghetti from their game to their back-end trash PHP "code".

Apex is probably the most frustrating game to be a fan of. The gameplay is genuinely good, the movement in general to the gunplay to the weird quirks of the engine all make this game very unique for an fps and battle royale. Unfortunately it is run by one of, if not the worst companies in modern gaming. The servers are terrible, there is little to no cheat prevention, their level of greed is INSANE in terms of item pricing and the amount of collection events, and their matchmaking system: jesus christ, where do I begin. EA literally has a patent for their matchmaking system called "engagement optimized matchmaking", which is as ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• and predatory as it sounds. Don't play for a few days -> come back, get a lobby full of noobs that I destroy, next game I'm up against master/pred stacks. The game just rarely feels fair. It doesn't feel good to beat people who barely know what they're doing and it doesn't feel good to get crushed by people sweating their asses off.
At this point I should have a masters in education because of how often I get teammates who have only played a handful of games and I have to teach them how to play. Real shame.

Apex Legends: Where Attention Spans Go to Die (and Loot Boxes are Born)

Ever feel like you're trapped on a hamster wheel powered by Red Bull and existential dread? Then boy, howdy, has Apex Legends got the game mode for you! This frenetic battle royale throws you into a colorful, fast-paced world where the only thing slower than the TTKs (time to kills) is the respawn queue.

Legends? More Like A.D.D. All-Stars!

Look, I appreciate a good hero shooter, but in Apex, everyone seems afflicted by a severe case of gotta-go-fast-itis. Wraith? Phasing through reality like a discount David Copperfield. Octane? Stimming himself into oblivion like a hummingbird with a death wish. These folks make Sonic the Hedgehog look like a rocking chair enthusiast.

Loot Here, Loot There, Loot EVERYWHERE (But Good Luck Finding a Gun)

Speaking of fast, have you ever tried assembling furniture while hopped up on Pixy Stix? That's what looting feels like in Apex. You'll be sprinting from building to building, desperately searching for a decent weapon amidst a sea of mobile phone chargers and sniper scopes. Just remember, that shiny gold backpack you finally snagged? It probably weighs more than your self-esteem after getting sniped from across the map for the tenth time.

So, Should You Play Apex Legends?

If you enjoy feeling like a caffeinated squirrel on a sugar crash, or if you have the reflexes of a retired Navy SEAL, then Apex Legends might be your jam. But for the rest of us who like our shooters a little more tactical and a lot less frantic, this might be a hard pass. Maybe try tiddlywinks instead. It's faster to learn and guaranteed to cause less rage.

this game makes my cheeks sweat

Unless you have hundreds of hours to learn all the movement tech, have perfect aim and friends to play this with, I don't recommend this game. It honestly kinda made me hate myself.

My experience was just dying over and over again with little to no reprieve. The skill ceiling is just to high for me. I could spend literally 100's of hours playing and still be in the bottom tier of players.

The game has just been out for to long. The skill level of the "average" Apex player is ridiculously high. If you're new to FPS games, this isn't the place to learn. And honestly, even if you have a background in FPS games (which is my situation), unless you want to deal with getting stomped over and over again for (I'm not exaggerating here) 100's of hours to *maybe* get better, I would stay away.

I had to ask myself if was I having fun. And I wasn't.

And this isn't including the issues with cheaters and smurf accounts. I can't speak to the cheating issue, but I 1000% ran info multiple smurf accounts while playing.
Got locked out of my account due to EA's ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• systems and their customer support is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• as well.
new season slaps

Terrible ping, terrible packet loss... Not a fan of the support for this game anymore.
Wanted to recover all the things I unlocked on XBox live and transfer to steam, but to recover that account I have to remember the last thing I bought (Date and amount) that would have been over 3 years ago.
On top of that, the servers are the laggiest I've dealt with on a FPS. Did you walk around the corner and out of sight? maybe on your screen, but in the server you're about 10 steps behind that.
Grenades are how you start every fight. If you're not carrying 5 at all times then you're at a disadvantage.
Hit boxes are janky at best. You can watch a kill cam of a shot clearly missing you, but it registers as hitting you.
If you're not playing on console then you're automatically at a disadvantage. Console players get a soft auto aim, while keyboard and mouse is left to actually be good at the game.
They also took away Arenas, which was how my friends and I enjoyed playing the game the most.

I want to like this game, but the only care it feels like EA puts into this game goes into all of their commercials. They clearly aren't putting effort into the game itself.

The game is a waste. It is a battle royal made by money-hungry bigots. Basically, when you play a battle royal you are not looking for a character story you don not care about. You want an avatar that holds a gun and shoots when you click your mouse button. But the game really tries to force-feed you its characters who are not interesting nor edgy(in a good way) so that you buy their skins through microtransactions. They are all over the top and cringe and make you feel pain every time your character talks or if you mute them every time you see them in the pick phase.



And yet, it is not the most shameful and lame thing about it, they try to poke into peoples' third world nationalistic spirit, -which I believe is almost non-existent nowadays- to get into the characters that represent nothing good about any nationality. There are people of color with overexerted features same as an Indian, an English woman who is portrayed as a mad lunatic and so on, to the point that it is just simply racist.



I said the game is a waste because all the effort and graphics and gameplay design is just serving the purpose of tricking you into spending money on the game. I hope no one falls for their dumb racist and vomit-inducing scheme and the game gets abandoned completely.

pros:
- solid gun play
- mostly well balanced weapons
- movement and all the mechanics to it
- finally banned inhuman configs (Steam configs still exist though)

contras:
- same maps for the past 2 years
- build in 40% perfect aimbot for controller players
- unstable 20hz servers (Among Us has a higher tickrate)
- broken sbmm
- useless anticheat (people that say swearwords are more likely to get banned)
- only real content being released are recolors of skins
- major bugs every update (Respawn keeps firing playtesters)
- audio issues (missing footsteps)
- upcoming cosmetics will likely be more 500 $ deathboxes + ugly universal heirlooms (no one asked for it)
- unstable servers
- performance issues get worse every update


overall maybe worth playing casually, IF one can ignore all those problems the game has

Game really fell off with the quality and the company respect for players who play their game. Been playing since season 4 Assimilation, back when EA allowed the Respawn devs to put their heart and soul into the game they made Apex a gaming experience that rivaled all the BR's of it's time. Now EA is dead set on sucking every penny out of the remaining player's pockets who still ply their game. They allow leakers to "spoil" their upcoming updates and game changes and so nothing about it. It really takes the fun of new content out of the game when the whole community knows what game modes and skins will be in the game the next month of playing the game. In season 4 it was really innovative of them to have a whole character(Forge) ready to be shipped out in the game files with abilities and everything ready to go. Then to release a trailer that killed off the new legend and who is being replaced with a robot assassin. Anyway, EA and Respawn needs to go out of their comfort zone and make content that is innovative instead of using the same formula over and over again. Which is something they won't do. Please change EA...

I've got about 230-240 days(5500-5800 hours) between all platforms and all I gotta say is, if you like to grind and shoot things going at the speed of light 20% of the time then this is great. I have played since the first week but kinda fell off a few times to play other games like fortnite, cod, or some story games. This is because apex has a very off-putting feel to it when things don't change between seasons...why? I have no idea, probably because our brains have gotten so rotten over time that we need content thrown in our faces or we literally die. Anyways, I'll give an actual review and stop yapping. So in the beginning, it can be an interesting experience to say the least, weapons that have a unique look and feel, unique abilities with optional ways to play with them. It can really be a love at first sight, that is if it turns out to cheat on you in the future. This is a terrible analogy but I mean apex can change in a heartbeat. Lately with all these gun changes such as SMGs having huge movement nerfs and small but game changing accuracy differences to all guns. It almost feels like the devs are making every gun worse since maybe season 7 or 8. I say that since the early seasons, most guns were pretty bad(maybe I was), just in different ways. LOOK, if you want a competitive game that doesn't need you to adjust to new things too quickly like fortnite does, then apex is awesome but in the grand scheme of things, you might be better off waiting for another game to come out that you can think about for yourself, many people have mixed feeling about apex, it's either really fun or too sweaty for people that want more casual play. I would say it's the kind of game where you just kinda turn on and off to check things out or see what's up with friends and what not. But everyone has their own opinion so I would give it a week of play before you really decide what to do with it. WOW, I suck at this(I reread my review). I hope it gives SOME closure though, idk. My personal opinion, it's very good. Should you play it? YES. Are you going to like it as a first time BR player? Most Likely. And finally, will you spend over 150 USD for a cool thing that looks cool in hands? PROBABLY (Not me though cuz I'm cool...I did actually) Thanks for reading guys!

Apex Legends is a game I have played for 4 years, and I have definitely seen its ups and downs as time passed. I would personally recommend this game not just because it is fun, but because it has its own unique characteristics in comparison to other Battle Royale games like COD Warzone and Fortnite. You can certainly look up many things about this game, but I believe that it is most likely guaranteed you will find a legend in the roster that suits you best. There is also a great amount of customization in this game (Which can be very expensive if you choose to spend money on this game), comparable to the likes of the games I mentioned prior, with extra possessions like your tailored banner. The last thing I will say before I review this game critically is that it may be tough for new players, though if you research ways to get better online you will get through it. Now, since we have sung its praises with many more that I did not mention, we must now look at what apex does not get right or what it could fix to do better. Hacking is currently rampant in apex, especially in the competitive mode as you move up the ranks. This has been a problem for a very long time, possibly dating back to season 2 (when I started playing), when I was on console so at that time hacking was barely a concern or even not a concern at all, while when I switched to PC in season 3, I personally started seeing cheaters in game as soon as season 5. It also relates to the large incident that happened in ALGS recently, where 2 players (Genburten and ImperialHal) had their game hijacked, giving them esp with full hitboxes, health, and player names, along with bullet (not aim-locking) aimbot. Hacking is the only concern I will describe in this review because it has been recent, and is a genuine concern and has been for a long time. In conclusion, while apex has many great qualities I mentioned, there are some concerns that do not have to do with how the game is intended to be played. I would personally give the game an 8.9/10, because despite its shortcomings, it is unique, it can be tailored, and most of all, it is great, but its shortcomings hinder me from giving it a 9/10 (Amazing). Opinions can differ widely on how good or bad this game is depending on who you ask, so I am not expecting you to 100% believe in my opinion, and all I ask of you is that you at the very least consider it.

Title: Apex Legends: A Thrilling Battle Royale with Room for Improvement

Rating: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Apex Legends has undoubtedly solidified its place as one of the premier battle royale experiences, offering fast-paced action, dynamic gameplay mechanics, and a diverse cast of characters that keep players coming back for more. Respawn Entertainment has crafted a title that shines in many aspects, but it's not without its flaws.

First and foremost, Apex Legends excels in its gunplay and movement mechanics. The fluidity of movement, combined with the satisfying gunplay, creates an adrenaline-fueled experience that few other battle royale games can match. Whether you're sliding down a hill while peppering enemies with bullets or engaging in intense firefights across sprawling landscapes, the gameplay in Apex Legends is undeniably exhilarating.

Moreover, the inclusion of Legends, each with their own unique abilities, adds an extra layer of strategy to the game. From defensive specialists to aggressive attackers, there's a Legend to suit every playstyle. This diversity not only keeps matches feeling fresh and dynamic but also encourages teamwork and coordination among squadmates.

Visually, Apex Legends is stunning, with detailed environments and character designs that bring its vibrant world to life. The various maps offer a variety of landscapes to explore, from lush forests to urban cityscapes, each with its own distinct personality.

However, despite its many strengths, Apex Legends is not without its flaws. One of the most glaring issues is the prevalence of bugs and glitches that can occasionally disrupt gameplay. From hit registration issues to server lag, these technical hiccups can be frustrating, especially during intense firefights where split-second reactions can make all the difference.

Furthermore, while the roster of Legends is diverse and interesting, balance issues occasionally arise, with certain Legends dominating the meta while others fall by the wayside. Respawn Entertainment has done a commendable job of addressing balance concerns through regular updates and patches, but achieving perfect balance in a game with so many variables is an ongoing challenge.

Lastly, some players have voiced concerns about the game's progression system, which can feel grindy and unrewarding at times. While the addition of seasonal battle passes and limited-time events has helped to alleviate this issue to some extent, there's still room for improvement in terms of providing meaningful rewards for players' time and effort.

In conclusion, Apex Legends is a stellar battle royale experience that offers fast-paced action, dynamic gameplay mechanics, and a diverse cast of characters. While it's not without its flaws, including technical issues, balance concerns, and a somewhat grindy progression system, the overall experience is undeniably thrilling and worthy of your time. With continued support and updates from Respawn Entertainment, Apex Legends has the potential to evolve into an even greater gaming phenomenon in the years to come.

The core gameplay and movement is great, but for me the bit I love the most is that the variety in the different legends makes for a really high skill ceiling, and I love the aspect of mastering how to play and also play against different legends.

A lot of people complain about cosmetic issues, which I understand totally, but at the same time, you can't judge whether a game is good or not by literally just the cosmetic issues. Who cares about cosmetics when the whole point of the game is the gameplay itself.

Honestly if you have a few hundred hours to kill in the next few months or so then learning the game is actually super fun, would recommend to anyone who has played particularly Source games or anyone who just loves movement shooters in general.

Apex fills lobbies from the top players down, meaning that anyone that performs better than a lobotomized kindergartner gets the privilege of going into diamond/pred lobbies constantly. Matchmaking is absolutely broken and serves higher tier players way better than lower tier players. It essentially aims to feed low skill players to high skill players because most people don't want to stick around long enough to get high skill.

Most cosmetics are free to try to get in a lootbox but the chances are genuinely so low of getting something you actually want that you basically end up having to spend money anyways. Legendary skins just outright suck and about 2/3 of them are just recolors of existing skins. Event skins are generally very cool looking but will require special lootboxes to obtain, so unless you just have mountains of premium currency gathered from previous battle-passes you're spending money to get them.

The servers run at 20hz for some godawful reason. The standard for most FPS games is 60hz. To put into perspective how bad this is, roblox runs on 128hz servers. The tick-rate is so low it's possible enemies can shoot you before the server has updated to allow you to even see them. Not to mention the fact that the servers constantly have ping and connection issues themselves. You'd think EA would just fix these issues or get better servers but it turns out they don't even operate their own servers, they outsource them to other companies. They literally do not have the ability to fix the servers for their own game. This is abysmal conditions for a game that generates roughly 1 BILLION (yep, with a B) dollars a year.

Did you like Titanfall? What if there was a battle-royal mode and it was made worse? Oh, that‚Äôs exactly this game. This battle royal is for 60 players. There are several maps on which you can play in teams of two or three players. Aside from other battle royal games, this one has a unique characters to choose from that have a different impact on the game. Each one has a unique passive ability, an active tactical ability and an ultimate ability. Some characters are better than others, weapons are poorly balanced and in many situations you feel like there is a lack of loot. If you don‚Äôt like battle royal, you can try arena mode. It‚Äôs 3v3 team deathmatch played across several rounds. At the beginning of each round you have money that you can use to buy/upgrade your arsenal. To make matters worse, we won‚Äòt get Titanfall 3 because they found out how much are those stupid skins earning them.

DO NOT DOWNLOAD OR PLAY.(Super Dumb Issues)
I was new to the game and wanted to steadily improve through the levels with teammates with similar gear and experience. Instead what happened is we were fighting experienced players and loosing 100% of the time and being immediately eliminated because very experienced players are put in each game as a FEATURE. I paid toward some perks along with four other people but I'm happy to say that we've all been fully refunded now and we're playing a different game cooperatively. Such a shame because the game looked very nice. When idiots in the game design company say: "Hey! lets put high level players in the same level as noobs" you need to fire them for drinking and loosing the business money, what you DON'T do is implement this unhinged dumb‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ery. Until this issue is put right it will be a good game spoiled and what a great shame that is? I know a few other people on Steam who have uninstalled the game due to this mysterious insanity.

PS: If you have wasted money on this game only to find out its ruined by a dumb decision as I did, they're at least pretty good with refunds so don't be afraid to ask for your money back.

pps: I'd love to be able to ask the chick who made this decision what she was thinking....

Unfortunately it isn't Titanfall 3, but it does stand proudly on its own two feet as the best battle royale on the market. Every hero is interesting in some way and they're all pretty different in terms of gameplay. The movement system and gunplay have only been slightly modified since Titanfall 2 and are an absolute treat, as always. The lootbox thing is kind of a turn-off, but that's almost certainly EA's fault, not Respawn's. Overall, I highly recommend it if you feel like playing a battle royale with a great cast of characters.

I've played this game for 5 years, since launch (I had a prior account that was hacked 2 years back). It's had its ups and downs, but man, it's gotten to a point the game is so intolerable to play for its many issues that I've had to uninstall. The matches are approximately fixed, either by the game or by players who are cheating.

Cheating, hacking, smurfing is so rampant in this game that it is unplayable just on that front alone. However, the game itself fixes each match by dynamically adjusting variables throughout the match to try to achieve a desired outcome. Respawn wants to control the distribution of wins to losses per player to maximize player retention, which is of course manipulative. Such variables include team stacking, loot generation, dive speed, target tracking, bullet strafing, hit registration, damage count, mobility, even ping rate. Lord knows what I'm missing. When you combine all of that along with the cheaters, afk bots in mixtape mode, and smurfers --this game supremely sucks. I hate that I'm even saying this as a loyal 5 year Apex player, but this game is steaming hot garbage and I cannot defend it or even try to play it any longer. It is absolutely clear without a shadow of doubt that these games are approximately fixed, and the knowledge of that ruins any derived enjoyment from the game.

Respawn, you were close to something great but you had to ruin it. I'm happily uninstalling this game for good. Goodbye.

Apex Legends is a very good game, but it has terrible developers behind it. A game that becomes unplayable for two separate reasons in the span of two weeks is not good. EA/Respawn have shown countless times that they are unable to satisfy their customers' safety and their pockets. Even if this game is fun, I can not recommend it in good faith due to anti-consumerism tactics and the inability to keep their game safe for their player base.

First of all, the game's worldview and character design are excellent. Each hero has their own unique skills and positioning, from an assassin who excels at stealth to a heavy gunner with full firepower, players can choose the most suitable character according to their preferences and the needs of the game. Not only do these characters have a unique appearance, but the backstory is also appealing, adding more depth and replayability to the game.
Secondly, the game's combat system is fantastic. It uses a first-person shooter method, allowing players to feel the tension and excitement of the battlefield in an immersive way. At the same time, the game is also very rich in tactical elements, and players need to use various skills and strategies flexibly in order to achieve victory in battle. This combination of tactics and shooting makes the game both challenging and fun.

In addition, the teamwork mechanics of the game are also a highlight. In Apex Legends, players need to work closely with their teammates to complete missions and defeat enemies. This kind of teamwork requires not only great individual skills, but also good communication and collaboration skills. This mechanic not only increases the difficulty and challenge of the game, but also improves the interactivity and sociality of the game.
In addition, the game's graphics and sound effects are excellent. Beautiful graphics and realistic sound effects make players feel like they are in the middle of a real battlefield, enhancing the immersion of the game. At the same time, the game is also very well optimized, and it runs smoothly even on lower-spec computers, which makes the game enjoyable for more players.
There are a lot of cheats, and I hope to optimize the reporting mechanism and increase the intensity of plug-in detection and banning.

The free-to-play hero shooter that injects a dose of personality into the battle royale formula.
Instead of dropping in as a nameless soldier, you choose a Legend with unique abilities, like a bloodhound who tracks enemies or a zipline-slinging Pathfinder. This adds a layer of strategy to the fight, with teams combining powers for creative takedowns.
While there's a learning curve, Apex is rewarding to master, and those clutch wins with your squad are pure adrenaline. Just beware, new players can get stomped by seasoned veterans. If you're looking for a free, fast-paced shooter with a unique twist, Apex Legends is definitely worth a shot.

It is the best battle royale game for me, but it has some flaws besides the br.
Why aren't all heroes available to every player by default? This would make the game even more balanced and fair.
Additionally, the arcade modes cycle in a strange way. Apex has excellent gunplay and movement, but players cannot choose which mode to play, aside from battle royale. Modes like TDM or Control cycle in their own playlist. This mode, similar to Overwatch's Elimination game mode, was highly appreciated as the best game mode in Apex by myself, but it hasn't been available for what, 1.5 years? It seems that the developers are only interested in holding players for Battle Royale It would be beneficial to have the option to play a quick round of TDM or a similar mode.

The changes regarding armor not spawning on the ground anymore and the skillstrees in every match are easily the best thing that have ever happend to battle royale as a franchise. The br-games are balanced and beside some annoying ults everyone should have about the same base hp and shields near endgame. This makes the battle royale more enjoyable than ever before. gg respawn, you single handedly fixed the whole battle royale franchise with this season 20 patch.

Go check out Apex, play some matches and you'll find one of, if not the best, multiplayer shooter available right now. highly recommended.

Fun classic BR with ever changing rules and legends. I've played this game since season 4 and I loved it thru all the updates and pain. Made Pred and Masters several times on console, but the PC version is just not worth it for rank if you wish to push past Masters. Plenty of cheaters, teamers, and other nasty players.

Pubs are still very fun, but beware sbmm in this game is a *****. You go from rookie pubs to 3 stack Pred/Masters. Cosmetics in this game are very pricey and honestly a lot of is reskinned. Of course this is an EA game so you get a golden turd, play, don't spend to much money on it :P.

At this moment on April 1st, I would highly recommend that you not play Apex Legends as of right now. There are many issues with the servers as shown through players being hacked in the recent event that was put on. There are other issues but that is a main one - avoiding a company that allows a hacker to place programs onto your PC to give certain players an unfair advantage over others. Play another game like Fortnite or Pubg if you want to play a battle royale game as Apex is too risky to your own personal hardware to do that.

I used to love this game, played through the first few seasons (not sure from when but at least from the second season through the 7th).

This was the first FPS game that I actually enjoyed and tried to improve.

Why I do not recommend this game?

1)Nerfs instead of buffs in an attempt to balance the game:

Unfortunately, the devs kept making the game worse and worse, nerfing path finder's grappling hook speed, wraith's ability to disengage etc, which made the game more slow paced than it was when it begun.

Balance was needed, indeed, but there could've been other tweaks that wouldn't nerf the funnest parts of the game, which was the insane amount of mobility in combat.

This was just the foreshadowing of other glaring issues, Respawn was constantly trying to balance the game by making their most popular characters less and less fun and adding other heroes that, in all honest, were not as interesting. Instead, they should've focused on balancing the current roster by improving existing characters rather than them, however, nerfs was a trend that continued, which honestly just made me less and less interested in mastering any of the heroes.

2) Community just kept getting worse and worse.

As I've played the game I started to notice an ever increase in players leaving matches, AFKing during a game and hackers in lobbies, to the point that it didn't even feel like it was worthy it to have a team to begin with.

Matchmaking kept degrading and I would either be placed with people so much lower than my skills that the game would essentially revolves around dropping off of the ship and instantly dying OR I was queued with someone insane that carried the entire team without giving me or the other team member a chance to shoot our guns and, despite what some people might think, winning that way is NOT fun.

3) Present game is actually WORSE than when I quit.

After season 7 or 8 I essentially stopped playing the game and when I decide to come back to try the new modes that came to substitute arenas I was greeted with 1 match of AFK party members that were probably level farming their accounts; 2) A party that one of the members immediately left as soon as they died 2 times in a row and 3) Penalties for leaving an unranked match despite the fact there was no way that my team and I could win the match in a 2v3v3v3 situation.

I understanding the penalty for early leavers, however, if one of your team members already left, this SHOULD NOT APPLY TO THOSE REMAINING, otherwise you're just forcing your players to suffer through a match they do not stand a chance against.

3) Controller meta

I understand that controllers need some help, but as you can see by the "professional" players scene, which basically had most (if not all) serious pro-players switching to controllers (best example is ImperialHall), the aim assist is something that generates an unbalanced game that doesn't really allow for skills to be fairly rewarded and lack thereof, to be punished. It just hurts when you're playing the game and you get 1 clipped by some one when you're jump/strafing, wall bouncing and then you can't even figure out if the person is cheating or just on controller.

If you can't balance both inputs, those inputs SHOULD NOT BE PLAYING IN THE SAME LOBBIES, otherwise, again, it creates a frustrating experience for everyone as the game feels like it punishes your skilled players and reward those that choose to the "superior" input.

Td;lr: Respawn had a gold gem that they kept mining in the wrong way and instead of consolidating their fun game they kept corroding and corrupting whatever good the game had. Avoid this if possible. At this point even overwatch 2 is better than apex and that's a blizzard game.

Used to be a great game but the insane power creep in both legend abilities and gunplay TTK, the game has degraded into a mix between OW and COD. New legends/reworks such as Conduit and Rev with regenerating health make the original healing system useless in fights. Game items and systems such as the Evac tower and support legends allowing anyone on your team to run and craft your banners have made the only focus of the game running away. And this is just the negatives from the degrading gameplay.

Game is infested with hackers/cheaters now with pro players being hacked mid match. You never know if someone was actually good or just cheating. Their anticheat system Easy Anticheat is likely developed by 1 dude in a basement somewhere as evidenced by their completely inactive Twitter (not caling it X) account that suddenly came back from a 5 year absence during their recent cheating controversy.

Last and definitely not least is EA's magnificent impact on the overall pricing and pricing methods used for skins in the game. New bundles have only gone up in price with most being $25-$30 with only 1 decent skin and filler items. Character heirlooms are no more as "universal heirlooms" have taken their place. Apparently the previous "collection events" as they call them, were not enough with you having to "collect" (buy) 24 or so items to get the new heirloom. At least if you could not afford all of them, you could get only the skins which you liked in the event. This is now removed. It is all randomized loot packs only to make you buy more to have a hope of getting the skin you want. Oh and also the price of the packs goes up the more of the items you own in the collection event.

Any who, these reasons and more have killed this game. At least EA will follow their usual plan of milking Apex for the last bits of money, so they can release a new game and do it all over again.

Apex Legends is a free-to-play battle royale-hero shooter game developed by Respawn Entertainment and published by Electronic Arts. It was released for PlayStation 4, Windows, and Xbox One in February 2019, for Nintendo Switch in March 2021, and for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S in March 2022. A mobile version of the game designed for touchscreens titled Apex Legends Mobile was released in May 2022 on Android and iOS. The game supports cross-platform play, excluding the aforementioned mobile platforms.

Before the match, players form into two- or three-player squads, and select from pre-designed characters with distinctive abilities, known as "Legends". The game has two gameplay modes. In "Battle Royale", up to 20 three-person squads or 30 two-person duos land on an island and search for weapons and supplies before attempting to defeat all other players in combat. The available play area on the island shrinks over time, forcing players to keep moving or else find themselves outside the play area which can be fatal. The final team alive wins the round. In "Arenas", players form into three-player squads and fight against another squad in a 3v3 team deathmatch over a series of rounds to determine the winner of the match. Teams win when their team has at least 3 points and is 2 points ahead.

Apex Legends is set in the same science fiction universe as Respawn Entertainment's Titanfall series, with several characters from the Titanfall series appearing either as minor characters or playable Legends. Work on the game began around late 2016, though the project remained a secret right up until its launch. The game's release in 2019 came as a surprise, as until that point it had been assumed that Respawn Entertainment was working on a third installment to the Titanfall franchise, the studio's previous major game. Apex Legends received generally positive reviews from critics, who praised its gameplay, progression system, and fusion of elements from various genres. Some considered it a worthy competitor to other battle royale games. Apex Legends surpassed 25 million players by the end of its first week, and 50 million within its first month. By April 2021, it had approximately 100 million players making it one of the most played video games of all time by player count.
As a seasoned gamer who's explored the vast landscape of battle royale titles, I can confidently say that Apex Legends‚Ñ¢ stands as a shining gem among its peers. Developed by Respawn Entertainment, the same minds behind the iconic Titanfall series, Apex Legends‚Ñ¢ delivers a thrilling and polished experience that sets it apart in the crowded battle royale genre.

One of the most commendable aspects of Apex Legends‚Ñ¢ is its impeccable gameplay mechanics. From the fluid movement system inherited from Titanfall to the diverse array of Legends (characters) each with their unique abilities, every match feels dynamic and full of strategic possibilities. Whether you're gliding through the air with Pathfinder's grappling hook or deploying defensive traps as Caustic, there's a playstyle to suit every preference.

Moreover, Apex Legends‚Ñ¢ excels in fostering teamwork and communication. The game's innovative ping system allows for seamless communication even without voice chat, enabling players to coordinate effortlessly with their squadmates. This emphasis on cooperation adds layers of depth to the gameplay, elevating it beyond mere gunplay.

Visually, Apex Legends‚Ñ¢ is a feast for the eyes. The vibrant, futuristic landscapes of Kings Canyon and World's Edge are beautifully crafted, immersing players in a world brimming with personality and detail. Combined with smooth performance and solid netcode, the game delivers a consistently enjoyable experience even in the heat of intense firefights.

Of course, no review of Apex Legends‚Ñ¢ would be complete without mentioning its ever-evolving content ecosystem. With regular updates, seasonal events, and a robust Battle Pass system, there's always something new on the horizon to keep players engaged. Whether it's the introduction of a new Legend, weapon, or game mode, Respawn Entertainment continues to demonstrate their commitment to keeping the experience fresh and exciting.

In summary, Apex Legends‚Ñ¢ is nothing short of a triumph in the world of battle royale gaming. With its refined gameplay mechanics, emphasis on teamwork, stunning visuals, and commitment to ongoing content updates, it's a title that deserves a place in every gamer's library. So gather your squad, drop into the arena, and prepare for an adrenaline-fueled journey unlike any other.

Do I recommend this game? That depends on a couple of things.

First of all, this is a team-based battle royale. There is no solos mode (although you can play no-fill trios or duos if you are a masochistic maniac, or don't have any time constraints in your life). Characters are designed for teamplay and the game can become a slog when randoms don't care about this (which is more often than not). There are more casual modes to play if this is a problem for you, though.

What I love about this game: it has probably the deepest, most satisfying and most skillful movement system in a shooter. At launch, it near-perfected the battle royale format with a slew of innovations and QOL improvements, the lack of which would seem almost insulting to a BR player today. The gunplay and overall combat is slick, pretty balanced (despite some seasonal outliers) and also deeply satisfying. The maps are (for the most part) well-designed and interesting to look at and play in. The game has personality (despite some more recent Legend clunkers.) And the skill ceiling is really, really, really high (which is how I sunk more than 800 hours into it over several years, starting on the EA launcher.)

But it becomes difficult to recommend to certain people because of longstanding problems. Inconsistent and sometimes broken audio, designed to be lush and satisfying but not easy to hear what's going on around you. Inconsistent servers - more or less playable one night, then quivering under load the next. Rampant cheating in some regions (I play on London server and it's not so bad there, but I hear NA servers are hellish.) Many, many anecdotes of people having their accounts (which they had spent money in) permabanned with no warning because they used text chat in game with a username deemed offensive AFTER already having that username approved months or years earlier, with a non-existent appeal success rate. Predatory, increasingly lootbox-based cosmetic events with no way to buy what you want, only to gamble for it - on top of already preposterous cosmetics prices.

To summarise, if you like team-based shooters with really smooth movement that offer an incredibly high skill ceiling, and you have a good internet connection, there's almost nothing out there like Apex. Go play, get demolished, watch some coaching videos on youtube, start the fun journey of improvement, and eventually become a worthy Legend. Just don't give EA a single cent of your money.

Yo, bros! Listen up! So, like, I gotta spill the beans about this game, Apex Legends, but first, let's talk about something majestic: elephants! Yeah, those trunk-swinging, tusk-bearing beasts are the real deal! And guess what? Apex Legends is like the elephant of battle royale games, strong, powerful, and totally dominating the scene!

Alright, so imagine this: you drop into this insane battlefield with your squad, just like a pack of mighty elephants charging through the savannah. The graphics? Dude, they're as crisp as the sun glinting off an elephant's back. The gameplay? Smooth as an elephant's strut.

Now, let's talk about the characters, man! Each one's got their own vibe, just like different species of elephants, ya know? You got your agile ones, your tanky ones, and your sneaky ones. It's like building your own herd, ready to stomp the competition!

And the weapons, oh man! It's like having tusks of destruction in your hands! From pistols to heavy artillery, you'll feel like a bull elephant, charging through anything in your path.

But wait, there's more! The maps in this game are like vast, open plains where you and your squad can roam freely, strategizing like a pack of elephants on the move.

But hey, it's not all sunshine and peanuts, bros. Sometimes you gotta deal with some annoying bugs, just like when an elephant gets a pesky mosquito on its trunk. But hey, the devs are always stomping those bugs out, so no biggie.

Overall, Apex Legends is like the king of the jungle, or should I say, the king of the savannah? It's a wild ride, filled with action, strategy, and more fun than a barrel of monkeys riding on an elephant's back. So grab your buddies, load up the game, and let's charge into battle like a herd of rampaging elephants!

TLDR: (Conclusion) My final thoughts as of right now is that this game is really good and still has a lot of potential in it. However, if EA and Respawn don't start taking this IP more seriously, I fear that this game will collapse whether it's because of cheaters or just overall poor management of the game. As of right now, I can't really recommend this game as all of the problems have unfortunately pushed me away from it, although I won't say the game is bad. I just wish for it to be fixed and polished.

Make no mistake, I may only have around 9 hours on Steam, but have accumulated almost 3,000+ hours on PlayStation. If I were writing this review in the past, I would've highly recommended it as it was, in my opinion, one of if not the best FPS out there. However, over the years, there have been many persistent issues that are still rampant to this day whether due to Respawn's fault or EA's fault. I do want to highlight the positives of this game before I berate it though.

To start, the gun play is really good. Unlike Call of Duty or other games that have random gun recoil, guns in Apex have pattern-like recoil. Whether this is good or bad is up to you but it highlights that many aspects about this game are inherently skill based. The guns, while having been unbalanced for a while (such as the charge rifle being OP, especially in Season 3) are moderately fair and are able to be used because of Hop-Ups (attachments that buff or change guns). Overall, the gun play is solid and should be applauded.

I also want to highlight that this game is really fair in terms of enemy engagements. The time to kill allows for you to survive a potential surprise attack and fully counter which I think is a massive W for the game and makes the game a whole lot more fun as well as intense since one mistake could be the difference between you or the enemy winning.

The movement is also undeniably god-tier and fits the game very well. The common counterpoints against this appraise is that it isn't Titanfall movement and makes you feel slow. While I can understand this critique, I feel that the movement in this game fits it very well for being a Battle Royale FPS and also fits perfectly with the time to kill. In Titanfall, the time to kill is short/nonexistent sometimes which fits well with its movement, that being fast paced and breakneck. In contrast, Apex, while still having a fast movement system, is slower to compensate for the time to kill so that battles aren't drawn out to hell and back.

While this point isn't very massive, I want to point out that the community and randoms are some of the best people ever. Yes, there is the occasional toxic try hard that should really ease up (especially in pubs) but most people are really friendly and cooperative. I've interacted with some very great people in this game that are very understanding that I haven't really been able to find anywhere else.

But enough with the good stuff as the negatives NEED to be addressed.

First, the matchmaking is so ass. I used to play ranked and got diamond a few times. As such, I would expect to be facing diamond/masters players, even outside of ranked. What I get instead is Apex Predators (highest rank players) in my unranked matches. Now, of course this doesn't happen ALL of the time and I don't think that it's a bad thing that this happens sometimes. But, when I see them on a consistent basis, even if they aren't currently Apex Predator, it makes me cringe a little inside. And on the opposite end of the spectrum, when I still played ranked and I was diamond (wanting to go for masters but decided to touch grass), I would get gold players on my team and get steamrolled which is not only unfair to me but also my teammates.

Second, the servers. For anyone who has played half a Season in this game, they'll know what I'm talking about. While they've gotten a little better, it's still hilariously pitiful how bad the servers are. Lag is rampant everywhere as well as just general latency issues, leading to crashes and whatnot. I don't blame this issue on Respawn entirely as EA does back them up with their servers. I'm not sure what servers exactly that they're using right now so I won't comment on it much other than saying that it is also ass and is pitiful for a game this big.

The last point that I will touch on is the most recent controversy as of writing this, which is the tournament hack situation with Genburten and ImperialHal. The fact that hacks were able to be put on their PC's and activated because of, allegedly, EasyAnticheat's software is absolutely ridiculous. I know that this isn't an Apex thing as any game with this anticheat would have the same problem but it's still disappointing on so many levels.

This situation extends to the insane hacks that were made in the past as well as the cheating situation in the game as a whole. In the past, many speed and gun hacks were prevalent, being used to constantly troll top pro players and just make the game overall unfair. How the "anticheat" allows this is beyond me which is why I wasn't too surprised when the tournament hack situation came about. And while I could talk about many more situations like this, this post is getting too long and you're not reading anymore.

My final thoughts as of right now is that this game is really good and still has a lot of potential in it. However, if EA and Respawn don't start taking this IP more seriously, I fear that this game will collapse whether it's because of cheaters or just overall poor management of the game. As of right now, I can't really recommend this game as all of the problems have unfortunately pushed me away from it, although I won't say the game is bad. I just wish for it to be fixed and polished.

As a gamer, I play Apex Legends from time to time just for the fun of it. Nonetheless, I am frustrated by the amount of sweaty try-hards who play the game. Even if its fast paced I would like to play for once. The amount of players with cracked-out aim and reflexes quicker than those during a caffeine overdose makes it so I almost slam my computer with a baseball bat.

Wherever you look, there‚Äôs always a group of Pu**y's hiding behind every corner waiting to jump on you with perfect team coordination. For me, this never-ending torture becomes very frustrating when all I want is just one match for relaxation without feeling like I'm applying at Cirque du Soleil.

The fact that people rely on bunny hopping or slide spamming only worsens the matter making what should be calm gaming appear as Olympic level gymnastics competition. Trust me when I say that IT'S JUST A GAME, CALM THE F*CK DOWN!!

However, despite the hatred, there's still a bit of hope for us NORMAL players. We persevere, dropping into the map, dodging bullets and praying for that elusive victory. Because deep down, we know that skill and determination can overcome even the sweatiest of adversaries.

But hey that's just a REVIEW, MY REVIEW!!!
Thank's for reading
_______________________________________________________________________
UPDATE:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The game sure is a rollercoaster of chaos and annihilation where every move could mean victory or defeat. Sure, there are moments of frustration with the try-hards and the relentless action, but beneath it all lies a gaming experience like no other.

Respawn Entertainment has made a masterpiece of fluid movement and satisfying gunplay, with diverse characters and evolving gameplay. Beyond the challenges, there's a welcoming community, always ready to share tips.

And when you finally become victorious, whether with your squad or solo, the rush of adrenalin is like no other. So, despite the challenges, Apex Legends offers an experience worth diving into.

Apex Legends is a game I played a lot back in 2020-2021, the game has a lot of depth with its many characters and mechanics, the gunplay is satisfying and it has a lot of personality. But I gotta put the nail in the coffin with this one because it's just impossible to actually enjoy Apex right now.

The matchmaking sucks ass, you'll be trying to chill out and play a casual game, trying to get some challenges done or just going for a few kills, maybe trying out a new character and the game will put you with the sweatiest ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• I've ever seen. I've played a little over 200 hours (I used to play the game before it came to Steam) but I've seen so many Predators with 5000+ kills on just a single character while I've got like 700 total, and this is not even a rare occurance, I see players like this basically every other match. This game has a lot of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• to learn and it doesn't help that half the lobby is filled with people that are playing the game since launch, it's ridiculous.

It could be fun if the game was actually balanced when it came to who you face, because there really is a lot of depth and interesting gameplay here. But the game just feels depressing to play with the people I'm going against.

And don't even get me started on usual multiplayer game stuff, teammates giving up at first ring because they decided to 1v3 some random squad in the distance or just quitting in general (which is really stupid because now you can revive even after the banner expires with the Support passive), third parties completely ruining your fun, that one cheater or two that loves to ruin the game, that sort of stuff.

If you haven't played Apex, stay away from it. It absolutely hates players that are actually trying to learn the game on their own pace, unless you have no responsibilities and 10 hours to waste everyday, then you might have a small chance of enjoying yourself.

Alright, I like this game, it's fun, but only because it's new and I play with friends. This game has a few serious issues which makes me want to not recommend this game. It's a headache to run, from constant crashes every 1-2 games to facing infinite loading screens fro hours on end, the amount of bugs I've tried to fix are endless, and pretty much none of them are on my end. I've checked, trust me. The issues are Apex specific, they never happen with another game, and if not for friends, I would not have touched this game. This game feels less playable than cyberpunk at launch, that's how bad it can be. Of course I've managed to fix some issues, but there's always some other issue which I end up facing. Plus EA literally collects data on you in game. I am not kidding I have spent at least 10 hours trying to get in and be able to play the game rather than playing. I will probably continue to play this game for a bit before I fully quit it but I can't really recommend it to anyone, as of now, it's been a net negative experience. There is also the matter of fact that cheaters are ridiculously rampant to the point that I'm most likely getting cheaters in silver lobbies, and if they're not cheaters, if I'm wrong, then they are not silver players, which makes playing competitive not fun. These same cheaters can have remote control access to your computer and download potential viruses on your computer while playing the game. Do you want to know one of the fixes to make this game work? Turn off your antivirus and firewall as they may be interfering with Apex Legends.
