In the vast landscape of video games, few titles have managed to achieve the level of acclaim and admiration that Apex Legends has garnered since its release. Developed by Respawn Entertainment, Apex Legends has risen to prominence as not just a game, but a cultural phenomenon. As a passionate gamer who has explored countless virtual worlds, I can confidently assert that Apex Legends stands tall as the pinnacle of gaming excellence, surpassing its competitors in numerous aspects and setting a new standard for what it means to be the best game in the world.

At the heart of Apex Legends' greatness lies its unparalleled gameplay experience. Unlike traditional battle royales, where players engage in generic shootouts on a static map, Apex introduces a cast of Legends, each with their own distinct abilities and personalities. This innovative approach injects layers of strategy and depth into every match, challenging players to not only master gunplay but also synergize with their teammates and utilize their Legends' abilities to outmaneuver and outsmart their opponents.

One of the most compelling aspects of Apex Legends is its emphasis on teamwork and communication. The game's ping system, a stroke of genius in game design, allows players to convey vital information with remarkable ease, fostering a sense of camaraderie and cooperation among teammates. Whether you're signaling enemy locations, suggesting loot, or coordinating your next move, the ping system ensures that every player, regardless of their communication preferences, can contribute effectively to their team's success.

Moreover, Apex Legends excels in its dynamic and ever-evolving gameplay. The introduction of new Legends, weapons, and gameplay mechanics with each season keeps the experience fresh and exciting, ensuring that players always have something new to discover and master. From the pulse-pounding action of the Arenas mode to the high-stakes battles in the main battle royale, Apex offers a diverse array of experiences that cater to a wide range of playstyles and preferences.

Beyond its gameplay innovations, Apex Legends boasts a rich and immersive world filled with lore and storytelling. The game's lore unfolds through in-game events, animated shorts, and interactive storytelling, drawing players into its vibrant universe and captivating them with its rich tapestry of characters, conflicts, and mysteries. Whether you're delving into the tragic past of Bloodhound or uncovering the enigmatic origins of the Apex Games, there's a depth to Apex Legends' narrative that sets it apart from its peers.

Apex Legends' technical prowess is also deserving of praise. The game's stunning visuals, smooth performance, and impeccable netcode ensure that players are fully immersed in the action, with minimal distractions or technical hiccups. Whether you're traversing the lush landscapes of Kings Canyon or engaging in intense firefights in the sprawling urban environments of World's Edge, every moment in Apex Legends is a testament to Respawn's dedication to delivering a polished and seamless gaming experience.

Furthermore, Apex Legends' community is a shining example of positivity and inclusivity in the gaming world. Unlike some online communities plagued by toxicity and negativity, the Apex community is known for its warmth, friendliness, and willingness to help fellow players improve. Whether you're teaming up with strangers in matchmaking or playing with friends in a premade squad, the camaraderie and sportsmanship exhibited by the Apex community elevate the game to new heights.

In terms of monetization, Apex Legends adopts a consumer-friendly approach that prioritizes player satisfaction over profits. While the game offers a variety of cosmetic items for purchase, including character skins, weapon camos, and emotes, these items are purely optional and have no impact on gameplay. This ensures that every player, regardless of their spending habits, can enjoy the full Apex experience without feeling pressured to spend money to remain competitive.

In conclusion, Apex Legends isn't just the best game in the world‚Äîit's a masterpiece that has redefined what it means to be a multiplayer shooter. With its innovative gameplay, emphasis on teamwork and communication, dynamic gameplay, rich storytelling, technical excellence, inclusive community, and consumer-friendly business model, Apex Legends stands as a shining example of gaming done right. Whether you're a hardcore competitive gamer or a casual player looking for some fun, Apex Legends offers an unparalleled gaming experience that is sure to leave a lasting impression.

I used to have a deep love for this game, but unfortunately, it has been completely marred by the presence of cheaters. Season 20 held so much promise, yet it has become virtually unplayable due to this issue. Respawn urgently needs to reconsider their approach to dealing with hackers. Playing in ranked mode has become a disheartening experience.

Here are a few suggestions:

1. Implementing death cams across all game types could significantly reduce false reports and provide clearer evidence of cheating.

2. Setting a minimum requirement for kills, such as 2000 kills, before allowing players to participate in ranked matches would deter cheaters who easily create new accounts to exploit the system.

3. Enforcing tracker banners to display essential statistics like kills, wins, and games played would offer better insight into the players encountered. Allowing players to conceal their stats only fuels suspicion and undermines the integrity of the game.

4. Offer PC players the choice to disable crossplay! It's illogical to grant console players this feature while neglecting PC users.

Yes

Microtransactions and Loot Boxes: Like many free-to-play games, Apex Legends utilizes microtransactions and loot boxes as part of its monetization strategy. Some players argue that this creates a pay-to-win environment or encourages spending beyond what feels fair or reasonable.

Balance Issues: Balancing characters, weapons, and abilities in a multiplayer game can be challenging. Some players may feel that certain characters or weapons are overpowered, leading to frustration and imbalance in gameplay.

Server and Technical Issues: Online multiplayer games like Apex Legends rely on stable servers to provide a smooth gaming experience. However, server outages, lag, and other technical issues can disrupt gameplay and frustrate players.

Skill-based Matchmaking: While skill-based matchmaking is intended to pair players of similar skill levels, some players feel that it leads to unbalanced matches, where they are pitted against opponents who are significantly better or worse than they are.

Content Updates and Support: Maintaining a healthy player base and keeping the game fresh with regular updates and new content is crucial for the longevity of a multiplayer game. Some players may feel that Apex Legends lacks sufficient updates or fails to address community feedback and concerns adequately.

Toxicity and Community Behavior: Like many online multiplayer games, Apex Legends can sometimes suffer from toxicity in its player community. Negative behavior such as harassment, cheating, or griefing can detract from the overall experience and drive players away.

Repetitive Gameplay: Despite its unique mechanics and engaging gameplay, some players may find Apex Legends' gameplay loop to become repetitive over time, especially if they prefer more variety or complexity in their gaming experiences.

Optimization and Performance: Depending on players' hardware and system specifications, they may encounter performance issues or struggle to achieve smooth framerates, impacting their enjoyment of the game.

Now lets to rate graphic and game play and final rate:

Graphic
It's so good and modern but the game need a good pc for a normal fps, if you have a low-end I advise you not to play it.
Characters
There are many characters, which makes the game take time to understand and get used to one character.
Like the characters, there are many, varied, and unique weapons, such as electric weapons, weapons with a specific type of bullet, shotguns, and snipers. All of these things are fun.
The map is very large, you do not know where to go and what is happening, and the number of players is small compared to the size of the map.
8.5/10, Worth a try!

+
Gun-play is fun, movement is fun, playing with friends when it's going well is fun, the combat is generally satisfying.

-
Garbage matchmaking, no match abandonment penalties, people actively land separately from the team by a couple hundred meters and then ragequit. You're practically forced to play with a premade squad which removes all the fun of meeting other people in a massively multiplayer game.
The character design is absolute ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• and that's still an understatement - I don't know who RE and EA are hiring for their art department but they surely have either 5 minute deadlines per project or they have no directors whatsoever.
There is zero moderation for names, text and voice chats, or verification systems for reporting people; which leads to false flags, racist neanderthals screaming into their 50 cent microphone, and whatever else.
And in line with the recent news about a massive security breach, a lot of trust for the devs has been incinerated because they have yet to make any formal announcement on this platform.

As soon as I loaded up the game my balls started to tingle and I knew something wasn't right. I looked to the reviews for an answers and there I found it. This game had given me ball cancer, and so I knew I needed to cut my own balls off as soon as possible. I grabbed a pair of kid safe scissors and proceeded to hack off my own sack. Once about halfway through cutting I heard someone break into my house through a window, I knew I needed to speed up the process so I quickly ripped my balls the rest of the way off. I heard the stranger walking up the stairs to my room. I tried to hide in the corner facing the wall, with the tactic of, if I can't see him, he can't see me. His foot steps got closer and closer until he was right behind me. In under 10 seconds he shot on my back, and just as fast as he came he was gone. So there I sat in my room mewing, bleeding from my groin, and my back as solid as a rock. Never again will my life be the same after bearing witness to this game.

Due to match making setting up new players with expert level players the learning curve is so steep that it takes any fun of this game out of the equation when starting off. This is not a game you can jump into and feel like your providing any help to your team right out of the gate. It would probably take a month or more practicing in the firing range using different configurations, and range techniques to even get to a decent player status level. But that's boring as who wants to play against bots for that long.

Edit: Just watched multiple 2024 YT videos from multiple guys that have been playing this game for a long time and they have pointed out there is some massive cheating going on in this game. That along with what I previously mentioned makes the grind one of the most challenging and frustrating ever.

APEX LENGENDS IS THE BEST GAME EVER

This game would be more fun if it wasn't owned by EA. Constant failures on Respawn's part due to EA being the greedy ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• they are. They rent 20 tick servers, causing multiple problems including but not limited to: Severe rubber banding, net code errors, servers dying when a new update or season drops, dying 3 seconds after going behind cover due to the refresh rate of the servers, and hit reg issues out the ass. Another sticking point is the non existent anticheat. Aimbotters, walls, silent aimbot, DDOSing, servers populated entirely by bots (not bad players the actual bot), and people connecting into console lobbies from pc and cheating on there. Also, EA is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• greedy and the monetization of this game is super scummy; $140 melee cosmetics, bundles costing anywhere from $20-$30, the battlepass is rarely worth it, not to mention they are introducing new collection events costing around $360 for a cosmetic death box (equivalent to a digital gravestone). They are charging $350 for a DIGITAL ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• BOX that only people who kill you can see, and that's only in a couple game modes since others don't even have players drop a box when they die. Not to mention the community being either pants on head retarded or haven't left their game since the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• pandemic started, so not playing with friends is a gamble on whether you get someone who has a favorite flavor of crayon or someone who spends half their paycheck on blood pressure medication (and god help you if you live in the EU and have to listen to some of the most 1600-ass slurs known to man). The only decently designed part of this game are the actual characters since most are actually fun depending on your playstyle.

TLDR: Owned by a greedy, scummy company. Monetization is horrible and also scummy. Game runs like old people ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. Not worth the time or financial investment.

The game should be great, in theory. However the community is awful. Either the game matches me up with someone who has no clue what they're doing and just wants to loot the entire game... or someone who never has stopped playing a day in their life and blames you for their death as the rush into the middle of two teams in the open. The cosmetics are overpriced for mid quality skins. Don't get me started on heirlooms. Severs need an upgrade. Truly a toxic cesspool for sweats and tears to collectively feed a greedy corporations profits.

In 2010 then-president of EA said something about single-player games being ‚Äúfinished‚Äù. Here we are now with EA publishing one of the best and most successful single-player titles of 2019 under its wing.

Fallen Order tells an original story of Cal Kestis, an apprentice jedi hiding on a scrapyard planet called Bracca. Once he gets found by the Empire hunting the jedi and rescued by some strangers, he learns that the goal of his saviours is to restore the fallen Jedi Order. Having really no other place to go to, Cal agrees to help and embarks on a journey full of danger and failures, but also with a lot of soul-searching and new friends.
The main advantage of the story is its characters. The main cast is not only always there for Cal, either just to chat about everyday things on the ship or to actually listen to his problems and be a genuine support on the journey, but they also impact the events of the game in a not-so direct way. Greez is being hunted by space gangsters which give you a hard time later, Cere .
Probably the most important character though, is our companion who is always there for us. Although the little droid, BD-1 doesn‚Äôt really say words, he communicates really well with Cal. The ‚Äúdialogues‚Äù between the two form a very cool dynamic and really bond us with the two characters.
Generally the writing of this game is amazing. The quieter moments with the crew members feel genuine and immersive. It‚Äôs this kind of absorbing story in which instead of saying ‚Äúoh it‚Äôs a trap, nice‚Äù, you say ‚ÄúDAMN IT CAL IT‚ÄôS AN OBVIOUS FU.CKING TRAP DON‚ÄôT GO IN THERE PLEASE‚Äù
Also, The Hot Goth Alien Cult Mommy.

In terms of gameplay, I'd say this is a softcore souls-like. An enemy that kills you takes your current xp and sends you back to your last meditation circle. To recover your xp you have to reach him again and hit him. Now it‚Äôs a cool attempt to make you more careful not to die and lose stuff, but it‚Äôs not really working. I was playing on second to hardest difficulty and honestly, I either did not care about the lost xp (it‚Äôs really easy and fast to farm back) or I just went and hit the guy that killed me not even because I wanted my experience back, but because he was just in the way.
The combat is sweet. You can do parries and precision dodges or just roll around if you don‚Äôt feel comfortable with your timing. Low on health? Call out to BD to toss you a stim right into your hand. Fighting with your lightsaber lets you do a variety of moves such as throwing it at enemies or literally teleporting to them to close in on them faster. Your fancy glowstick also has a two-sided mode ‚Äì it exceeds at fighting groups of enemies. It also has an attack in which you dual wield the glowstick and many players wish that this was a permanent mode.
You can also use The Force. In combat you can slow enemies down, pull them towards you or (my personal favorite, classic move) yeet them off a cliff (as a side note - many games have cocky enemies talking sh.it, and then get their asses floored seconds later, but hearing a clone yell ‚ÄúYOU ARE NOTHING COMPARED TO ME, JEDI" while falling down the abyss after getting yeeted off a cliff face is something else). Powers have many versions; a charged push can throw away multiple clones or even a big troll-thing.
The Force is also used to solve many different environmental puzzles either to progress or to unlock a secret. Outside of combat you explore several places in the galaxy. You move around by climbing some plants, wall running, swinging on some vines, etc. Cal runs and jumps (man, hopping around was just so cool to me) around in a very intuitive way and it‚Äôs all incredibly animated. What I must say though, is that swimming overall feels very off and has some really bizarre animations.
At first visit to some places the exploration feels really natural and immersive. I hardly ever got lost anywhere, even in the more open areas, and if I was ever in trouble, I could always use the map to see unexplored paths I had left.
Unfortunately, backtracking to certain locations to get the leftover secrets and chests is an absolute disaster. Dathomir is a great planet, it‚Äôs a challenging, beautiful wasteland with cool lore and story. Going back to it and trying to reach the swamp area again is just a sh.itshow though. It‚Äôs so unnecessarily convoluted. It even seems like in this one place, past the bridge in the village should be an opening to just let you through. Instead, it‚Äôs blocked by this little wooden wall that you can‚Äôt jump over, so you must go around the whole location. It‚Äôs a serious flaw that is not only easily fixable, but just feels like somebody just forgot to put something there.

The game looks very good and has some amazing landscapes. It also has a photo mode to play with. Regarding animation ‚Äì most of them are amazing and very creative (BD tossing you heals is just so good). Besides swimming, the only complaint would be the lack of finisher animations. Some foes only have one and others get repetitive after a while.

Now the sound design ‚Äì maaan, this is THE science fiction game. The space crafts flying around, blasters shooting, things exploding, funny glowsticks swinging around. They‚Äôre not only high quality and very characteristic, but they all just have the oompff you know? The soundtrack amazingly complements the vibe. It‚Äôs very movie-like. What blew my mind is that if you listen to the OST album of this game on Spotify PC, it replaces the player bar with an extending lightsaber. How cool is that?

I didn‚Äôt really encounter any technical issues, but what‚Äôs funny is that there is an infinite jumping glitch in the game that they did not patch. It‚Äôs not really that useful though, because you skip many invisible triggers while using it and it screws up the collision and map loading. It is funi.

I was never a Star Wars fan. This is probably my first encounter with this franchise since Republic Commando on Xbox Classic or randomly seeing The Clone Wars on TV. Nothing wrong with the universe itself, I just never really got hooked by it.
I was never a Star Wars fan, but luckily Fallen Order doesn‚Äôt require you to be one. It‚Äôs a wonderful adventure by itself. Maybe even a good starting point into the SW universe for a newbie like myself ‚Äì and don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôm in no position to say that this is a good piece of the Star Wars media not knowing the rest of it. Nonetheless, from my experience with it, I can say that it‚Äôs enough to get you hooked on.

As someone with 1700+ hours on Steam and 3600 hours on Origin, I feel confident in saying, the game is not what it used to be, it was my main game, the game that i thought about on my way home from work, the game i couldnt wait to boot up and play with my brother and friends, however, since around the time that seer came out, the game changed from what it used to be, is it still fun? Yes, is it still (in my opinion) the best BR game out right now? Possibly, the cheaters are so obvious and obnoxious now and EA/Respawn seem to not care at all, hopefully the game gets restored to what it used to be, they need to stop focusing on marketing and political correctness and focus more on making the game playable for the casual player, not everyone has time to put the hours in to be really really good.

I'll be honest, I'm not a huge fan of Apex Legends, but I want to provide a brief and impartial review. The game runs smoothly, although I find the movement not as fluid as Titanfall in my opinion. The characters have interesting abilities, but they didn't resonate with me. My main concern is the perceived imbalance in gameplay, especially with players feeling like bullet sponges and shield durability being unreasonably high. While I acknowledge the game's reputation, it didn't resonate with me overall.

I've been playing Apex for years and it's always one of if not is my go to game(s). The selection of characters is vast so there is most definitely somebody for everyone's play-style, with new legends being added about every other season. Along with that there are countless guns and new ones being added about as often as new legends, from snipers to sub-machine guns and pistols, they've got 'em all. Even though there are purchasable skins with premium currency (apex coins) the ones you can earn thru apex packs and for free during events are pretty good on their own. That being said my only real complaints about this game after all these years are how many cheaters/modders there are and the fact that the apex coins have never gone on sale.

Nearly impossible to have fun due to unfair matchmaker. Not recommended to people who don't have much experience with shooters.

The way Apex Legends mixes elements of character-based shooters with the battle royale mode is pretty interesting. The game is fast-paced, with many high risk, high reward movement mechanics that require timing and skillful aiming to execute properly. It can be super fun.
The only problem is matchmaking: The game seemingly doesn't differentiate good players from bad ones. You constantly get put up against people who have been playing since release and they simply don't allow you to have any fun. 95% of the time I was getting killed in a single burst by someone with 34 000 kills or more. Even though I only have 230 hours of play time and absolutely suck at the game by comparison...
It's a shame, because it can be a really good game for everyone, were it not for this one flaw.

Man, I never thought there would be a day I give this game a bad review but it has cometh. This game has just turnt zoggy ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, I thought that the new armor update and the change back to old ranked would be better but once again. . . I was proven wrong. I liked playing this game back in my last 2 high school years but that game is gone because just like most the games these days: the devs and the community. The magic that this game once had just vanish in plain sight. I'm too lazy to go into actual detail why but I will say: the changes they made. suck.

I can't recommend this game to the "Casual" gamer, there is ZERO SBMM, as a player with moderate skill I find myself in lobbies against the top of the food chain (Preds, Masters and Diamonds) in every game, and to add insult to injury it pairs me with new and low skilled players on my team. So my teammates die quickly which leaves me to fight 3 stack high skilled players by myself. If this isn't bad enough the cheaters with aim bot and wall hacks currently run this game, I don't know if EA is either unwilling (Because of the loss of revenue) or unable (Because a better ant-cheat will cost them $) to fix this, and now there has been a security issue with the game. Just SAD this game with so much potential has gotten to the state it's currently in.

I can say for sure that this is definitely one of my favorite battle royale games by far, in the top 3 for sure. This game was just perfect in every possible way, honestly speaking I don't even know what they could've made better. The guns, the movement, the map, the new stuff they add, just everything about Apex Legends was so good. The first time I played it was on the exact release date (Feb 4, 2019) on my PS4, and I played it with my cousin. We decided to play in groups of three so we could get some help to win since we were new to the game. Surprisingly, our first game matched us with someone who was already pretty good at the game, even though it was the first day it was ever launched. He totally carried us to victory, no joke. Me and my cousin only got like 1 kill each, and we ended up winning our first game on the first release day, which is still crazy to me. I'm grateful I got to play most of the seasons, especially the OG ones. I loved it a lot, including the Hemlock, which is one of my favorite guns in the whole game. Honestly, I can't complain except for the fact that your account isn't the same on PS4 or PS5 or any other platform you play on. I played on PS4 for a long time and had so many cool skins, battle pass stuff, and gun wraps. My account was fully maxed out until I switched to PC. Even though I used the same EA account, it took me to a new account on PC. It basically had nothing on it, like starting over again. It got me really annoyed and frustrated, but I managed to grind a bit more and almost maxed it out again. I really wish I could play this game more. Also, I don't like that there isn't a solo mode. I kinda get why, but sometimes playing with random people can be really annoying. But again, I can't complain because most games aren't as good as Apex Legends. I honestly recommend anyone to play this game, though I suggest playing it with a friend or family member, just anyone you can talk to. Overall, it's a great game and definitely beats most shooter games like Fortnite, Warzone, PUBG, and the rest. This is just my opinion and if you disagree, that's okay. I hope you find this review useful!

Game: Good

hate it

lets get the good stuff about the game out the way since there's not as much to say

firstly the high fps this game can achieve while looking as nice as it does is impressive yes i often notice the render distances going from blurry to detailed but it doesn't diminish the visuals to much

second the unique design and mechanics in the game is also impressive

third the balance of a weapons power in the game has always been pretty good

now the bad stuff

firstly ive never been very impressed with the servers ping and latency in general has always felt higher then it should be take rainbow six siege for a example very similar server locations yet much better latency even if a player in the uk went on to us server in r6 it would be smoother than doing the same on apex

second audio is often very unreliable sometimes there's a enemy right next to you and you hear nothing other times they can be 100+ meters away and sound like there right next to you

third the biggest issue is the rank system which to be fair to apex is often awful in any shooter game this season in particular has made it very hard to rank up since you get more points the more kills you get and get very little points for the placement your team gets you might be thinking skill issue but getting kills can be greatly effected by the team you get which leads us to the other problem of the rank system i can honestly say about 80% of all the randoms i get look like they haven't played a game in there life before they are often selfish stupid and unaware of the games environment im not a pro at the game and yet these randomers are worse they play the game like it call of duty most of the time then run off after a squad without looting properly at the start of a game die then complain i honestly see no difference in the skill between silver randoms vs plat randoms if i got matched with randoms with my skill level id be plat 1 or 2 instead im bouncing between gold and plat 3 also its much harder to get kills in apex over damage which by the way you get no extra points for same thing with assists this forces randoms to play for themselves rather than in a team im not saying they should revert back to old ranked where you'd get points just for placement but i think it needs to be balanced out more so you feel rewarded for damage assists and high placement games

Tiramisu recipe
Yield:
6 to 8 servings
FOR THE CREAM
4 large egg yolks
¬Ωcup/100 grams granulated sugar, divided
¬æcup heavy cream
1cup/227 grams mascarpone (8 ounces)
FOR THE ASSEMBLY
1¬æcups good espresso or very strong coffee
2tablespoons rum or cognac
2tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder
About 24 ladyfingers (from one 7-ounce/200-gram package)
1 to 2ounces bittersweet chocolate, for shaving (optional)


Done correctly, a classic tiramis√π can be transcendent. A creamy dessert of espresso-soaked ladyfingers surrounded by lightly sweetened whipped cream and a rich mascarpone, tiramis√π relies heavily on the quality of its ingredients. If you don‚Äôt have a barista setup at home, pick up the espresso at a local coffee shop, or use strongly brewed coffee. As for the ladyfingers, make your own or buy them, but keep in mind that store-bought varieties can range from soft and spongy (like angel food cake) to hard and crunchy (like biscotti). Both kinds will work here, but if you're using the softer variety, stick to a light brushing of espresso, instead of a deep dip.

Apex Legends Anti-Cheat and the Specter of Compromised Systems

As a seasoned player deeply invested in the vibrant world of Apex Legends, it pains me to relay an unsavory truth: the purported safeguard of fair play, the anti-cheat system, is more akin to a sieve in a storm. Allow me to elaborate on this disconcerting matter.

One cannot deny the veritable epidemic of cheaters tarnishing the competitive landscape of Apex Legends. Whether it's through aimbots, wallhacks, or other nefarious means, the sanctity of fair play is continuously compromised. In response, Respawn Entertainment, in their infinite wisdom, introduced an anti-cheat system purportedly designed to safeguard the integrity of the game. Yet, what we've been served is nothing short of a bitter concoction of false promises and shattered trust.

Enter the ghastly specter of remote code execution. It's a nightmare scenario straight out of a cyberpunk dystopia, yet here we are, grappling with its grim reality within the confines of our gaming sanctuaries. Reports have surfaced, detailing how the very anti-cheat mechanism intended to shield us from the blight of cheating has become a gateway for malevolent entities to infiltrate our systems with impunity. This, dear readers, is not a cautionary tale; it's an ongoing saga of negligence and ineptitude.

One is left to ponder: how did we arrive at this sorry state of affairs? Was it an oversight, a glaring gap in the fortress walls overlooked by those tasked with our protection? Or was it a manifestation of hubris, a misguided belief that our systems were impervious to the machinations of the malicious? Whichever the case may be, the end result remains unchanged: a community left disillusioned, vulnerable, and frankly, incensed.

In the realm of online gaming, trust is a currency more valuable than any in-game loot or accolade. And yet, Respawn Entertainment's handling of the anti-cheat debacle has squandered this precious commodity with reckless abandon. Players no longer feel secure within the confines of their digital domains, haunted by the specter of compromised systems and the omnipresent threat of exploitation.

To Respawn Entertainment, I extend a challenge: rise to the occasion, reclaim the trust you've squandered, and fortify the defenses of Apex Legends against the scourge of cheating and remote code execution. Until then, the disillusioned masses shall continue to lament the sorry state of affairs, reminiscing about a time when the battlefield was fair and the playing field level.

I love Apex Legends. Here's my review on it:

Pros:
1. The Legends in this game are precious. Each has a backstory, motivation, and unique personality. And their abilities reflect themselves. They aren't isolated; there are lore pieces released by Respawn that keeps me engaged and invested in the characters.
2. Respawn creative ideas and Titanfall's legacy: The game's movement system is very fluid and opens creativity from players. The ping system allows for quick and easy communication without needing a microphone, which can be helpful for those playing with random teammates. And the armor swap and a lot of other features from this game are just great.
3. The game is complex and trains your brain in a lot of way. The character abilities themselves add a layer of complexity, unlike other BR games. There are a lot of variables happening in this game and pushes you to make decisions quickly. Armor swaps, third parties, the ring closing, positioning, reviving your teammates, knockdown shields, survival kits, drop ships, respawn beacons, legends' ultimates and abilities... It's a fun game for your brain!


Cons:
1. Not beginner friendly. There's little room for error, and fights can turn on a dime. This is especially punishing for new players.
2. Not solo queue friendly. This game is heavily focused on teamwork and randoms will ruin your mood a lot.
3. Servers suck. You use a high end ISP and LAN connection? It won't do anything against EA's low quality servers that would give you constant high ping and high packet loss. Even pro players and streamers still get this problem. But I don't blame them that much. Apex DOES need higher level of servers than other game. Too bad EA is an indie company.
4. Bad anti-cheat. Bots and cheaters are not uncommon to find.

Getting into servers with high ping and packet loss on a regular basis this season(Season 20 when this was written).

The game was hit with a wave of hackers/exploits years ago and is still suffering ever since. Now and then you'll see a message saying a player has been banned for hacking mid-game, but more often than not, you will be shot down by a L-Star user from halfway across the map while fighting two people from two different teams. No, that wasn't a "third-party" that was clearly some guy using an exploit.

The fact that a hacker has managed to derail a competitive event speaks volumes about the amount of resources EA has been putting into cyber security the community speaking up about this for years. EAC(Easy Anti-Cheat) has made it clear in a tweet that this is not a fault on their side but it a client issue.

This game made the Battle-Royale genre enjoyable for me and it would be sad to watch it die to negligence. Now is not a good time to start playing the game as it will be hard for a new player to tell the difference between a legit skilled player vs a hacker. The game is tough as it is and can be demoralising when you're starting out, even more so when you lose to a cheater. EA has refused to publicly address the ALGS hacking issue and I doubt they will confirm it to be an RCE vulnerability in the client.

The base game is fine; the whole game experience not so much. To have fun with your own squad, a few hundred hours of gameplay id required before you stop getting rolled. To enjoy the game as a solo player, you'd need a few thousand hours. There are a lot of suspicious players, but you can't really tell if they're cheating since there's no killcam (in normal trios). There will be a lot of times you'll think you died to a really good player and it was actually a cheater, and vice versa. Recently, there's been a RCE(Remote Control Exploit) going around where hackers are able to gain access to your PC and possibly install malware. Until this issue is resolved, I DO NOT suggest playing this game.

It has become so rampant across console and PC - from the 3rd party attachments to scripting to no recoil to wallhack to aimbots. I fully expect that in every high level pub or ranked match I will come across several cheaters. That's every single time I play the game and in every match there is an expectation of cheating. As some one who has played this game extensively since its release on console and now on PC. With the recent news that hackers can directly access your programs on your PC or download their own I cannot recommend this game until the issue is fixed. This has huge safety concerns. Thankfully it was found by a hacker whose only interest was to mess with the ALGS games but you can bet others will come if this is not patched. If you are not sure what I am talking about see The Gaming Merchants Video on Youtube "Breaking News: Apex Legends got Hacked" He does a great job of describing the event and possible security risks.
For me I will be uninstall the game and waiting for further updates Its not worth the risk of your personal information or someone locking up your PC. I hope to see this fixed soon.

I'm done with games and their bogus anticheat root BS.

So, this game right now has several problems and I do really enjoy playing it, or at least I did until recently.

I'm going to adress the elephant in the room immediatly, the matchmaking. I have never seen a game with worse matchmaking before and I played my fair share of games with matchmaking issues. But Apex gets it to another level and Respawn/EA go ahead and say that its the best course for the game. For those unaware, Apex does not match people with equal ranks against each other, and anyone who says otherwise hasnt played this game enough. Everyone who has played this game has probably seen a full stack of Apex predators in their games before. I personally match into a full stack or at least 1 Apex Predator every session. For me in Pubs a lobby like that is an instant disconnect, Ranked i still try to get some points but eventually, unless really unlucky, they just outclass the entire lobby immediatly, and this is not coming from someone who just started playing, I hit master last season after a long and exhausting grind and even then me and my duo usually just avoid games where we know we are outclassed, I know for many this would be a case of bad sportsmanship or I should at least try, but so you have a comparison: Imagine playing soccer as someone who just joined a local team for you on a minor level, you have a tournament bracket of small regions of your home, and then manchester united or any other world class soccer team. I would love to say this is just a minority of games but sadly because of the matchmaking only prioretizing low queue times, High skill players can get matched into low level lobbies on many occassions, so essentially the top 1 % are currently dominating every pub match and ranked is not in a good state. I personally have also been matched into lobbies full of silvers where it felt like just farming kills, from a competetive standpoint it is depressing and from a casual gaming standpoint a major annoyance.

A small note on microtransactions: I know the prices are insane, and this game probably has almost as much audacity when it comes to selling skins than Overwatch 2, but it's F2P, so i refuse to argument against it because people can chosse to ignore the store and there are not many p2w items in the game except for a few skins with better ironsights.

I don't just want to roast the game though since I have enjoyed it for quite a lot, the gameplay feels really good, so does the gunplay, except Volt Ironsights, god I hate them but thats just a personal skill issue. No but honestly the character design, gunplay and gameplay feel really great and since the sandbox is changing constantly every season feels really refreshing, evo shields giving abilities was a change that got me back into the game for a while as well since it just seems like a really fun idea.

So while the game is really fun to play right now you are submitting yourself to a beating by the top players or streamers every 2nd round on high levels and on low levels you are getting farmed anyways because people are farming their 20 kill and damage badges because you can just go on a loss streak by disconnecting for 40 games in a row, get queued into silvers because the game doesnt really care and then steamroll them, get ur badges and after that win ur immediatly back into plat lobbies if not worse.

TLDR: The matchmaking is a major issue right now alongside some others I was too lazy to write about, game is fun but in current state cannot recommend it.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Not sure what the reviews on hackers are on about...played this game off and on for some time and it scratches an itch MOST FPS games can't, including COD, Valorant, Fortnite, etc. As far as I'm aware, I've never encountered any hackers, I'd argue that the ceiling in regards to skill is just that high that it makes exceptional player seem like they're hacking.

The pricing on most of the items are outrageous...but I've only spent $10 on the game and the game pass essentially pays for itself.

Wished they kept Arena though, that's the one aspect that I like about Valorant, choose you weapon queue up in a small team in a decently sized map and fight. The movement, predictability and repetitiveness of Valorant doesn't appeal to me.

Match Making for newbies could be better. I can see why new players can be turned off if you're dropped in a match with experienced players. Though as of recent, Match Making has seem to improved, this includes queuing by myself and queuing with my friends who have a KDR of less than .70

Apex Legends is a free-to-play hero shooter battle royale game developed by Respawn Entertainment and published by Electronic Arts. It features a unique blend of character abilities, fast-paced action, and strategic team play. Here's a breakdown of the game's pros and cons to help you decide if it's for you:

Pros:

Free-to-Play: Apex Legends is completely free to download and play, with optional cosmetic microtransactions.
Unique Legend Abilities: Choose from a growing roster of Legends, each with their own unique abilities that can influence the battlefield strategy.
Team-Oriented Gameplay: Work together with your two teammates to combine your abilities and strategize to win the match.
Fast-Paced Action: The movement system is fluid and the gunplay is satisfying, with a variety of weapons to choose from.
Regular Content Updates: The developers frequently add new Legends, weapons, maps, and gameplay modes to keep things fresh.
Cons:

Steep Learning Curve: Apex Legends can be difficult to master, especially for new players. The game requires good aim, map awareness, and teamwork.
Microtransactions: While the core gameplay is free, there are microtransactions for cosmetic items like character and weapon skins.
Can Be Frustrating: As with any battle royale game, there can be a lot of frustration when you die early.
Predatory Matchmaking: Some players complain that the matchmaking system can put you up against very skilled players, especially at lower levels.
Overall, Apex Legends is a great free-to-play hero shooter with a unique blend of strategy and action. If you're looking for a challenging and rewarding game to play with friends, then Apex Legends is definitely worth checking out.

This is my FAVORITE game. I absolutely love it. It is a fast paced fps that has the best movement of any game I know. There are 25 unique (looking at you Mirage) legends that make it so no mater how you like to play, you can have fun. There are supports, recons, assault, skirmisher, and area control legends. There are at least 4 unique legends in each of those 5 categories, so no mater how you want to play, Apex has it. There are a lot of guns that all are useful for different circumstances (accept the charge rifle, that's worthless all round), so if you like sniping, you can take an smg and sniper. if you want to strafe fast use pistols, if you never want to reload, use lmg. there are guns no matter what sub play style you like.

the game itself is a pretty unstable game, any more than 100 ping and you feel it. It crashes every now and then, but not with any frequency. In the high ranks there are cheaters, because it is a hard game. It is not for everyone, you do 50 battles and only win once. Because of its difficulty it is a sweaty game. The movement is fluid, and can take some getting used to. I personaly am free to play, and everything in the store is expensive either way. APEX IS NOT A PAY TO WIN GAME. the only things you can buy are cosmetics. It has great graphics, but you will never go many games without a little lag.

over all, i love it. it is free to play, has everyone's playstyle, and has good graphics. moment is superb, high ranks have cheaters, but for the most part its good. oh and if you are solo q-ing, be prepared for toxic teammates. it is about a 1/4 randoms are toxic.
I wouldn't recommend this game to my worst enemy.

as of Season 20
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Ws
-Removed steam configs for roller :)
-New content each season, hasn't been too dry
-Average wait to play is around a minute or so (unless you're high in ranked)
-Movement is very fun
-Gun goes BRRR (but r99 shoots blanks)
-Zaine's return to Apex
-Many modes that cycle every few minutes
-Group of guns that accommodate all play styles
-Could be starting to notice that we like cool free things (ie Reactive Flatline skin that u unlock with challenges)
-Voice Troll = Fun
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Ls
-Game can be hard to learn
-New players can be matched with higher skill players, (i think this is to reduce matchmaking times)
-Cheater problem has been going on for ages
-Controller and mnk beef
-Sometimes you get toxic teammates
-THE GAMES LAGGING (servers are poopee time to time)
-Ranked system is better than season 19 but kill cap is EW
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Idk what else to say, just try the game, play with friends and give it some time. Have fun beaming :)

At its core, Apex Legends emerged in 2019 in the crowded sea of battle royale titles, distinguished not just by its adherence to the genre's fundamentals but by its innovative strides in gameplay mechanics, and character diversity. But with its incredibly steep learning curve...

Who is Apex Legends for?







A lot of multiplayer games are very dependent on the tone set by the community.
This digital congregation is a melting pot of casual players, hardcore enthusiasts, and eSports professionals, mirroring the game's versatility. However, as with any online game, the community's diversity means players might occasionally encounter less-than-ideal teammates or competitive spirits that don't align with their own. And as per usual, the loudest part of the community is the type of "gamers" who hate the game but keep playing it. The guys will yell at you through their Dollar Tree microphone for mistakes they've made. But hey, this happens in any type of competitive game out there.

The game introduces fresh mechanics to the battle royale genre, such as a detailed ping system for communication and a revival feature that keeps the hope of becoming the Apex Champion alive even after a squad member has fallen. These innovations - copied by other BR games - make it accessible to newcomers and offer depth to seasoned players. However, these same features that enrich the gameplay also steepen the learning curve, particularly for those not familiar with hero-based or team-centric games. If you are new to the game, just be prepared to hear things like
Apex isn't a fast-paced FPS which puts a lot of people off, even when they are very skilled at other shooters. Newbies will feel like they get downed in a split second while they on the other hand virtually shoot peas at their enemies. But once you take a step back, learn from your mistakes, and improve your decision-making, spatial awareness, positioning, movement, and game sense over time, you will notice how smooth the game can be.
And if for some reason you just don't enjoy the Battle Royale game mode, you can also play Control, Gun Game, and Team Death Match.

As a free-to-play title, Apex Legends is continuously evolving, with regular updates that introduce new Legends, maps, and gameplay mechanics. This keeps the game fresh but also means players need to stay on their toes to adapt to the changing landscape. What I like is that you basically only have to buy the Battle Pass once and if you level it up, you get enough Apex Coins (microtransaction currency) to buy the next one.
And of course, you have the typical loop of people loving or hating any change or addition being made. There is a trend in streamers and content creators not touching grass, just being in a bad mood, hating on the game, and lots of people in the community copy & paste their opinions. Just like when Shroud said, "Valkery is the most stupid Champion ever because her HUD has a green tint when dropping in and he has zero visibility through it and he also can't tap strafe with her".
There's also constructive feedback out there and the devs actually try and listen to it but they'll never manage to please everyone. I recommend not to engage with that toxic part of the community. Find your own reasons that motivate you to play the game.

Apex Legends feels like it's made by people who love classic games like Quake. While it may not satisfy the solitary gamer or those seeking visual spectacle in every corner, it stands as a testament to Respawn Entertainment's vision of what a free-to-play, team-based shooter can be. Getting better as a player, improving strategy, and communication converge to create exhilarating moments of triumph. Yes, there are some RNG aspects to Apex but that's the nature of all major Battle Royale games.
I recommend it if you are ready for a very steep learning curve and for Wraith players to rage quit;
the classic Apex Legends experience!

As much as I want to like this game I just can't. I get stuck on the loading screen constantly and the game won't open. Every update something goes wrong with this game, losing all of my levels, progress and data, the list goes on. Wouldn't recommend for that reason, I'd like to add I have a very good gaming PC and still I have issues running this game almost every single time with current drivers (and yes I've updated Steam.) I never have any issues running any other games on my PC, it's only ever this one.

There is a feel to this game that no other game can come close to matching. The fluidity of the movement and mechanics to the gun-play and Legend abilites. There is nothing quite like it. Some games come close but none surpass it IMO. Not saying it is a perfect game, the audio cues need to be fixed and they need to prioritize the games health and not how much money can we make off of this skin or this collection event. Overall I would give Apex an 8/10. I've put about 2000 hours on it in the past 2 years between my accounts. If you stay consistent you will learn the guns maps and it will make you a better player. You will just enjoy it more in general.

Disappointed with the Current State of Apex Legends
As a long-time player of Apex Legends, I can't help but feel let down by the current state of the game. While it used to be a thrilling and enjoyable experience, it has now devolved into a frustrating mess of sweatiness and unbalanced matchmaking.

I'll be the first to admit that I'm not the greatest player out there, but I'd like to think that I'm at least competent. However, my recent experiences with the game have left me feeling utterly defeated. Every time I load it up, I'm greeted with a cycle of dropping in, dying almost immediately, and repeating the process ad nauseam. It's become increasingly difficult to even get a shot off, let alone secure a kill, when facing off against squads that seem to dominate the entire lobby effortlessly.

What's most disheartening is the apparent decline in the game's matchmaking system. Gone are the days when matches felt fair and evenly matched. Instead, I find myself pitted against opponents who vastly outmatch my skill level, making any hope of enjoyment quickly dissipate.

It pains me to see a game that I once cherished and spent countless hours playing now reduced to a shadow of its former self. While I have fond memories of Apex Legends from years past, the current state of the game leaves much to be desired. Unless significant improvements are made to address the issues of sweatiness and matchmaking imbalance, it's difficult to see myself returning to it with the same level of enthusiasm as before.

Forget about the game review here is easy and practical `WATER` recipe:

Ingredients:
-Water
-Bottle
-Spoon
-Tea spoon
-Pot
-Pan
-Ice

Directions

1-Get thirsty or not you can choose.
2-Take a glass.
3-Take a bottle carefully. This part is very important. There must be "Water" in it!!!
4-Carefully pour 100ml of water from the water-filled bottle into the glass.
5-Add half a tablespoon of water.
6-Stir for 5 min.
7-Take a pot and put 500 ml of water in it.
8-Meanwhile, set the oven temperature to 250 C.
9-Put the pot full of water into the oven.
10-Take a pan and add 100 grams of ice to the pan and wait for it to get hot.
11-Add the water from pan to water in the glass.
12-Add 1 teaspoon of water to the glass before the water in the oven evaporates completely.
13-Put the glass of water in the refrigerator and wait for it to cool.
14-Bon Appetit

they wiped my Xbox account, via "cross-progression" this being an account i have spent at least 100$ on and 100's of hour's. i have been playing since season 7 and i guess i this season will be my last. I hate EA, first they stop titan fall 3 now this

Just a very inferior BR right now, especially with every new season. From the drop, it is heavy rng since you always seem to get a gun attachment or a shield cell while the squad that drops near you gets a flatline and a mastiff. After that, you have to deal with a couple unbalanced characters like Fuze, whose utility allows him to damage you greatly over time no matter where you use for cover. Little to no counter-play and is abused often.

With ranked, the devs can't decide whether to make it skill based or reward ratters for ranked points. They flip flop every season and cater to the pros that whine every year.

For gunplay, it's not necessarily bad, but it is certainly inferior to Warzone. Not to mention, there is a reason controllers are so heavily used in this game. MnK will always get outclassed against a controller due to poorly balanced aim assist. PC/Console crossplay for competitive multiplayer games was a mistake.

It's movement mechanics were really its only redeeming quality. I don't call champions with different abilities a pro because like all other games that do this mechanic (like Overwatch and Valorant), they don't really make a game better but can certainly make one worse due to poor balancing. Back to the movement mechanics, it feels more sluggish compared to when I played some time ago.

All in all, the game is inferior on so many levels, and it just isn't worth playing.

Was a great game, unfortunately since all the whales are too busy spending money on their next shiny digital toys the devs are getting lazy with every event. Legend balancing is not great, with most of the newer ones being able to carry solely based on their overloaded kits. The grind to buy legends for free is egregious, after about 250 hours I've only unlocked maybe 3-4 legends for free. The cross save update took way too long to roll out and by the end of it I ended up losing credits (About 6-7k legend tokens, thats a couple hours of grinding just thrown away.)
Its a shame that Respawn is owned by EA, as the Titanfall universe would be better realized in maybe another kind of game, not a blatant cash grab battle royale. Also, recently Respawn did announce that they were working on a new game, but they straight up killed anyones hope by saying it was not Titanfall 3.

TL;DR, Formerly a decent battle royale that rode the hype of a successful IP, ruined said IP because of corporate greed.

Gameplay-wise, this is the best battle royal game out there, still. It offers the most intense experience u can get out of fps (it's like DOOM on nightmare but against people). When Apex Legends got released, it was a brutal boom, everyone was playing it, every streamer. All the other BRs instantly copied the new mechanics they brought like pinging items and areas. The whole pinging system got added to almost every mainstream shooter, not just other battle royal games.

The down side is the insane skill gap between players and the que. Since the player base began to get smaller after the biggest boom.. balancing went to hell. It got way better since the last 2 seasons, but it's still ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.

The skill cap here is basically requiers you to have ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• tons of macros for moves that those "movement gods" abuse. Moves that you wouldn't be able to do with the normal controls. Some techniques are little things which when mastered, make you a god. So yeah, to get to the top u need to work insanely hard and u basically need to cheat. This is the game for crazy people who want as many options as possible and who want to play on the edge where every 0,5sec matters.

No othergame has such intense gameplay when you actually master it a bit. I have 1,2k hours atm. here and 500 hours on origins and i'm still a complete trash compared to people who play this seriously.¬®

This is one of those games where u end up on reddit/ytb looking for guides and tips bc as u get to like the game more, the same goes for frustration. Every time u feel like u are better than majority and that u actually got somewhere, u get instantly massacered by some sweaty dude who can move like ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• Rock Lee from Naruto and then u realize u'll never get anywhere.

This is why majority of players left and now it's just a game where they release BRUTALY over priced skins which are mostly just re-colors. There are almost no cross overs, they managed to make a deal with Final Fantasy franchise and released an insanely expensive heirloom sword lately, to get it u must have spent a fortune (100 euro and more). Skins are 40euro+ ussually if u want a good one, it's just a total nonsense. This is bc the game is dying (mobile version of this game died bc it didnt make enough money to make it worth fixing all the bugs so they just canceled it, NO REFUNDS) and apparently this is the only way to make it work.

I'm still giving this a yes bc i'm a casual and generaly i suck at it, but when u manage to win a game and u actually get decent number of kills, it's satisfying like no other game.

Apex Legends, developed by Respawn Entertainment, has undoubtedly redefined the battle royale genre with its fast-paced action, strategic depth, and innovative gameplay mechanics. Set in the Titanfall universe, this free-to-play shooter pits teams of three players against each other in intense, squad-based combat, where skill, teamwork, and quick thinking are the keys to victory.

One of the standout features of Apex Legends is its diverse roster of Legends, each with their own unique abilities and playstyles. From the agile and elusive Wraith to the hulking and defensive Gibraltar, there's a Legend to suit every playstyle and strategy. The depth and variety offered by the Legends ensure that every match feels fresh and exciting, as players experiment with different team compositions and tactics.

The game's movement mechanics are another highlight, borrowing elements from Respawn's critically acclaimed Titanfall series. Running, sliding, and wall-running are all seamlessly integrated into the gameplay, allowing for fluid and dynamic movement across the map. Whether you're chasing down enemies or evading incoming fire, the movement mechanics in Apex Legends add a layer of skill and finesse that sets it apart from other battle royale games.

Combat in Apex Legends is fast-paced and satisfying, with a wide array of weapons and attachments to choose from. From assault rifles and shotguns to sniper rifles and grenade launchers, there's a weapon for every situation, and mastering the gunplay is essential for success in the game. The addition of unique hop-up attachments and weapon skins adds depth and customization to the experience, allowing players to personalize their loadouts and stand out on the battlefield.

The game's map design is also top-notch, with diverse environments ranging from sprawling urban areas to desolate wildernesses. Each location offers its own strategic advantages and challenges, encouraging players to adapt their tactics based on their surroundings. The addition of dynamic events such as supply drops and environmental hazards keeps matches unpredictable and ensures that no two games are ever the same.

While Apex Legends is undoubtedly one of the best battle royale games on the market, it's not without its flaws. Some players may find the learning curve to be steep, especially for newcomers to the genre, and the game's matchmaking system can occasionally lead to unbalanced matches. Additionally, while the game's cosmetic microtransactions are purely optional, some players may find the pricing to be a bit steep for certain items.

Overall, Apex Legends is a masterpiece of multiplayer gaming that sets a new standard for the battle royale genre. With its diverse roster of Legends, fluid movement mechanics, and exhilarating combat, it's a must-play for fans of competitive shooters and newcomers alike. So gather your squad, jump into the arena, and experience the thrill of Apex Legends for yourself.

Let me share my thoughts on Apex Legends, a game that I've really come to enjoy.

First off, the gameplay in Apex is incredibly engaging. It's fast-paced, action-packed, and always keeps you on your toes. Every match feels like a new adventure, and the variety of characters, each with their own unique abilities, adds an extra layer of strategy to the game.

One of the things I love most about Apex is the teamwork aspect. You're always working with your squad to outsmart and outgun your opponents. Whether you're reviving a teammate, coordinating your ultimate abilities, or just communicating your next move, the teamwork required in Apex makes every victory feel even sweeter.

The graphics and design of the game are also top-notch. The maps are beautifully crafted, with diverse environments that keep the gameplay fresh and exciting. And the attention to detail in the character designs and animations really helps bring the world of Apex to life.

Another aspect of Apex that I appreciate is the constant updates and new content. The developers are always adding new features, weapons, and characters to keep the game feeling fresh and evolving.

Overall, Apex Legends is a fantastic game that I would highly recommend to anyone who enjoys fast-paced, team-based shooters. With its engaging gameplay, stunning graphics, and constant updates, it's definitely one of my favorite games to play.

This game is terrible. It is extremely toxic and full of cheaters. It is also very addicting and hard to stop playing. Try your hardest not to install this game because you won't be able to stop playing and it will make you misirable.

If you don't have 1000 hours in the game already, don't bother. Most players understand the bullet drop enough to snipe you with a shotgun. But the worst aspect of this game is recognizing the guns, you cannot look at a gun and guess what it does, you will start every fight floundering realizing that the smg you picked up is a burst or rifle you picked up has to heat up before it starts firing. Yes, you will learn it, but it takes 100s of games of smashing your head into a wall as you get deleted by sweats and spin bots before you feel comfortable looting, while still being smashed. Just play something else.

Okay so I've been playing this game since it first released, it's... quite the experience if you're a solo q'r like me. if you have friends that can play with you and they know how to have a good time. This Battle royale can be very fun. However I will say this. solo q'ing ranked can be a very awful experience but if you can find yourself a good team that's been playing the game for a longtime it can be fun and competitive, it's designed to be that way.

Don't listen to other peoples reviews saying "You have to make this game a second job in order to be good at it" that's absolute BS. If you have the time practice in the firing range. The range is a fun experience on it's own because you get to learn movement mechanics, weapons and legend abilities. Take your time and you'll slowly excel at getting better but it takes time. Also practice in the mixtape gamemodes, that's why they're there. To help people practice with certain weapons and Legends. Once you learn everything it can be a fun experience. Try every legend you can. Trust me you'll find the legend that works for you but do NOT be stuck playing a legend for too long it can get boring. switch it up every once in a while it helps to keep the game fresh.

The only thing I'm iffy about on this game is that there isn't enough gamemode variety. They bring in a limited time mode about 3-4 times a season and most of the time they are very fun to play but they are there for a limited time which sucks but at the end of the day this game is designed to be a battle royale. If you find yourself liking a limited time mode too much and then uninstalling the game after it leaves. This isn't the game for you.

Quick tips to make your experience a little better. Stick very close to your teammates, they will appreciate this a lot. Do NOT push a team by yourself. 9 times out of 10 you will die. no matter how good you think you are at the game. There's no stopping 3 dudes shooting you at once unless you coordinate an attack with your team. And push EVO harvesters as soon as they spawn, this will get your armor more EVO points, and the more EVO harvesters you push, the more points you get, and the more points you get, the more upgrade perks you will unlock for your legend you're currently playing

If you've played nothing but fast TTK shooters like Call Of Duty. You need to change your mindset. This is not Call Of Duty. the TTK is longest I've seen it in any shooter. You need to unload an entire magazine to kill someone in late game. But like I said before the game is meant to be played this way. If you're willing to change and practice for this game. It will reward you. Then you'll come to find out that this is the best Battle royale currently on Steam.

Good luck, have fun, and most importantly, get those wins Legends.

Apex legends is a game that you will hate, depending on the map you either always get third partied/ or even fourth partied. Or at most see 3 teams the total game, Or you're still on lvl 1 shield while the last team you meet is red shield. That is if you don't hot drop, if you do hot drop you have to be lucky enough to land on a weapon, ammo, anything that could help you survive the onslaught of punching from enemies that land with you. Even then you have to fight multiple teams just to run out of ammo and get third partied. You tell yourself that this game is the goat but that's only when you either get close to winning or winning after spending at most an 1hr of getting unlucky with drops, unlucky on hot drops, or the other person is just better. Once you win a game after spending a lot of time to just win once, you have to do it all over again just to be lucky enough to make it to be champion.

Now if you solo drop with randoms then you just gotta be lucky enough they're using sound, or even use their abilities. A lot of the time your randoms will just leave the game as soon as they get knocked, those who stay know that we need them because that is what makes a team, those who look out for each other and want to finish the game.

This might be one of the best battle royale games on the market right now, so why the negative review? Well, I genuinely cannot think of a worse game for a new player to jump into. The game has been out for 5 years, and the skill ceiling has shot into space. It is way too hard to learn how to play the game, since it is not only a difficult game to do well in, but the matchmaking also sucks and you're going to get dominated by an extremely sweaty player nearly every match.

I would consider myself to be a slightly above average player. Ive played the game since launch with a few long breaks here and there. I love the game, but it is an absolutely MISERABLE experience without friends. One good match is just not worth the torrent of bad matches ended by the same top 1,000 players using the same legends with the same guns with the same insane movement. It is completely impossible to enjoy this game casually.

All that aside, the game has abysmal monetization (20$-200$ skins), 20hz servers (the standard is 60), overpowered aim assist on controllers, a cheater infestation, and a slew of bugs every update. So if you're the type of guy who wants to play games to relax, stay as far away as possible from this game.

Im sure this game is a lot of fun to chill and play with friends have a fun battle royal experience but im not able to play thanks to EA. Making a new EA account is a cumbersome process, in my case specifically i had to download a vpn to create an account, when you go to select your region mine was locked in south korea which is not where i am and i tried to change it to my country and it would not allow me to change it. the issue with south korea is that it requires a korea phone number so i couldn't even lie if i wanted to. so after i downloaded a vpn i was able to set up my account using an email address, as you would expect, and it worked i made an account and was ready to play. I opened the game and clicked on the sign in option and my steam just gives me an error and tells me to reset my password even though i never entered a password or email address or username. i don't really know who to blame for this or maybe im doing something wrong but i just feel like when you put a game on steam you should allow steam to manage the account side of things, you shouldnt have to make a seperate account and then make the process for said account a terrible one. i just want to play games and have fun but nowadays that seems less and less plausible. giant companies don't care if youre having fun anymore they don't care about your time playing the game they just want money and its sad. i wish gaming was still fun, and don't get me wrong some companies are doing it right and they do care but i remember a time when almost all of the video game producers cared, games were fun, the focus was on the player rather than the investors and making money. I understand that the point of a business is to make money but both parties can be happy, create good quality games and the money will flow in quickly. like i said before im sure this game is great so if you want to play it play it but these are my thoughts on everything.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

This game is the definition of Overstaying your welcome, this game used to be great...up until season 10. All I see in this game today is Re-used things with a mediocre "New Twist" and its upsetting. Cool events with special modes have been reduced to just Re-skins that cost more money with game modes that just keep getting used again. They deliver updates very slowly some PATCHES taking months to come and also make it difficult to earn XP some quests even taking specific characters to complete. Characters in which new players don't have, so they have 2 options spend money or play the game modes that are either forgotten about for months or just used to much. They have been running out of Ideas to the point they don't even introduce new legends or guns. They ignore the community so much that things that have been asked for come YEARS later. They should have quit updating the game and added every mode made (Besides the holiday specials) to a rotation and added the holiday modes when that holiday is happening and worked on newer projects like I don't maybe TITANFALL 3 that they have been teasing us with at this point. Saying that its happening then saying its not and so on so forth. I know I sound like a picky person and I won't deny it but its sad to see such a good project get stale due to the fact it's being milked to the bone.

GPT:
Climbing the ranks in Apex Legends requires a combination of skill, strategy, and persistence. Here are some tips to help you ascend to the Predator rank:

Understand the Ranking System: Know how the point system works for your specific rank. Kills, assists, and placement contribute to your points in a match. Familiarize yourself with the point deductions for starting a match in your rank to strategize effectively.

Master a Few Legends: Become highly skilled with a few characters to adapt to different team compositions and strategies. Knowing the ins and outs of your chosen legends‚Äô abilities can be the difference in critical moments.

Improve Game Mechanics: Work on your shooting accuracy, movement, and positioning. Apex Legends is fast-paced, so being able to move and shoot effectively is crucial. Utilize the training area to practice.

Teamwork and Communication: Apex is a team game. Communicate with your squad, whether it's through pings or voice chat. Sharing enemy locations, coordinating attacks, or calling out resources can significantly increase your chances of winning.

Strategic Play: Sometimes, engaging in every fight isn‚Äôt the best strategy. Know when to fight and when to avoid conflict to survive longer and secure higher placements in matches.

Analyze and Learn: After each game, take a moment to reflect on what went well and what could be improved. Watch replays or streams of higher-ranked players to learn different tactics and strategies.

Stay Consistent: Progress in ranking up is about consistency. Play regularly and try to maintain a steady performance. Avoid tilt by taking breaks if you're on a losing streak.

Squad Up: Whenever possible, play with friends or players you synergize well with. A coordinated team has a better chance of outplaying random squads, especially in higher ranks.

By focusing on these areas, you‚Äôll improve your gameplay and increase your chances of climbing the ranks in Apex Legends. Remember, progress takes time, so be patient and enjoy the journey.

With a combined playtime rivaling my cat's nap schedule, Apex Legends has become my digital playground of choice. But let's talk about the real stars of the show: the female legends. They're not just badass fighters; they're total stunners. From Wraith's mysterious allure to Lifeline's stylish flair, these ladies are as deadly as they are easy on the eyes.

And the gameplay? It's like a choreographed dance of destruction. Sliding, jumping, ziplining‚Äîit's a symphony of movement that keeps me on the edge of my seat. And don't even get me started on the ping system. It's like having a psychic connection with my squadmates, only cuter.

Visually, Apex Legends is a treat. The vibrant environments and detailed character designs make every match feel like a work of art. Sure, there are a few bugs here and there, but when you're fighting alongside a squad of fierce females, who cares? In conclusion, Apex Legends is a battle royale masterpiece that's as easy on the eyes as it is thrilling to play. So grab your squad, channel your inner goddess, and let's dominate the battlefield together.
