I had 245 hours in this game through the EA launcher and now 45 more on steam, so after ~300 hours I think it's safe to say I think Apex Legends is a pretty good game. Stay away if you're tempted by microtransactions, though, as their pricing is pretty absurd on some things.

This game has unparalleled gunplay, movement, and legends. It's a pioneer in its space, and has extremely skilled players. It's also ridiculously grindy, extremely overpriced, and feels like a chore to play. I haven't been playing on steam long but I have around 2000 hours across the platforms. Most decisions the developers make alienate the playerbase in the interest of profits, there is hardly any communication between them and the players, and it shows. Entire events full of recolored skins for their full price ($20 a piece!!), overpriced cosmetics, the worst ranked system of any game I've played, and a community with a toxically "git gud" mentality, striving for wins above all else because they're so few and far between for most players. Only the top players seem to have a good experience, as the matchmaking is heavily catered to the people who play 8-10 hours a day. Lobbies are filled with players better than you, to the point where you can't compete and thus can't improve without devoting massive amounts of time, energy and effort. I feel this game has been circling the drain since arenas was removed and it's very disheartening. It could've been great if it had a little more attention to gameplay than to profit.


TL;DR Very fun game, if you buy nothing and devote your life to playing it.

Apex Legends isn't just another battle royale game; it's a masterful blend of heart-pounding action, strategic gameplay, and compelling storytelling that sets it apart from the competition.

From the moment you drop into the vibrant and meticulously crafted world of Apex Legends, you're greeted with an adrenaline-fueled experience like no other. The first thing that strikes you is the diverse cast of characters, each with their own unique abilities and personalities. Whether you're a seasoned player or a newcomer to the genre, there's a Legend that suits your playstyle, offering a sense of inclusivity and diversity that is truly refreshing.

What truly sets Apex Legends apart, however, is its emphasis on teamwork and collaboration. Unlike other battle royale games where solo play dominates, Apex Legends encourages communication and coordination among teammates. The game's innovative ping system allows players to effectively communicate with their squadmates, even without uttering a single word. Whether you're marking enemy positions, suggesting loot locations, or simply expressing gratitude for a well-executed play, the ping system fosters a sense of camaraderie that is unparalleled in the genre.

But it's not just about teamwork; Apex Legends delivers in terms of gameplay mechanics as well. The gunplay is smooth and satisfying, with a wide array of weapons and attachments to suit every playstyle. Whether you prefer close-quarters combat with shotguns and SMGs or long-range engagements with sniper rifles, Apex Legends offers a diverse arsenal that keeps each match feeling fresh and exciting.

Moreover, the game's map design is nothing short of spectacular. From the sprawling landscapes of Kings Canyon to the futuristic cityscapes of Olympus, each map is intricately designed to encourage dynamic gameplay and strategic decision-making. Whether you're navigating treacherous terrain or engaging in intense firefights in urban environments, every match presents new challenges and opportunities for exploration.

Beyond its addictive gameplay, Apex Legends also excels in its storytelling and world-building. Through a series of cinematic trailers, in-game events, and character interactions, Respawn Entertainment has crafted a rich and immersive universe filled with lore and intrigue. From the enigmatic motivations of the mysterious Syndicate to the personal histories of each Legend, there's always something new to discover in the world of Apex Legends.

In conclusion, Apex Legends stands as a testament to the power of innovation and creativity in the gaming industry. With its dynamic gameplay, emphasis on teamwork, and rich storytelling, it's no wonder that millions of players around the world have been captivated by its charm. Whether you're a casual gamer looking for a thrilling experience or a competitive player seeking the ultimate challenge, Apex Legends offers something for everyone. Strap in, drop down, and prepare for the fight of your life ‚Äì the Apex Games await.

Honestly this game has had a lot of issues. If you want to enjoy a game where players do nothing but camp and steal glory for the win then this is definitely the game for you. Furthermore, the lag of the servers are way passed playable where you will be punching the enemy one second and by the time you are about to down them you will randomly go down due to the lag. The lobbies are full of hackers as well and nothing is being done nothing to fix this issue. The champions and guns are not balanced at all, no matter how you train with them you will always need luck on your side in order to hit anyone. If you have loss packets then good luck your accuracy will mean nothing as the bullets will not count the damage when you hit an enemy. As the the Champions nothing is being done to make them fair enough in a 1v1 situation certain Champs will always win in a fight so the lobbies will be full of the players doing nothing but spamming the broken abilities. Lastly the guns that you get when you drop will not have its bullets next to is 60% of the time so good luck in trying to win a fight where you have empty guns to shoot. So before you want to invest your money into this game just know that this is what you will face, which honestly is not worth your hard earned money. So do not download and play this game.

This is easily the best season Apex has had since I've gotten the game, but critiques that have been long standing are still relevant even today. The events are mostly centred around spending money for cosmetics (most collection events are this with no gameplay changes or special modes) and the ones that are greater than that are few and far between, making for large content droughts. If this trend stops, I think that Apex could easily become one of the greatest live service games of all time, but as of right now I can't recommend getting into the game in good faith

Self-explanatory

Graphics and Visuals:
Right off the bat, you can‚Äôt miss Apex Legends' stunning graphics and visual style. The game boasts detailed character models, vibrant environments, and smooth animations that really bring its world to life. Whether you‚Äôre exploring the dense forests of Kings Canyon or the futuristic cityscapes of Olympus, each map is beautifully designed and packed with detail.

Gameplay:
At its core, Apex Legends is all about squad-based battle royale, where teams of three duke it out to be the last squad standing. What sets Apex apart is its focus on teamwork and its diverse cast of Legends, each with their own unique abilities and playstyles. Whether you‚Äôre into the speed of Octane and Pathfinder or the strategy of Gibraltar and Wattson, there's a Legend that fits your style.

The gunplay is smooth and responsive, with a wide range of weapons to choose from, each with its own pros and cons. The game also features a clever ping system that lets you communicate with your team without needing to chat, making it easier to coordinate strategies and share info.

Progression and Customization:
Apex Legends has a solid progression system that lets you level up your account and earn rewards like Apex Packs, which contain cosmetic items such as weapon skins and character outfits. There‚Äôs also a Battle Pass that unlocks more rewards as you complete challenges and earn XP.

When it comes to customization, Apex Legends offers a ton of cosmetic items to personalize your favorite Legends. From weapon skins and character outfits to banner poses and quips, there‚Äôs no shortage of ways to make your Legend stand out.

Community and Support:
One of the best things about Apex Legends is its dedicated community of players, who are always ready to help newbies get the hang of things. The developers at Respawn Entertainment also deserve a shoutout for their commitment to the game, with regular updates and new content like Legends, maps, and modes.

Conclusion:
In a nutshell, Apex Legends is a standout in the battle royale genre, offering fast-paced action, team-based gameplay, and deep customization. With its stunning visuals, tight gameplay, and supportive community, Apex Legends is a must-play for battle royale fans and a prime example of what a free-to-play game can achieve.

Rating: 4.5/5

this game is a joke of an fps game and gaslights you into thinking your skillful however upon transfering your skills into other fps games you soon learn the techniques in apex only pertain to apex and you only really learn macro gameplay. the mechanics of apex are gimmicks due to how rewarding they are in this game yet non existent in other games. tap strafing for example. if you ever tried facehugging an enemy in another game your throwing but in apex just tap strafe mid gunfight once or twice to have higher return. so many gimmick mechanics. the game is unsatisfactory for long term players. audio in this game is antagonistic aswell. why is there so much ambience after every death? why is there big loud noises that obtrusively yell at your ears whenever you do something dopaminergic. ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• game. children like it because its simple minded asf. what a cash grab. waste of talent. why play apex when you can just play valorant. less cheaters, no ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• audio ambience trash, actual competitive integrity, non gimmick mechanics,mechanics directly transfer to other games including macro and the ranked system comparatively speaking is not so ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• at all. this review is bases. fact check everything i pointed out and you will find this to be true. every other review isnt as objective as this one.

Don't bother if you are going to be on mnk, i have thousands of hours on this game on mnk, no matter how much I practice my aim for YEARS, I get one clipped by a roller. I have played on MNK for idk since I was 11 and now I am 27... I switched to roller for the first time ever (well since the first xbox came out and stopped roller when xbox 360 came out) about two weeks ago and have been getting 10+ kills per match (not joking) vs my usual 2-3 on mnk because I can actually let aimbot do the work for me aka controller aim assist. People want to say i isn't broken... yeah I cannot achieve the same skill to this day on mnk. Sure mnk has a higher skill ceiling but majority of us in fights lets face it, we don't use neo-strafing unless we are octane which even then most fights are up close where controller has the upprehand. Mid and long range sure mnk has a slight advantage due to recoil control... to counter it you need a 3x or 2-4x or 6x for sniper and aimbot does the control. Vs on mnk you can hit people at a distance a bit easier even with a 1x.

All in all, use a roller if ur not looking to try to get flashy with movement, oh did i mention the roller guy just has to back up a little and he will be able to kill you in your neo strafe? Lets not forget how hard it is to shoot a neo strafer in general, if your aim is already bad on mnk, you will miss like a roller player (but you would miss more because you dont have the micro adjustments from aimbot)

I've been playing this game since day one, with a few breaks here and there. It's time for me to move on because I've reached my goals and there's nothing left for me to chase. But I cannot leave without reviewing my favorite battle royale game.

Apex Legends was, and still is, the best competitive battle royale game ever made. It offers a diverse selection of legends, weapons and maps, encouraging players to experiment with various tactics in order to achieve victory.

However, the solo queue experience is not very enjoyable. Playing with friends is highly recommended.

The weakest point of this game is its expensive shop. The only purchase I can recommend is the 10‚Ç¨ Battle Pass, as it has a decent amount of cool stuff and you get your money back. The downside is that it's very grindy.

Season 20 is one of the best season of apex and brought some much needed Quality of life improvements to the game. But the cheating is completely out of hand. Before you would see one here or there as is common with F2P battle royals. But now its literally every game or every other game you run into someone with them. I'm not bad by any means after 1400 hours (got about 300+ on origin from launch) so I know its not a "git good" kind of situation. Ive literally spectated cheaters play entire matches reporting them and the system does nothing.
Do your job Respawn. Stop selling trash basic skins for $20-30 and promising free heirlooms (after giving you $300 lul "free") and fix your anti cheat or at least show that you are trying to improve it. Then maybe i'll change my review. Only time will tell I guess.
